text:
Last year when my friends and I dined at here the food and service was excellent, this year it was completely different.
We had dinner at the Hash House a Go Go on Thursday April 25th. Our waiter was a male, one of the persons in our party of 3 ordered a coffee and the waiter brought her out a cold coffee of old coffee to our table and told us that a new batch would be ready in 8 minutes, a half hour later we needed to track him down and ask him for the coffee. When we ordered our food I asked if could get sauteed onions on my hamburger our waiter replied I could ask the chef but he will not do it, we were all thinking are you kidding us your chef will not Saute onions for a burger, sounds like this chef needs another job to us.  We then were anticipating hot biscuits delivered to the table like last year, instead we each got a cold, old and very hard biscuits, no butter etc. delivered to the table to accompany them. This restaurant does not seem to feel the need to care anymore. Our food arrived, it was fair at best, and we did not see our waiter until he delivered our check. We were very disappointed that he did not bother to check in with and see how are food was or take the dishes off the table. I was tempted to bus the table myself. Based on our service and the attitude of the chef we will not be back.

This was our first time at HHAGG. The service and food was great. The portions are large and the presentation was appealing. Restaurant appeared clean. Two can split an entree, especially if you cannot, or do not want to carry 1/2 your meal home with you. We will definately return.

Amazing food, amazing service, amazing atmosphere!! We were seated and greeted right away.  Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and had some great recommendations! I seriously don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.  The food is fresh, beautifully presented, and bonus,  GREAT price! If you're staying on Freemont, don't bother trying any other restaurant! If you're not staying on Freemont, roll your hungover butt to a cab and GET DOWN HERE!
My favorite go to place for breakfast. Portions are huge, can be shared among two to three people. Pancakes are awesome. Andy fried chicken is by far the best dish I've had there.

I'm really bummed to give this two stars.  I've been coming to this location since it opened.  I go once every couple of months, but I won't be returning.  It seems that the food quality declines every time I go.  Yesterday, my salad had a few brown, wilting leaves.  The biscuit was delicious, as usual, but they no longer keep the peach jam on the table.  I had to ask the server.  The server finally brought one little side of the jam, even though both my husband and I had a biscuit.  Overall, the service was slow, the food was meh, and I won't be going back.
When in Vegas this is the place to go or be for breakfast or brunch. Great food, huge portions, cool place to hang out. We go every year.

Went to this Hash House A GoGo back in February and it was the BEST!  We ordered the Chicken and Waffles and a Scramble and a side of fries and split it between 3 people and it was PLENTY!  Service was quick - even though they were training a brand new waitress!  Coffee was hot and fresh, fries were delish and the best thing of all were the fried leeks that were on the chicken!  Oh Lawd!  Cannot think of one thing that was a negative here.  Loved it so much we went to the Hash House A Go Go in Chicago this past month!  Looking forward to the Dallas location opening soon!  GOOOOOOOO - you will not regret this!!!

So far I've eaten at hash enough times to where I could be an expert on all things hash house. 

This particular spot has the same amazing food I know and love but the staff is a little less than good. 

Ordering is difficult. Be simple.....otherwise the heads may explode.
Like this place! Great food,huge portions and great customer service! If your really hungry this I the place to go!

What huge portions! I got the blueberry and pecan pancake which was honestly about 12 inches in diameter !! No joking !  And my girl had the bisquits and gravy, also a HUGE portion. Food is very good! A must go if you stay downtown.  And the prices are good as well

Wait way too long for mediocre food and moderate service to iffy service.  Not to mention LOUD.  I get that it's Vegas in a casino, but c'mon.  Too loud to even talk normally.  Not worth a special trip.

Absolutely delicious!  Fresh, home style cooking FTW! Ordered stuffed burger while my date ordered chicken & biscuits.  However, everything looked so great I couldnt keep my eyes of my neighbor's table.  Portions were outrageous.  Both dishes arrived hot & in a timely matter.  Service was great even though my date was extremely rude to the waitress (I would give the date 0 stars if I could).  Plates are about $15.00 each which is more than reasonable seeing that the portions would allow you to make three meals out of the one plate.  Not too fancy yet not as casual as fast food.  Would recommend as a group outing as everyone would find the menu & pricing acceptable.

The true LV experience! 

Please note... 1 pancake feeds 2-4 people easily. They are 14" pancakes. 

Great presentation of food and very reasonably priced for all that you get. 

I got the basic breakfast for ($8/9?) and could barley finish it. 

Must try this place out.

My husband and I arrived to hash house a go go at 815am on a Friday morning. So we were expecting a bit of a wait. Hostess gave us a pager and said it would be 30-45 minutes. Not a problem, I said and asked how far the range was and was told to stay on the main floor and not to leave the casino and it would work. After over an hour I returned to see how much longer our wait was going to be. Come to find out the hostess had forgotten about us and had skipped us. Not a problem l, you were busy, that's understandable. We get seated and I try to order orange juice, only to be informed that they're out of orange juice. How, on a busy Friday morning are you already out of orange juice? Oh well. We order our meals, a basic and apple cinnamon flapjack with whipped cream. Oh, now you're also out of sausage and bacon? Well that eliminates a good portion of your menu. After being seated for about 5 minutes 3 booths near us were seated. Yet somehow all 3 ordered orange juice and got it. Before my husband and I even got our drinks. After waiting for 45 minutes for our food to finally arrive, my potatoes are cold, my husbands pancakes have 4 paper thin slices of apples that are nearly blackened from being burned and there's no whipped cream. I try to ask for a side of hollandaise sauce since there is a section on the menu for eggs Benedict, but much to my surprise and chagrin I am informed that there is no hollandaise sauce in the restaurant. After we attempt to eat and decide it's not worth the hassle and ask for he check we still have to wait an additional 20 minutes for an incorrect check. Needless to say we were not impressed nor will we ever recommend this location which is a shame considering every other hash house a go go I have been to (multiple locations in Las Vegas and the Chicago location) I have never had such horrendous food not service

Everything about this place was wonderful we actually went for breakfast and dinner. For breakfast I ordered the chicken and waffles they were absolutely fabulous the chicken was seasoned perfectly and juicy. The waffle was nice as well as the fried onions on the dish. For dinner I ordered the chicken pot pie I couldn't finish this dish it was overflowing with chicken and potatoes. It was simply the best pot pie I've ever eaten. I highly recommend this place and I will definitely be back.

I wish I could get in the door to review the food but I do not like waiting and there is always a long wait. at least 30 minutes. 

One day though, I'll get my foot in the door. and the food better be good
Rude manager, her name is Kara. Report her!!! If she doesnt like to work with people why is she even working there.

I was kinda scared to try this place because of all the scathing reviews, but I was optimistic and thought maybe the brilliant reviews had some merit. Doh!
The food was ok and in ginagorous portion sizes. The appetiser portions are big enough for a decent dinner. The corned beef in the corned beef hash was really tasty, but what was with the watermelon and pineapple slices with corned beef, potatoes and eggs? The fried angel hair pasta that comes with every entree was just silly too...I don't know if it was just poorly executed...has anyone else ever seen sticks of fried angel hair pasta with dinner? The whole branch of rosemary as a garnish was weird too. 
The service was pretty good. That and the corned beef are saving the place from one star. 
Don't know if I'll go back...most likely not with so many better places for less money.

I'm not a fan of big chain restaurants, but due to all the people I know that were appalled that I had not tried this place, I thought I should at least get off my food snob horse and give this place a try.  I wasn't kicking and screaming going into this place, but I was a little annoyed that I was being forced to take a break from gambling, that is until the food came.  Three adults shared the legendary Man Vs Food favorite.  I was expecting a ton of mediocre food smothered in gravy.  When the plate arrived it sure looked like what I was expecting.  Literally, this thing is the size of a regulation size football, and not the controversial deflated Pat's size either, fully inflated.  I was however extremely surprised when I took my first bite.  Each layer/component of this behemoth is actually very well made and tasty in its own right.  I didn't understand the fried spaghetti sticking through, but that was about my only question about the dish.  Three adults + one serving = still had leftovers.

We had the opportunity of being served by Rochelle who explained menu portions and her personal favorites. We took her advice on the Sage Chicken & Waffles, as well as the chicken and hash chorizo! We were stuffed beyond measure. Thank you Rochelle for an enjoyable dining experience! If you stop by ask for Rochelle, she will take good care of you!
This place gives you huge portions.  A great spot for breakfast and lunch.  I posted a few pictures of the burgers.  Check out the pics and then stop by and try one.  It was delicious.

Meh.

This place specializes in huge portions of mediocre food. 

I will say, many many people rave about this place and seem to love it, so I'm definitely in the minority. But, I've eaten here multiple times now and walked away everytime thinking...meh.

Your love of this place probably depends on how you judge restaurants. If you like the the theme of huge portions at low prices, it's a fun place to try.

BUT, if you are a true foodie and you are looking for flavor, quality, or something that will make you lick your lips with satisfaction, this place just will not do the trick. Nothing here tastes bad, per se. But nothing tastes truly delicious or has you wanting to go back for more.

Overall, if you have a picky palate, try somewhere else. You'll just be disappointed in Hash House.
Dishes are huge so better to share with someone! We ate andy's sage benedict eggs (or something like this) and it was really good...Orange juice not that good though
come hungry! big meals! but prettty good deals...lol but yeah love coming here good tasty food

1.food very bad
2. Glass.. Dirty
3. No hostess for over 5 min. 
4. Waiter forgot what he was doing. 

Food... First attempt cold. 2nd attempt warmer for some of it. Salmon dried out... Old. Drink. Floaties... Yuck. This place just made my stomach curl. Table was sticky, food crusted to it. Never eating anywhere at these establishments.  Staff unprofessional, though they act liked i would expect from this kind of rat hole.

I've eaten at Hash House A Go Go on the strip & it was awesome but the one  downtown has the WORST service ever. Not busy but we waited 10 min for a hostess. Another wait to clean a table. Greeted by a lackadaisical waitress who was smacking gum. Took our drink order, brought us cold coffee & hot orange juice. A full 10 min later she takes our order.  We wait & wait, no warm up on my coffee offered. The MANAGER brings my husband's order & leaves. 10 minutes later my food has not arrived and my husband's is cold because he refuses to start eating without me, plus his order is wrong. Another 5 minutes, gum smacker shows up, says she will bring more coffee. Where's my food? She will check. More waiting, finally back with her gum a snacking and her attitude  ugly, says my food will be right out! I don't know when my order came because we left as did the couple across from us that was also waiting, watching & waiting some more.  We went across the street to Duprey's where we were greeted, seated, served and stuffed in 20 minutes. Great pancakes. Our waitress was a doll. Do not go go to Hash House A Go Go. Skip it & go to Duprey's.

Stopped by for lunch after a long Vegas night. 
Had a short wait to be seated; but that's expected in Vegas. 
Once seated we were attended to quickly. Our server was polite, helpful and professional. He made some recommendations on drinks and food. He warned us the portions are large, and he was right. When the food arrived it was hot and looked great. It tasted good, but it's nothing extremely special. It's essentially huge portions of diner food with a slight twist. Nothing to make a huge deal out of.  It is a place worth returning to though. 
Give it a shot for yourself.

This place is okay. Not anything spectacular, by any means. I've eaten here twice, once I had the mushroom cheeseburger and the second time, today, I had breakfast there. 

The Stuffed Cheeseburger: The first time I went there I had the stuffed mushroom and swiss burger and it was alright. From the name, I assumed the actual patty was stuffed with mushrooms and swiss but it was actually stuffed between two patties. The burger was huge and they cooked it well done, just like I asked for but it lacked seasoning. The patty desperately needed salt; it was very bland. The mushrooms were slightly salted, could've used more but were still actually really good. The condiments were perfect, the fries were good and the burger was HUGE. 

Breakfast: they offer a breakfast dish called The Basic which include two eggs cooked to your liking, sausage or bacon (two pieces of either, we picked pork sausage), potatoes (crispy or mashed), toast or biscuit and assorted fruit. I didn't really care about the fruit or the toast or biscuit so I just ordered sausage, two eggs, and potatoes a la carte. It was a couple of dollars more, but at least I didn't have to settle for something I didn't want. The eggs were pretty good, but I would've liked the white to be set a little bit more. The two sausages tasted good but they were very pale and almost looked undercooked. I should've asked them to cook them until they were dark. As for the crispy potatoes, I guess I kind of expected more of a hash brown/latke kind of fried but it wasn't, they were more like fried chunks and they were still very tasty, salted well and the portion size was good. My boyfriend ordered the basic, with two over easy eggs, wheat toast, mashed potatoes and sausage (he asked for them to be cooked well, almost burnt so it would be crispy). He liked it; his eggs were cooked perfectly, the sausage was delicious (I know because I tasted a bite of his; they were WAY better than mine which seemed barely cooked and not seared at all), he seemed to enjoy his toast but they completely forgot the fruit. He thought the mashed potatoes were alright but a little tough.

Overall, the food here wasn't bad. Breakfast was definitely better than lunch. Breakfast wasn't great for a place that specializes in breakfast. Compared to Denny's, it was like double the price for the same quality. I would return for breakfast but not for lunch, not for a burger at least. I'm sure there are MUCH better burgers around.

SO FUCKING GOOD! 

They have huge proportions, and delicious food! 

Had it for the first time while staying at the Plaza and was pleasantly surprised!

We had the salmon Benedict, bacon and mashed potato stuffed burger, chicken and waffles, and the bacon avocado burger, and they all were HUGE and SOOO tasty! 

Definitely a good drunk or hungover meal!
This place absolutely rules. I got the man vs food favorite and it was the breakfast of dreams

WOW!!!! Thia was by far the best place I had eaten during my week long stay in Las Vegas. Our server Roberto was spot on. Actually out of the whole week the best server we had our entire trip. Try the meatloaf sandwich xoxoxo amazing!!! The chicken and waffles by far one of the largest meals I have eaten.  But I got a box to take it home. It was just so good I couldn't leave it there to waste. One meal is enough to share. This hidden gem is a must try along with the Freemont Experience. Best day ever I must say!!

we tried this place and 4 out of the 7 people eating in our party got sick. 

The restaurant manager tried to claim that food poisoning only happens in 12 -24 hours. Which may be true for salmonella or e. coli, but can happen very fast for things like staph bacteria poisoning. Within 20 minutes, actually. 

The manager refused to believe us, refused to give us any satisfaction, and when we had to run off to vomit instead of continuing the conversation, yelled more useless facts about salmonella poisoning after us. I'd like to see his food safety certificate, I'm sure it's out of date.

Also, the service was deadly slow and the prices expensive. 

Awful, awful place. Avoid at all cost.

Great service, good food, nice atmosphere...the welcone and the wait staff at the downtown location from start to finish were welcoming and explained the menu and everything.  The food although it was good was way too big for one person, would definitely recommend sharing a plate.  The downsides aren't really huge downsides, your food comes out separately if you are in a huge party and it's A LOT!!!! Other than that would definitely go back :)
Huge portions!! On top of that, everything tasted great! A must go while in downtown Vegas and an empty stomach. Family loved it!

Did not disappoint!
(Several) Friends highly recommended HHAGG for the perfect hangover cure. After a late night out it was just the ticket to recovery. Funky fresh options and excellent service. Bloodies are on point at 20oz and you can keep the cup if you want.

Sage Fried Chicken anything for your fried hangover fix. Waffles, Bene or the country classic which is what I had with maple reduction (bomb!!!!) and mashed potatoes---HUGE!

For a lighter option the skillet with sun dried tomatoes, artichokes and spinach was lovely and definitely easier on the stomach but still ---HUGE!

Service was on point and helpful. Walked in at 10am on a Sunday and got a table for 2 immediately. I'm sure the locations on the strip would have longer wait times but the food came out quickly after we ordered it and we were back out within the hour. We ended up walking around for a bit and then went back to the hotel to nap :)

If you're thinking about it, DO IT. Even if you have to wait, it your perfect cheat meal to splurge on in Vegas (like we aren't splurging on everything else in sin city anyways, haha!)

We stopped to have breakfast between our second and third legs of Ragnar Las Vegas. We were tired and hungry. The waitress got our orders and brought out our food quickly. 
There was a guy 3 tables away playing with his chips from the casino. After about 10 minutes, we were able to figure out where the sound was coming from. As soon as we pointed it out to our waitress, she went and politely asked the guy to stop. Breakfast was great, service was even better. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

They were not joking, the servings are huge.  My waffle was enough to feed myself and my fiance. 

My husband is usually able to eat his full plate, but he only ate about half his meal.  Which was potatoes, eggs, bacon and a biscuit.

It was very good! And very decently priced, both our meals was a bit less than $25.
Nice place. Food was good and service was good. Outmeal was big portion but eggs white was little bit small for me. But overall it was nice experience.
Stacked!!!!  Go hungrier and more hungover than ever before.  Cheesecake Factory portions on steroids.  Yum

Ate at this restaurant because it was conveniently located in our hotel lobby. There was about a 20 minute wait for 3, which was fine. When we were seated we waited about 15 minutes before a server walked up to us and asked us if we had been helped. When we told her no she went to grab our server for us. When our server finally showed up she had a terrible attitude. She rudely took our order and walked away. When our food came out someone else brought it and filled up our drinks for us. She never came back until it was time to drop off the check. Terrible service on her part, but everyone else seemed okay. I had biscuits and gravy, just a side portion because their portions are huge, and my husband had a burger. The food was okay. Nothing stood out to us. Will probably choose somewhere else to eat next time. Not worth returning to.

Phenomenal, we went to the other one at the Linq and that one was just as good.  Got the meatloaf last time on the server's suggestion and got the Chicken Benedict? this time.  Will post a pic in a min.  It was almost or equal to the meatloaf.  Chicken was crispy, egg was perfect and biscuit was from scratch not to mention the mashed pot.  HUGE portions and not crazy expensive.  Got the chips and guac for $9 and was like how good could this be?  It was da bomb, it came with a hot red salsa that made the deal worth it fo sho.  Will be hitting up the one near me very soon.

Great corned beef hash !!  This is a lot of food to eat. Really good.  Service is a little slow. Don't asked for any changes on your order, the chef won't do it. I asked if they could change the cheese on my eggs from Swiss to cheddar and was told Chef wouldn't do it.  They will leave items off but won't change things. Food is good !!

THE. WORST. SERVICE. AND. SERVER. EVER!

IF YOU EXPECT TO PAY FOR GREAT FOOD PLUS SERVICE...  THIS LOCATION IS NOT THE ONE TO EAT AT!

I'll start off by saying the food is GREAT!  HOWEVER, the sole reason for the 1 star is for the service, or should I say the lack of service!  
Let me start by summarizing the volume of business that I witnessed, since one may be quick to assume that it was busy. 
-Upon arrival and walking to our table in the back of the restaurant, there were only a total of 4 tables sat up front and in our section, 2 more tables finishing up. 
-Once we were seated, it took our server over 10 minutes to greet us just for our drink orders.  
-Once we were ready to order, I bring it to our server's attention, and my exact words "my son is allergic to shellfish, can you please note that when putting in our order".  Instead of agreeing, our server, REBECCA, decides to ask numerous questions and give us a hard time about it!
-After I order is placed, we do not see Rebecca again, until after our food was delivered by members of management!
-It takes 45 minutes to get our food delivered to the table.  Our order: 2 chicken benny's, a ranchero benny, a regular breakfast platter, a chicken salad, and kid pancake combo.
-Not only did it take our food forever to come out, but our food was delivered in increments of every 5 minutes.  Whatever happened to serving an entire table all at once?!?! 
-I had to ask the manager serving our to look for our server so I can place an alcohol order.  He complies, instead of offering to take my order for me. Once I finally ordered my drink, I take notice that she IMMEDIATELY, NOT STEP TO THE BACK TO PUT MY DRINK ORDER, but IMMEDIATELY goes to a table next to us where her other co-workers are eating. IN THE CUSTOMER DINING AREA, and proceeds to EAT with them, instead of putting in my drink order first!  After five minutes of eating, Rebecca, our server, takes notice that I am looking at her, and she steps to the side, to which I believe to place my drink order, and then comes over to us stating "I'm still waiting on your drink order, I don't know what is taking so long", after I had witnessed her go straight to the "employee lunch table" first.  
-My wife asks for something very minimal- extra napkins...  Rebecca, our server, does not come back with napkins after 5 minutes.  Instead we had to get up and "interrupt" the other servers eating and ask for napkins.  
-My question is: since when do servers eat in the customer dining area as a group?  Every restaurant I've worked at or managed has a specific dining area for the employees!

TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE!!!

I apologize, but did I mention at least the food was good?  Too bad the service negates the quality of the food they serve.

The waiter said that the sun-dried tomato & artichoke hash was his favorite vegetarian hash, it also happened to be the only. It was bland and pretty much all of the ingredients were tasteless. After asking how the food was and walking off before I could answer, I spent ~20 minutes trying to flag him back down to get something else.
The replacement was an equally bland bacon-less version of the original benedict, which was doused in equally bland red pepper sauce, and had a mammoth (and dry) biscuit instead of an english muffin. The waiter happily took away my food when I said that I didn't like it much more than the first dish, but when the check came I was informed that 'his manager' had refused to let him take off two items from the check.
When I told him that it was 'okay' and that I'll just never come back, he smiled and said 'sure'.
$14 poorer and no less hungry, I left and plan, as I said, to never go back.

Horrible. .served eggs with the whites uncooked.
Sausage was nasty...for the price it should at least try to compete and serve decent food that is not raw! 
Told the girl at the front desk and she said "good" apparently she was not hearing what we said or just didn't  care...that explains it!  
Thumbs down a BIG one......horrible!
Can not recommend this place at all! Chewy potatoes, chewy bland pancake. Bland sausage, toast wasn't toasted. Ask three times for jam or jelly. Never got it. Go to Denny's, cheaper and 100% better!
The chefs at this joint are AMAZING! I had the portobello burger, it was the best I have ever had! A must try if you like mushrooms. The servers were nice and helpful. The food was worth every penny!

Went here Sunday. My wife had a ceasar salad with chicken. Our food came out in 5 minutes which we thought was almost too fast. 

Ended up in ER from food poisoning. Not a great way to end our trip.
Lots of food. One plate can be enough for 4 people.  Chicken & waffles were good with the exception of the chicken being a little under seasoned.

We visited HH while in Vegas because of the great reviews. We went on a Friday mid morning. The service was absolutely horrible. I had to ask another wait staff to find our designated waitress because we had waited for 10 minutes without seeing her to greet us our take a drink order. Then she disappeared again. The bartender brought us our drinks. Again, I had to ask another server to find our waitress so we could order food which took forever to arrive. (I think she didn't submit the order timely). The food was okay but lacked flavor. Everything seemed pretty bland, even the red pepper cream sauce lacked flavor. Not at all a pleasant dinning experience.

We ate here based on rave reviews. Although the portions were indeed huge, the flavors were  underwhelming. My husband had the portobello mushroom sandwich which was pretty flavorless. I had the salmon salad. The salmon was cooked nicely but the horseradish cream dressing tasted like sour cream. The service was slow and nearly every staff member including the manager walked by the dirty table across from us for nearly 30 minutes before it was finally cleaned. Disappointing.
They have hot tea! Says "bulk prepared" on the menu but then came with a great individual fresh tea bag and pot. Honey on the side, but can ask for milk if you need. Yummy!!

So I just may have had too high of hopes for this one, but Hash House A Go Go at the Plaza hotel in downtown LV was just okay.

We went in for brunch at around 10AM and there was no wait for 6 people. Our server was quick and answered all of our questions about the menu. Before we knew it our order was in and food was on the table. The huge plus about this place, besides the fast service, was the portions. You can easily share an entree between two people (and probably still have leftovers). Unfortunately the food did not wow me as I had hoped it would.

Hearing so much about the sage fried chicken and waffles I didn't even need to look at the menu to know what I wanted. Maybe the cook was having an off day or maybe this location was not the right one to try, but what arrived was less than noteworthy. The sage gave the chicken breading a unique flavor unfortunately once I cut into the chicken (which I believe was a boned thigh) all of the breading fell off the chicken making it a big skin, syrup, mess with flavorless chicken. The waffles had strips of actual bacon in them which would have been pretty awesome if the bacon was cooked a bit more.

Nothing really memorable here and no raves from our group.  Next time I'm in Vegas I might go back, to try something else at a different location.

Pros: Quick and helpful service, huge portions, decently priced.
Cons: The food.

Decided to have dinner here as we were staying at the Plaza. The fried chicken and waffles were absolutely delicious. Super crunchy but not greasy, waffles stuffed with bacon rashers. Very tasty,with fresh sage and rosemary.
Service was prompt and super friendly. Go in hungry or share- portions are huge!

If you want an extra large portion of OK food, go here.  Luckily, our server warned us to only order one breakfast to share.  We ordered the Fried Chicken Benedict.  The first few bites were great, but it was so big and took so long to get through that it ended up getting cold.  And it was not good after that.  Our server also told us that it's not good reheated.  So, we spent $13 on a meal that 2 people could only get half way through.

I had the Fried Chicken Benedict that was featured on Man V Food. I split this with my wife ( and we can put some food away!) and we had trouble finishing it. This dish was by far the best food I've had in a long time, with that said it gets a well deserved 5 star!

4 of us went for late breakfast as we heard such great things. Servers don't bring food, other support staff does that. We had 3 plates come to our table that didn't belong to us.  My husband's food never came, after asking our server about it, he checked on it. He unapologetically told us his plate was delivered to someone else. He reordered from kitchen, & it was again delivered to someone else. As the rest of us were finished eating, waiter said he would reorder again, we declined. He never got his food, he was not charged for his food. We never got an apology, no drink refills whole meal. Over all, very poor service. But, food we did get tasted great

This is my absolute favorite go to place in Downtown Las Vegas.  Very small and crowded place, but the food makes up for it.  My waiter Eric also the bartender was amazing.  He was warm and welcoming and making my drink exactly how i ordered it.  

If this was a larger place i would have made it 5 stars.

The food here is amazing and prices are moderate for Vegas!  Be warned - portions are huge.  I had the sage fried chicken sandwich, and it was delicious.  The fried chicken was tender and flavorful, and their milk toast is absolutely amazing.  The biscuits with honey butter they give as an appetizer were delicious as well.  I definitely recommend that two people share an entree, or maybe get several per table and dine family-style.

We went late at night and had absolutely no wait.  Service was decent, but the food alone is why I'm giving five stars.

So I always make it a point to go here when in Vegas. Today went to have a late breakfast. The restaurant was half full at best. I was told there was a 20 minute wait for my wife and I. When I asked why because there are so many empty tables. I was told that there are several parties coming in that had texted ahead. When I said I am a customer standing here. they replied sorry, they texted first so you will have to wait.  I won't be dining here again. Plenty of restaurants in Vegas to choose from

As a frequent visitor to Vegas, we decided to get off the strip and make this a Vegas Throwback weekend in Downtown. What a fun weekend that did not disappoint.   Breakfast at Hash House A Go Go is a must!  Grab a seat at the bar for the best servers around!  Then settle in for a a fresh breakfast experience.  The avocado and bacon scramble is delicious.  Served with a homemade biscuit that could compete against any southern kitchen biscuit, a side of crispy potatoes, and fresh fruit is served on a platter and plenty to share unless you have a giant's appetite.   Add a fresh Mint Mojito and you are off to another great day in downtown Vegas..
Good portions. Service ok. Food quality questionable. Still a new location so maybe they'll get better?  Sort of expensive.

Split the chicken and waffles with my wife and it was delicious and very filling. Didn't care for the bacon inside the waffles (Hey America, your bacon sucks!) but the chicken was cooked perfectly and very moist.

Good deal for $10 each and we couldn't finish it.

I wanted to love it here. I'd heard about it for ages. We tried the BLT Bloody Mary. I love the idea but the drink had a sweetness that (to me) comes from cheap tomato juice with corn syrup in it. One friend ordered the corned beef hash and it was out of this world. NO complaints there. Another friend and I split the Chicken and Waffles.  Large portions and no problems splitting.  (Hash and splitting is why I gave a 4, not a 3) When I eat C&W I like a combo of sweet and savory/salty. The chicken was tasty, but not really great fried chicken and the waffles had no sweetness as a contrast. We were underwhelmed. I would go again - and place a different order. Our service was quite good.

This review is based on a pick up order. Besides the long wait time (reason for 4 stars) while being transferred to the bar to place my order,  everything went well. The staff was friendly and efficient. The guy who took my order was patient with me and gave me suggestions. I was told the meal would be ready in 15 minutes and it took exactly that.  As I walked in my food was being brought out. Will definitely order from here again if he need arises.

Went here for a late breakfast after a hard night of Vegas style debauchery. I had their famous chicken fried chicken Benedict. And man it was amazing. I could drink the chipotle hollandaise sauce that smothered it. My buddy had the hair of the dog which comes with 8 slices of bacon and a 22oz can of Budweiser. Cool spot. We'll be back.

My family and visited this restaurant on Saturday and since this was our first time here,  we were really looking forward to a fantastic experience like we've had with all other restaurants we've visited these past few days. Especially after we've heard nothing but good things about this place. So you definitely will not leave there hungry, BUT if you get Donna Server #516 beware. Her customer service skills were very unprofessional from the minute we sat down. I watched and heard the waiter (had a ponytail) the next table over and he was very friendly and actually explained a little bit of the menu and even asked if they've been the before.  Didn't get any of that from Donna. Too many things to list regarding her poor costumer service,  but the worst one was when we were checking out. She brought us our receipt and didn't say one word if she was going to take our payment or if we pay up front. So we waited for her to come by, and we asked her if we she took our payment or do we pay up front? Her answer was "well I gave you the receipt, I'll take it". Just because she gave us the receipt, doesn't mean they take thr payment for you.   She walked away, so I put my card with the receipt.  She came back and to a table near by without checking on our take and walked away again.  So now we're waiting longer, so I started to get inpatient by this time. She went back to the same table and started to take their order, so I excused myself and let her know we were waiting for her. She replied "um I'm taking there order" so we proceeded to walk out to find the manager. As we were walking away she was making comments about me to her customers at the
 table. I got the managers attention told him what happened and he apologized. As I walked out of the restaurant and looked over at me laughing and waiving.  I felt that she was mocking me, so at this point I was very upset so I went and spoke with the manager again and he apologized again. IF I ever try this place again I will definitely make sure I don't sit at any of her tables.

Hash House A Go Go is a must visit restaurant in Vegas. It's located inside the Plaza Hotel. I ordered Hash House Fried Chicken Benedict (supposed to be for breakfast) that could feed me for the whole day. It pairs good with Hash House style Bloody Mary if you're a bloody Mary lover . My husband ordered his Pub Crawl (corned beef sandwich with fries) that was also a huge dish. The sandwich was so huge that he had to cut it up and ate it with knife and folk . Worth every single penny!!!

We went on a Monday afternoon, no wait to be seated and helped by our helpful server. The menu seems smaller there than on their website. He chose the sage chicken Benedict and I chose the pork tenderloin Benedict. We both chose the famous Blt Bloody Mary, it's served with dry toast and mayo and garnished with Blt. The glass' lip is lined with what tastes like imitation bacon. It was disappointing but aside from that the experience was pretty enjoyable.

Large portions of mediocre food. Got three times as much as I needed. If it tasted better I would say twice as much as I needed but my corned beef hash just didn't taste as good as it looked. The Bloody Maria was excellent. The service was slow. If I ever go back it will be just for the Maria. No need for big plates of blandness.

Recommended by a friend after my hungry husbands 3 day softball tournament. We shared a fried chicken eggs Benedict and left satisfied, and full! Huge serving and bill was under, $20. Definitely going back, burgers looked yummy as well!

The smoked salmon hash was inedible it tasted and looked like old fish. Waiter never asked why I never touched my food 
Disappointed. The rest of the group loved their food.

The only reason I got food to go from here was to take care of a hangover. I've been to another Hash House on Sahara back when I lived in Vegas...still not impressed and disappointed. Today's plate was bland. Sausage was too soft when I bit in. Like undercooked and soft. Also I cannot understand how an establishment can't season their food. Put some damn flavor in there. I've gone to mom and pop diners with more flavor and delicious plates here. Only gimmick is cause Hash House has big portions. Whoopdeefreakindo.

Went there twice.  First for breakfast.  We heard about the portion sizes so we shared a corned beef hash and eggs (with lots of other stuff).  It was more than enough.
Then we went with friends, for dinner.
One person ordered the meat loaf... it was enough for at least two hungry people.
One person ordered the chicken pot pie (at which point the server asked "Do you know how big that is!?)... actually it was enough for all four of us!
My wife and I ordered a small side salad (to share), and a hamburger (to share).  The salad was just right, and the hamburger was enough for three people.
I quickly came to the realization that a family of 4 (or 5 if the kids are small) could eat cheaper than at McDonald's... $14.99 for the chicken pot pie.
I found the overall quality of food to be average, but the quantity enormous.
One other thing... As a senior citizen, I have yet to buy in to what the younger people are doing to themselves.  A server in restaurant with tattoos and metal things sticking through noses, eyebrows, tongue, etc., is not an appetizing sight, in fact it's an appetite depressant.

Delicious food. Words can't express the flavors here! 
Would come here over and over and try something new everytime. The portions are over the top. It really feeds 2 people. I hope people try this place. 
The staff actually is very pleasant and helpful. They know their  menu.

If you are on a diet do not eat here or any places recommended by the Man vs Food guy because the portions here are massive.  I did not see an empty plate busted away by the staff there when they cleared the tables.  

Food wasn't bad but it wasn't spectacular. The massive portions even out the prices. Service was excellent when we visited.

When visiting Fremont, you really should have breakfast here.  The portions are huge. The menu hilarious and varied.  We had a group of 5 of us, they told us it would be a 45 minute wait. They got us in within 20 minutes.  (You give them you cell number and they text you when your table is ready)   If you're a midwesterner at heart and want your beloved monster size pork tenderloin- you will find it here.  
They service is a little slow for your food but they aim to please. We had a birthday boy with us and they baked him a fudge cake while waited. Exceeded service expectations!

The place wasn't busy but having a horrible time with service.  Never did know who are actual server was, as one person took order, one person delivered coffee, and the manager brought one breakfast for my sweetie, and I had to wait about 5 mins. for mine.  Food?  If you like a big (awful) doughy biscuit that looks like it came out of the pillsbury doughboys butt, then this is the place for you.  Ham, spinach, cheese scramble had a big glob of partially melted cheese on top with a few leaves of raw spinach thrown on to complete the order.  We will never go back.

I ate at the Sahara location years ago and remember it being very delicious & a nice menu of different items to choose from. Well a few months back I tried the downtown location and was truly disappointed. Food was not as good as I remembered and service was horrible. I don't think I will be eating at this location again.

Great food and service.  Tried the Man vs Food meal and it was HUGE! The chipotle the sauce is amazing!!! they use fresh ingredients, no hormones... and you can really taste the difference. 
I have to go back and try the chicken and waffles. They have a special on Tuesdays for it.
I was staying at the Plaza for business and waited over 30 minutes for them to open at 7am and finally had to go to McDonald's for breakfast. What sucky management.

Last Labor Day weekend 2015, when my family and I came to HHAGG, we had an awesome dining experience.  Fast forward to July 4, 2016, and the dining experience is A-Gone-Gone ! Wait times were longer than 20 minutes, and so we chose the counter. The brunette server was A-Horrible Mess! She waited on everyone around the counter in speed except us. It took 30 minutes before our food came out.  I shared my concerns with the on-duty manager, and he did nothing to apologize; he made excuses for her and the lack of service we experienced.  I am making it known today that HHAGG is just that - hashed and gone.  We won't be back, and I'm sharing with others to don't even bother to go here.  One star is too many!

Great location - right inside the Plaza hotel

Huge portions and amazing breakfast food for the prices.  Been to a hash house in San Diego and this is just as good as I remember it.  You could definitely share a meal for breakfast.

Our server was really nice and attentive.  Definitely worth going if you're in the downtown area.

Went on Easter dinner after church mass. It wasn't crowed and had dinner with in-laws. The food was excellent and filling. Service was actually great compared to what others say. I ate at 3 different Hash House A Go Go and all 3 have great food. This particular place at the time we went had great service. But like all places, there are times when service is not all that, but I guess we caught it a great time and my in-laws enjoyed there first experience @ Hash House A Go Go a great one!

LV native now, and was 1st year I decided I needed a cooking break on turkey day. I realize nothing is as good as homemade on Thanksgiving, but went in with an open mind, given this restaurant's positive reviews. Made an unnecessary reservation, as the place was virtually empty when we arrived, which was lucky, as whoever took my reservation only hours earlier, didn't write it down.

The waitress arrived quickly and took our order quick as well, as we were all decided we would order the turkey dinner. She was a little off putting, as in not friendly, which I would later realize the reason, we we were arriving at end of her shift on Thanksgiving.

It took no more than 5-10 minutes to receive our plates. Looked decent, but tasted not so decent. The turkey and stuffing were moist, but there was probably about an ounce of gravy on the potatoes. I asked the food runner if we could have more, and she rolled her eyes and said "I'll have to check with the kitchen." She brought back for three of us about one more ounce of gravy to share. The mashed potatoes served with dinner were like bricks that seemed to be sitting the entire day, were not warm, and lacked any flavoring such as milk and butter. Vegetables served were carrots, green beans and a small ear of corn. The corn was cooked properly, but the carrots and green beans were virtually raw, and the carrots were so tough I couldn't cut with a knife. None of the vegetables arrived with butter or any seasoning, just plain and hard; reminded me of my kids' school lunches! The dinner was to come with cranberry sauce, which it did in a tiny ramekin usually seen in restaurants that put ketchup in for fries. There was approximately one tablespoon each. Given my kids love cranberry sauce, I forfeited my tablespoon so they could each have an extra 1/2 tablespoon; what a joke. 

For dessert we ordered pumpkin cheesecake and pumpkin bread pudding. When I ordered dessert, the waitress indicated she was "going to get out of here," and I believe the bartender was going to finish up our table. She brought us the check, my tab was approximately $80, and although the food was sub-par and she wasn't the friendliest, I gave her a 20% tip. She was never seen again.

Meanwhile, our pumpkin cheesecake arrived immediately from a food runner. My kids and I had a few bites, but it didn't taste like cheesecake to me. Rather, it had a strong taste of cool whip in the filling. My two little sweet freaks didn't touch it yesterday in the fridge at home, and I'll toss it today. After waiting 30 minutes for anyone to pass by to get their attention, I managed to get two hosts' attention. Our bread pudding was missing in action, and at about the 40th minute the food runner returned with the bread pudding. I told her no way, wasn't paying for it, as I just told the host 10 minutes prior same, and was waiting for the manager to return my bread pudding money. He did ultimately run a new check canceling the dessert charges and apologizing for our waitress taking off before ensuring our dessert was delivered. Obviously, we were forgotten about. He gave us the bread pudding, but no one has touched it in the fridge. 

The entire experience and food were subpar, and given this restaurant's reviews, I had high hopes, and a crummy buffet would have been a far better option for the price. Because of this experience, we will never dine at this chain again.

Nope, not yummy. If you THINK it's yummy you are a terrible person who should be locked in a dungeon forever. This place is very much about the gimmick, you know, GIANT, decorative portions of not very delicious things. I've been several times and I think there are so many better breakfast places nearby (Babycakes, Egg Works, Cracked Egg, etc.) Last time my omelet was really dry and completely flavorless despite me adding a zillion extra ingredients and my biscuit was dense and heavy like a carby hockey puck...no buneo! Really this is expensive, icky quality buffet food made to look pretty on a plate. Um..pass.

The portions are very big, and the food is pretty good. I had The Basic with sausage thinking it sounded simple enough and wouldn't be huge, but it definitely was. The sausage and potatoes were excellent. On the downside, I've definitely had better service. The waitress seemed annoyed by everything right off the bat, even though we are polite and low maintenance - no special requests, no sending food back, just ordered our food and ate it. Maybe one round of refills. I'm sure that's probably not typical, but given the abundance of food choices in this city it was enough for me to decide I will probably not be back.

To put it simply...the best breakfast I had in Vegas.  While the buffets are good at filling you up with huge plates of food...the quality can be a little lacking.
Hash House A Go Go will cost you a little more, but the combination of huge portions and great tasting food will satisfy you.  
I had the Corned Beef House Hash...which was quite delicious.  Although huge, I was able to put most of it away.  Of course I walked around for a couple of hours feeling quite stuffed.  You can tell just by the look and taste that everything is prepared fresh...no canned stuff here.
My brother had the sage fried chicken benedict dish...which he raved about.  It was even larger than my plate and he couldn't finish.
My mom had a basic breakfast of eggs scrambled, biscuit, hash brown potatoes, and bacon.  This was too large for her and she couldn't finish either.
One thing that you have to try if you come here is the Watermelon/Kiwi Lemonade.  I didn't order it, but had a taste of my brothers...it was delicious and quite refreshing.
This location is convenient if you are staying downtown as it is located in the Plaza hotel lobby area.  There was no significant wait to eat here(we waited about 10 minutes for a table), but we went on a Monday about 9AM or so...so could be different on weekends or at different times.
Highly recommended.
The food was great. If you want pancakes I advise you to share with someone because they are HUGE!

What an amazing experience! The food was unreal ! The chicken & waffles was the best I have ever had & that's coming from a expert. The wife ordered the chicken Benedict it too was amazing! Warning the portion sizes are HUGE. Enjoy !!!!

Everything was great... Except the Rosemary. 

Good food fair prices. My only complaint is that my plate only had 17 bunches of rosemary sticking out of the top.  The food could have used more. :(

I've been here the last two times I was in Vegas and the food is consistently excellent. Lots of options in the menu. Beware that portions are out of control so save your appetite. I would recommend making reservations as it is always crowded. Highly recommended!!!!

Worst service after 4 days in Vegas. There was no wait, we were seated immediately, place was not full, 25 minutes later we don't even have a glass of water. I don't care what food guru has eaten here or how many things on the menu are named after him, you actually need to have a chance to eat the food. Better off with a breakfast buffet for much cheaper.
Amazing portions!  My wife and I shared the prawn app and the chicken and waffles entree and left stuffed!

Nice portions, you need to split things.
Very tasty & came out hot.
Nice ambiance, inside Plaza Hotel downtown.

AMAZE BALLS! This place is awesome! We ate twice in one weekend. If you have to wait, no worries, its WORTH IT! The food and service was awesome! We had a realy cool guy serving us and giving us a hard time but in a super funny way! The food was all HUGE so be prepared! 
I are the Best BLT ever in my life. It was the lunch special. Jalepenos and Spicy Bacon. YUM!!
Will go back again next time!

Portions was large and presented nice.  Food tasted ok imo.  The coffee tasted really good like Starbucks. I enjoyed that the most.  We ordered the chicken and waffles, the smoked salmon benadict and the regular breakfast with bacon and eggs.

Chicken and waffles - really looks bigger and better than it is.  try pull off all the breading and really look at the size of the chicken! The meat is soooooo small. I had better tasting chicken from the supermarket. 

Smoked Salmon Benadict-  tasted ok but had only had small pieces of salmon and mostly had this mashed potato bedding.  The sauce tasted really good but that's because tasted like  was made of pure butter.  I was blowing gas out my a$$ all day- had to have been from this food.  Yikes!

The standard breakfast was the best out of the three. imo.

Overall,  this place felt like not clean.  The carpet was really dirty like nobody went sweep for days.  My whole family was sneezing from who knows what.  As soon as we left, they were ok.

I don't think we be back again...All show no go...

Go ahead and put it on your To-Do list.  Fiancee and I split the chicken Benedict and we were both stuffed.  We also each had a BLT Bloody Mary, and even at $11.50 each, we were not disappointed.   The drinks have bacon, tomato, and lettuce accompaniments, so of course they are served with a slice of toast and packet of mayo so you can have a snack, too.  Highly recommend!  Portions are enough for 2 people to split easily.  You won't leave hungry or disappointed.

Wow. The manager (tall balding man) there has no experience with customer care and how to get his point across without insulting repeat customers...definitely in need of training/retraining. Needless to say that we and all of our friends will not be returning.

This was my second HH to visit, food is delicious but a lot of the portions are massive; unless you can eat a lot you really need to split most meals to get your money's worth.  Some options are more reasonably sized but their signature items are big.

Perfect stop for lunch after a day of walking in the heat. Mandy our bartender was amazing  I will warn you the baby Burger is actually 1 lb where the Burger is a 2 lb so order the baby version. And you'll be full for the day.

Do you love bacon?  Do you love 'Merica?  If yes come here.  

Huge portions, definitely was full splitting a meal (and I'm a big guy)
Delicious chicken and waffles (with bacon mixed into the waffle batter and chicken batter, I didn't even know that was possible).  
Fried chicken benedict was pretty good too, this thing is massive.
Service was great.
Coffee was ok.
Prices were very reasonable, $10-15 per plate

All in all, great experience.

visited 06.26.15

Excellent breakfast spot for a hearty way to start your day, or end your night of drinking.  Portions were massive, so bring your appetite but the large sizes don't take away from the wonderful flavors you encounter when you taste the food.

I had the truck drivers special with french toast and it was awesome.  The toast was soft and fluffy and crunchy and it was served with a very generous side of maple syrup, eggs and bacon!

A friend had the chorizo, eggs and toast and she did her best but she couldn't quite devour the mountain of food served to her in the cast iron skillet that just adds to the presentation.

Coffee and OJ were on point so all in all a great spot.

Stayed at the hotel during a music festival so the rooms were sold out. Wait was about an hour and half for sit down so my party of five opted for take out. That was about 20-25 min wait. The portions are GIANT!!!! Got the country fried steak, was 7/10.  It was definitely double deep fried. The gravy had good tasty bits inside and the mashed potatoes were yummy. The green beans were sad and overcooked. My boyfriend got the eggs benedict but it came with scramble eggs rather than poached. Also giant portion! All in all, it wasnt exciting. Just food to fill the stomach.

So we went again, it was worst that the first time.

Since they don't use trays they dropped my husbands breakfast on the floor. Another employee (not our server) walked up and asked my husband if he got a bite of it! WT...? (As if he took a bite and threw it on the floor or something?!?!?!) My husband said No and the employee said "That's f**ked up, dude" and walked off. I am not a prude but I do believe in professional language is a workplace. 

So two employees come to clean up the mess, One has dirty dishes in his hand. I saw it coming. I was hoping he wouldn't. But he did! He put his dirty dishes on my table next to my plate of food! Gross! 

Vegas has plenty of restaurants! Its service that makes it great or not! This place is a No Go for me!

Came here to do a easy cheap breakfast and couldn't resist the urge to try something else!  The Country Fried Steak was amazing and more than I could handle. My boyfriend got the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and that was just AWESOME!  The flavor was amazing!

The food for the rest of my party was excellent and what I expected, but my dish SUCKED!!  I ordered the turkey leftover meal, but got 4 thin slices of turkey.  Measly portion??  At HHAGG?!!  Don't think I will eat there again.  If you offer a holiday special, don't make it the most expensive but chintiesta f***ing thing on the menu!!!  Avoid any specials! Used to be a fan, now a hater of Hash House A Go Go.

I love this place!!! Ever since I saw this on man vs food I had to try it. The first thing I got of course was the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken I tell you what one of the best things I've eaten in awhile. I've been there 3 times so far and have never had a problem with service or wait staff. I've also indulged my craving with the Apple Cinnamon pancakes yum yum! I recommend you try it at least once. Not everyone has the same experience as the next person but from my experience so far not a bad one.

the food was great, and so was the service; however, the reason this wasn't a 5-star review is because of the dirty silverware. My buddy had crud all over his spoon, and as well, dug out a piece of spinach lodged in his coffee cup. sick! i also didn't care for the "jelly of the day" as the only jelly option. i just wanted some grape jelly, yet the only jelly available was some peach-strawberry abomination. disgusting!

First let me say, I love HHAGG.  But the service here was poor.  Perhaps it is the downtown location that attracts a certain clientele. But don't assume I am a low class citizen until I do something that warrants such treatment.  

My son's pancakes were supposed to have chocolate chips. They arrived plain. Our six orders didn't arrive together. The last order arrived a full 1/2 hour after the first order. 

We asked for a bottle of ketchup. They said weren't allowed to give a whole bottle. .. Really?!? Is there a ketchup shortage in Vegas I'm not aware of? 

I will probably not come back here by choice. 

The saving grace is the food which is consistently good.

Hash House A Go Go holds its place in my "TOP PLACES TO EAT BREAKFAST" list! The reason is because the portions they serve are HUGE and it's great if you want to do family style eating, where people split the entrees and share!

There is so much food to choose from. It's a little more pricey than your average IHOP but the quality and portion is bigger. Everything in the menu is pretty much $15+, which can be a little pricey for breakfast food. Although it is a little on the pricier side, the value is there because the food is really good and sometimes it's actually cheaper to share food amongst each other via split bill, which our server had no trouble doing!

Due to its name, I thought that this place was a quick grab and go type restaurant but it ended up being a whole restaurant, and I'm not complaining at all! Service was brilliant, as drinks were quickly refilled and the server was really helpful in helping me pick out some food. 

This place definitely surprised me, and I will be coming back for many more breakfasts!

Everyone else has pretty much said what there is to be said.  Not much of a crowd at this location (and why DOES the Plaza smell so weird?) I hear the Strip location is much busier.  Comically huge portions  but the food is just alright. I had the fried chicken hash and the fried chicken was indeed tasty, as was the slab of griddled cheese on it there but the biscuits and potatoes weren't terribly flavorful and there was just too much sauce.  I also had this huge pistachio iced coffee thing that wasn't as pistacio-y as I would have liked.

Had the sage chicken Benedict and was ok,nothing great. I expected more as this chain is highly rated by many people. The portions are huge! More than enough for 2 people! I'll try again and order something else to give a second chance.
Bad service from the hostess. She was rude and not friendly at all. Good food though.

Always a solid choice for brunch.  We were able to walk from our hotel.  The wait was about 25 minutes on Saturday at 10:50AM.  Service was good, and the food was quite filling.  I didn't even finish my meal...way too many carbs on the plate.  The fried chicken is quite good...so good we got a fried chicken Benedict and the chicken and waffles.  They have fresh-squeezed tangerine juice as an option...so cool and different from most breakfast/brunch joints.  It was a nice way to start our day in town.

"The food channel lied to me". The chicken and waffels kind of suck and it took lil over 20 min for my food to come "and no it was not busy" maybe it was the cook I don't know I'll give it a try one more time. "maybe"

Our party of four visited the Hash House twice.  Breakfast and Lunch.  The burgers were touted by the waiter as, "the best we would ever eat."  A bold claim, unjustified by the finished result!  The burgers are huge, and that's all.  The two patties were both cooked bone-dry.  I had to remove one so I could choke down the other.  The seasoning and additions did nothing to make up for the overcooked meat.  We decided to try breakfast another day.  Once again, the huge portions did not disguise the trend toward over-cooking here.  I have had Denny's breakfasts better prepared.  It may be a problem of this particular location, but with all the options available in Vegas, you could only do better anywhere for the price.

This review is for anyone with food allergies, specifically gluten free. 

Before our trip to Las Vegas one of our foodie friends suggested we visit this place. We were excited when we accidentally stumbled upon this place. We came at the last minute on a Saturday morning and didn't have to wait long to be seated. That's the end of the good from here. I HATE leaving bad reviews. I work at a hotel and used to work at a restaurant, so I understand this industry, but what we experienced was so beyond "bad" service I'm at a loss for words. I originally wanted just to send the owners an email, but I couldn't find any contact info...Then I thought that others with food allergies need to know. I want to point out that I'm not looking for anything from management, I just want other gluten free travelers to know about my experience here. 

I have Celiac Disease, so if I eat anything with wheat in it I get really sick. Before we even got sat we asked the manager that was on duty if they had anything gluten free that I could eat. He said "Yes of course. Everything is made to order so you should be able to find something." Perfect! So we were seated. Our waitress came over and took our drink order. I asked her what she recommended that was gluten free and her response was "Uhhh...umm...we don't have anything gluten free." From there it was back and forth with her and the manager we talked to earlier. All I really wanted was an egg, bacon, and some hash browns. The manager said the hash browns come pre-packaged and seasoned (what happened everything made to order?) and would have to check on the label. When he came back he said they were gluten free. Then the server came back and I told her what I wanted and she said  "No, he is wrong. They aren't gluten free." I have never had an issue with ANY restaurant I've been to about trying to find out if I can have something gluten free. If they don't that's fine and I'll find a safe place for me to eat. But the lack of communication between management and the servers was the worst I've ever experienced. I was to the point of tears and had to embarrassingly ask where the restroom was so I could pull myself together. After that we never saw our waitress again. I could tell she was upset with us, but really? She never came back by to see if everything was okay or offer refill on coffee. We saw her chatting it up with the table behind us. We waited for nearly 10 minutes before she came back to give us our check. When we did finally see her she threw it on the table without even looking at us or saying a word. I have never felt more humiliated in my life! There are SO many great restaurants in the area, this one isn't worth the headache (and tears) for people with food allergies. We won't be back.

Great food and huge portions!! My friend and I shared a breakfast hash and we both were full. Such great flavor! Only bummer was yelp had there hours opening at 7am when they really opened at 7:30am. When we mentioned this to the staff, they didn't seem to care.
Ginormous portions of excellent, tasty food. Had the HH original eggs benny. Busy restaurant, but great service.

Called ahead, they said it was not busy and that their was no wait.  When we arrive they say that there is an hour wait even though there was no party/ line in sight, we waited 15 min and were seated, that had me like O.o why?? Food was good, pancake was massive.

I ate here a few years ago at the Henderson location, and it was good.  Not great, but good enough to try again.  This time we ate at the downtown location in the Plaza hotel/casino off Fremont street.  

I ordered the HH Original Eggs Benedict.  Presentation was dramatic, as usual, but the food was disappointing.  Bed of mashed potatoes were good but nothing remarkable.  Tasted like a homemade mash with little or no cream/butter and skins left on.  Then on top of that were two halves of a biscuit.  Bottom half was hard as a hockey puck.  I was about to call the waiter over to take it back but then I cut into the top half, and it was soft.  No intention of eating all those carbs, so let it go.  Tomato was under ripe and spinach leaves were cold and crispy.  Eggs were poached perfectly. Bacon was thin and just okay.   "Red pepper cream" poured over the top was uninspired.  

My companion ordered the smoked salmon egg white scramble with fresh fruit.  Strawberries were pink and white.  Not red.  Not ripe at all.  Pineapple was good.  She enjoyed the hash, but I thought it smelled horrible.  I don't like strong fish scents, especially for breakfast.  

Will definitely not be back.

The food was great.  I had the Fried Chicken Salad, very tasty.  The service was awful.  My food came first, then 15 minutes later my husbands came. In the mean time, the waiter came up to me and said the reason why we dont have our food at the same time, is because there are no heat lamps.  First of all, I never made any comment on why my food was the only one on the table.  I guess he needed to rectify the mistake, but after he said such a ridiculous statement, I replied, "we didnt have this problem at the other Hash House".  He walked away,  Then the manager came up to the table with my husbands food and told us the same thing about the heat lamps. OMG. no reply from me.  They werent friendly AT ALL and spoke to me as if I were a total idiot.  Next time I will be heading to the Hash House on Sahara.  They managed to get our party of 8's food out at the same time and were very friendly

Helpful Hint: You should have started the other meal first.

I really had high hopes for a good meal. We went at breakfast time. We sat in the bar. When we saw what the neighbors next to us had we were very impressed with the presentation. So we ordered. My friend ordered the chicken eggs benedict. Still had high hopes he took a picture. I ordered some kind of Fried Chicken with a biscuit. Neither one fo was impressed. After we left we both thought wow that was horrible especially when I think our bill was $48....Of course we had 2 Bloody Mary's. My friend said it was good. I had never had one so i ordered it. Took me all day to get that taste out of my mouth and I only had a few drinks of it and gave it to him. Oh well no I know. May give them another try some days but I guess that would be if everything else was closed.

I ate dinner at this Hash House A Go Go in Las Vegas, NV on 9/14/2015.  It was my 1st time there.  I was told that they serve huge portions and they do (it was also my lunch the next day).  I had their dinner spinach for $7.99 (I like spinach) and a BBLT with fries for $13.50.  My coke was $2.99.  My server, Corey, did a fine job.  Plus, I took photos.

I had a pretty good time eating at the Summerlin location and the one in the Linq casino.  This one is located in the Plaza hotel downtown but this time around, for whatever reason, it wasn't all that thrilling.  Perhaps because it was the one meal in LV on this trip that I decided to take the trashiness of the food down a level?  At around 10 AM we did have to put our name on a waiting list but it only took about 5 or 10 minutes before I got a text telling us to head back to the host.  

The waitress and staff were kind and definitely kept our water and coffee full.  No problems there.  Mom and I split the Healthy Start with spinach, mushrooms and onions and a side order of Biscuit and Gravy for $5 (to offset being TOO healthy, you understand)!  The other half of our party ordered the Crab Benedict.  They brought out the Healthy Start but when they found out they had mis-keyed a Benedict with Fried Chicken instead of Crab, they corrected it within minutes!  Great service, no question.  

The issue was really the food.  It was just good, not great.  To the point that we didn't order anything decadent which is kind of the point of eating at Hash House A Go Go, the two people who ordered the Benedict didn't have anything much to say and one of them could only eat a little because the sauce was too spicy for her.  We did have the biscuit and gravy but it was also just okay.  Nothing great.  We ate because we were hungry, but we'll probably try something else next time when staying downtown.
The name is as cool as the food they serve!!!! If your looking for a good "hangover helper" breakfast in Vegas, THIS is the place to go!!!! By the time we left here, I felt right as rain.....

I dont know how they do it but no other place can u get so much DELICIOUS food at such i low price. I go to Vegas every month and this is always our go to place. The service is wonderful and they give u way to much food.I just wish that they had half portions available i feel so bad about the amount of food that gets wasted here its ashame. We've had breakfast,lunch and dinner here never a bad experience.

I came here for only one thing, to try out their Bloody Mary. There's so much talk on the internet about their Bloody Mary. So what's cool? They make their own mix. That's respectable. But it's ok, not great. They serve it with low quality vodka which you can ask for a higher quality but I decided to stick with their formula. I really did think it would have tasted better with a higher quality vodka like Grey Goose. Regardless, this is not a Bloody Mary I would go out of my way to come and drink.

Went here once for breakfast and again for dinner the next day.  Breakfast was great and as many other have mentioned, the portions were huge. Where this restaurant took a turn for the worse was dinner.  After the great corned beef hash, I had high expectations for the pork tenderloin.  When it came out it was a total wtf moment.  Everything the menu said came with the dinner was there; except it was sandwiched between two huge pieces of pork; A huge mash potatoes, cheese, veggie, mushroom pork-bun sandwich.  I don't get it but whatever, let's give it a try.  To my disappointment it couldn't hold a candle to the hash but to my horror I spent the next seven hours vomiting uncontrollable while I lost what I'm guessing was several feet of intestine and my dignity in the other direction as I fought two friend I had dinner with (ordered a different dish then I) for toilet time because they were violent ill as well.  You know the old adage about what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...along with the lining of my stomach and my ability to establish eye contact with my friends.

I love to wander around Downtown and look at all the stuff hiding in the corners of the casinos.  In the Plaza, the big hotel / convention center at the corner of Fremont & Main, you can find a pretty standard looking casino, but the eateries in there are far from standard.  The Hash House is a strange Southern/farm-themed restaurant that serves up biscuits and 'hash' skillet scrambles, as well as Southern-style breakfast (chicken & waffles) and comfort food.
I went here for breakfast, service was good.  They wouldn't do a turkey substitution on my scramble (I got the jalapeno/chorizo version and thought it tasted pleasantly like a breakfast taco), but the serving was generous and the flavor was good.

I'd give it a thumbs up, especially for a morning-after breakfast.  If you're looking for a low-fat snack before yoga though, give it a miss.

The portions here are obnoxious. That is the first thing written and noticed about this place. It is their thing. It is an odd thing to have. Personally, I would aim for excellence in food, environment, or something like the same, but HHAGG shoots for ridiculous portions that even the hungriest of Americans find it difficult to finish. (And boy are there some hungry ones out there!) The food is decent enough - better than your average chain restaurant. The decor is sleek. The service is fine. BUT CHECK OUT THE HUUUUUGE PORTIONS!!! OMG! LMAO! JPIA! I have found the dinner to be more appetizing than their breakfast (which is the opposite of what they are known for). The time I tried the highly recommended chicken and waffles, I was underwhelmed. However, I am not really a chicken and waffles type of guy. The dish just perplexes me. The food is satisfying enough, just do not expect to be wowed by anything other than having more food than you can eat. (Which is a good thing.) (I think.) (Sometimes this country confuses the hell out of me.)
Sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no service. Apparently I wasn't important enough. Won't come back. This place runs the same as the hotel. Looks like they forgot about customer service. Thanks.

Be advised - the portions here are huge!
We were able to split 1 entree between the 2 of us!

We went with the breakfast quesadilla - which was delicious! Plenty for 2, and an instant hangover cure! Lol. The sauce on top was fairly spicy, but was very tasty!

Prices are fair for the portions you receive. Our waitress was very friendly and suggestive to menu favorites, since it was our first time here.

I think we hit this spot at the perfect time! We were seated right away, and our food was served pretty quick! We waited maybe 10 minutes from the time we put our order in, to the time our food arrived to our table. I was shocked, considering the place was jam-packed when we had walked by the night before.

It was a quick, easy and delicious meal after checking out of The Plaza.

Will definitely be back during our next visit to DTLV!

Perfect Bloody Mary. First time coming here and I only tried a few bites of food but I did try the corned beef hash. It was served hot and a great change of pace having shredded fresh corned beef with cheese. It's like a breakfast Ruben. The potatoes were OK, they aren't what I like. I like fresh potatoes not ones from a bag...

Bloody Mary is pretty good though!!!

This place is amazing. I guess I'll start off by saying: I have a huge sweet tooth. So, it was only natural that I order the Snickers pancake and a spiked kiwi watermelon lemonade. Ah.Maze.Ing. oh my gosh. The pancake was huge--it took up the entire plate. The lemonade was so tasty, sweet, delicious, and came with a huge slice of watermelon. Service was a little slow (I was out of water for several minutes) but the food was so good, I kind of didn't care.
This place is delicious! Portions are big and food is great. I got the banana French toast it was delicious!

Terrible service. I got a seat right away and he took my order but after 30 minutes, my food didn't come and no one came to update me that it was on the way. It wasnt even that busy.  When I started to get antsy, I couldn't even find anyone to complain to!  So I just left.

I saw Hash House on Travel Channel's Man Vs. Food. So going to Vegas I had to check it out and I was not disappointed. I went with my family and we all had a great time. The service was amazing. Our server helped us choose the best menu items and the best drinks. And his recommendations didn't disappoint. I ordered the chicken and waffles, it was so delicious. The chicken pieces were huge and crunchy and perfectly seasoned. The waffle were fluffy. Together the chicken and waffles are a perfect pair, then adding the syrup...is like taste buds heaven. The meal was so big, I tried to eat all of it but couldn't. But it was a great meal.  
This Hash House location gives an older vibe and it was hard to walk through especially with a stroller. But the restaurant is clean and the staff is super friendly. I would definitely eat here again.

Decided to come here for breakfast since it was within walking distance from our hotel.

The "Brown Sugar Banana Flapjack" lives up to the hype, as well as the "Fried Chicken & Waffles."  Like many others have said, huge portions, & as much as we tried, we couldn't finish it all.

Our servers were very nice & checked on us often to make sure we were okay. We left there stuffed & weren't hungry until dinner!

Zero wait time, showed up at 730 am, and showed up hungry! Great service, clean environment, good suggestions by our server, and a very clear menu with abundant choices. I went with the Machacas and my husband the Chicken skillet. Our food came out within 10-15 minutes (can't be sure, we were too busy trying to plan a fun day) and was plated beautifully! My Machacas had skillfully prepared eggs with beef and tomatoes and onions...I had no idea eggs could be that fluffy! Fried potatoes and a large tortilla complemented my meal. I received the jalapeño sauce/salsa on the side and requested a side of limes to help cool it down. Delicious!!! I ate almost every bite of the eggs despite the gargantuan portion! Even though the potatoes were crispy and flavorful I couldn't even...my husband's skillet came with a soft and succulent biscuit the size of a softball and was paired with homemade jam, mixed berry possibly? His response? Perfectly warmed and moist ;) Yum!!
