His chicken skillet was chock full of onion, pepper, and asparagus served over the top of crispy fried potatoes, along side of two eggs done just right. Cleaned his enormously portioned skillet/plate! Bottom line, go early, realize that great restaurants become busy, and the food tastes farm to table fresh! Great coupons if you stay at the Plaza, but even without, very affordable restaurant experience! Thank you Hash House!
This is a place to go when you are STARVING the portions are ridiculously huge. I had the chicken pot pie which was to DIE for! Highly recommend if you ever get the chance
2nd time here and it never disapoints! Tried the corned beef hash a go go and it was delicious! Huge portions. Service is great. Always a stop for us while we're in Vegas!

I thought from the pictures and description that this place was going to be great. Not so. A lot of the hashes and food is dry, it needs like a sauce or cream to make things better. The service wasn't great. 

There are too many other breakfast places to go to in Vegas, I won't return.
normal breakfast but big.  Service was friendly but very slow.

The only thing that makes me sad about writing this review, is that I'm not sitting in the restaurant eating their food! I was skeptical about it because of my bias against the Plaza hotel (my grandmother goes there all the time, so it's because of her, not anything wrong with the hotel). But by far, this is the best breakfast I have ever had! And the service is beyond words! We loved our server so much we even took a picture with him! I think his name is John... I asked him if I could take him around in vegas with me because he was so amazing! 

Like most people said, the portions are huge! I split with the person I was there with and we still didn't finish! The drinks are huge too! I got a mimosa and it had me buzzin by the end because it was a lot! We got Andys Famous Sage Fried Chicken Breast w/maple reduction, two eggs your style, bacon mashed potatoes and biscuits. But instead of mashed potatoes we got regular breakfast potatoes. The sauce was beyond words! It was a chipotle mayo, that I could have put in a cup and drank. Can't wait to go back and try other things!

Great breakfast here in the newly renovated Plaza Hotel.  Ate their sage fried chicken & waffles.  Two pieces of perfectly  battered fried chicken with waffles, bacon and tomatoes garnished with fried green onions and a rosemary stem made for a totally satisfying meal.  This dish was huge! 
The chicken was not greasy at all and had a lightly seasoned with sage batter that came out crispy.  

The guy next to me ordered their pork eggs benedict.  The waitress said that there are 18 ounces of chicken fried pork alone in that dish.  She said Adam from Man vs Food ate this dish.

Very good value for the money.  I'd eat here again in a heartbeat, but my arteries would probably kill me if I made this a habit.

People seem to love this place; I thought it was terrible. Yes, the service is fast. The people are friendly. The portions are huge. But the food is bland. BLAND. Tasteless. Devoid of flavor. Lacking in the ability to please one's taste buds. And unexpectedly deep fried. 

I had visions of cranberries and thinly sliced roast pork and house mayo when I ordered a pork tenderloin sandwich. What I got was something like looked like chicken fried steak slapped onto a flavorless bun with a pickle.

Tasteless, fried, crap in enormous amounts. Why do people like this place?!? Skip it.
Big portions, very tasty options. Delicious mimosas! It seemed to be reasonably priced for vegas.

One of the best meals you can have in Vegas.We had Sage fried chicken benidict...so  yummy!! You'll have to bring your appetite, plates are humongous so you might wanna share. Next time in Vegas hit this place up first your tummy won't regret it.
We love this place. The portions are huge! So bring your appetite! Or split a plate with someone!

SOOO MUUUCCCHHH FOOODDDDDD!!! Come hungry or prepare to split cause these portions are HUGE!

I ordered the Hardwood smoked bacon, avocado, onion & swiss scramble which came out with fluffy eggs and stuffed with bacon and avocado. Got a brown sugar and banana pancake as a side... but it was 14" wide! Super tasty, and fluffy, that is a winning pancake. 

The boys ordered the Sage Fried chicken, chicken and waffles, and chicken fried steak. The chicken is cranky on the outside, moist on the inside and fills you to the brim. We left with full tummy, smiles on our faces, and lots of doggy bags.

Servies was friendly and this place was defo worth the wait.

Worst service ever! My husband and I came in around 3PM for an appetizer before going onto Fremont. We were seated by the host and then NEVER served. 3 different waiters walked by and didn't take even our drink order. We felt completely ignored and insulted. After 35 minutes we got up and walked out. My husband wanted to leave after 15 minutes but I wanted to see how long it would be before we were served. I'm sure the food is great from all the reviews but management needs to reevaluate it's staff. As we were leaving, we told the host that seated us about it and she just smiled and told us to have a good night! WOW...

This is Red Neck Heaven. Portions are HUGE with lots and lots of fat, carbs, sugars....all the good stuff. You gain five pounds just walking in the door. When we ate there - middle of week, just after noon rush - half the tables were empty. Still, the orange haired waitress had us wait 10 minutes for a table. Waitress was distracted and when kitchen staff brought lunch to the table he almost threw it rather than sitting it on the table. No eye contact, much less actually speaking.
But the Bloody Mary's are great as is the food but it's just too much food; that said, lots of people were cleaning their plates!!!!.

First of all... I am not the type to talk bad on a place.. that is ofcourse until they treat the customer like crap... which is the experience I just had at the Plaza Casino Hash house.  They entice casino patrons to eat there by offering discount coupons upon checkin... then find every excuse not to fulfill them.  We had a four top wait 10 minutes just to be sat (at the front hostess stand) The short haired african american girl that worked at 5pm 1/9/2012 likes to talk more than work. Then we waited for another 5-10 minutes just to get a server and put in the drink orders.  At 515 pm... they then stated that our 10 dollar coupon would not be honored.. even though we clearly were there before the 5pm cutoff... the server even remembered us from a previous visit... and should have known that we are excellent tippers!! What an idiot... I hope you enjoyed your tip that we deducted the ten bux from!!!! Bahahahhahaahhahahahaha (pause for deep breath) hahahahahahahahahaahahahahaa!!!!.  Food wise.... do not order your own portion... SHARE!!!  The portions are HUUUUUGE... and perfect for 2 people... save your money for the casino or alcohol.  I will never be back, and will be spreading the word to everyone who considers this Downtown Vegas Hash House  location.  Very Very Very poor service and the manager of the place should take notes from Adam (GM) in the Oscar's restaurant upstairs!  Go to Denny's or the Mcdonalds inside the casino before eating here.... Not that I expect any changes, but the owner of this location should consider why the restaurant is suffering. PATHETIC!!!!

I liked it don't know why there were bad reviews though I did just get the chicken eggs Benedict which was enough to feed me a few times as well as being frickin' amazing. Our waiter Paul was really nice and made sure we were happy.  Our food came out really quick and price to quantity to creativity ratio was splendid.  The food was not gourmet quality but most definitely better than iHop or Denny's in my mind and had a unique taste to it due to their "from scratch" slogan. Perfect for a great hangover breakfast that leads to a nap and more drinking then eating all the leftovers when u get home.

We've been here several times and each time is better than the last! The meatloaf is delicious,  but the mashed potatoes will make your eyes roll back in your head! The crabacked are fresh and full of CRAB,  not filler! The fried green tomatoes are light and tasty.  We're stuffed! Again!

Typical hash house. Great food. Huge portions. Terrible service. Super slow and unfriendly. We were sitting for almost twenty minutes before our server asked what drinks we wanted. It took at least fifteen minutes to return and another fifteen to take our order. If it was busy I would understand but it's frustrating when you have family from Hawaii visiting and have to wait over thirty minutes to receive your food. I'll stick to another location.

Had breakfast here twice! Crab Benedict was the bomb!!!  Both meals were amazing!!! First waitress was awesome and very attentive, was hoping to have her again. We ended up with a younger girl who was ok... But over all great experience!

Tasty food! Found this place on Yelp weeks before I came to Vegas. I love going to local joints when I travel. Strong advise you to come here with an empty stomach. Portions are  huge! Waiter was great and helpful. It's near Fremont too, so great time to walk off the calories ;)
Sadly I wasn't impressed. Server wasn't particularly friendly and the food wasn't hot. Definitely didn't live up to what I had heard about the place. Doubt I'll go again.

This place is always busy! It's probably best to get their early unless you're okay with waiting a long time. Wait time varies by location and I think this location probably has the shortest in comparison to the others on the strip. 

I was suggested to visit this spot for their massive plates and I was surprised with how big the portions were! I love chicken and waffles, so I ordered the sage fried chicken and waffles. The server will ask if you want the bacon in or out - of the waffle that is - and I got in. This was such a decadent meal. Four waffles with bacon strips sticking out of them and two huge fried chicken breasts stacked on top and fried leeks garnishing this tower. This plate is big enough to be shared by two, but I dare you to take the challenge and eat it all yourself - after all, this is sin city.

Party of 14 brings you a variety of orders to view! What stands out about this place is their commitment to freshness and making things from scratch. No processed junk here! Their dishes are very tasty and come in large (I mean LARGE) portions!! They have a creative farmhouse-style food blend on traditional dishes. Comfortable ambience, great for small or large groups.

Possibly my favourite place for breakfast in Las Vegas. The friend chicken Benedict is pure perfection. 1 will feed 2, don't believe me? You have been warned. Coffee is good. Service is great. Nice crowd of people. Love it here.

*Note: Order what you definitely want as the serving is HUGE!!! If you can't eat HUGE servings...you can DEFINITELY share it as it can feed 2 people!

I love everything in the menu... it always give me a tough decision when ordering.

This place is amazing! Grab a buddy to share with because portions are huge! We ate here three times on our last trip, it was convenient as we stayed at the Golden Nugget and delicious! One of the best things about this place is they serve my favorite huckleberry vodka all the way from Idaho and it comes in an adorable mason jar you get to take with you.  We tried both fried chicken and chicken fried steak, both were great but the chicken was just slightly better. Try the gravy on both, it's wonderful! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Hands down best breakfast for dinner I've had in years! While celebrating my besties birthday, we checked Hash House out for a quick bite...2 hours later, the entire group was beyond stuffed and had a ridiculous amount of leftovers. The entire experience was great. Our hostess was so sweet to accommodate our large group into several tables and our waitress deserved a medal for her ability to laugh at us and with us!! Drinks, apps, food, extra plates and to-go boxes (along with napkins and disposable silverware). Seems this is a general expectation for a dining experience but all other places were simply put off with our request for disposables or offered at a fee. No joke!!
We will definitely be coming back again!
What amazing unique and delicious food. Portions were huge. One of the best breakfast experiences we've had for awhile and we travel a lot!

This was our second time to a Hash House a GoGo. The first was at the Linq location. We must say the trip to old town to the Plaza location is worth it! The food and the service was great! The casino floor is close and they will text you when your table is ready if there is a wait. Other locations are crowded and the wait is brutal. 

For brunch we had the crab cake Benedict and shared the humongous portion. It was perfect! The biscuit was delicious and we were skeptical about having the mashed potatoes instead of hash browns but as is, is the correct choice. The spicy sauce is ahhhhmazing. We also had to of the mango champagne cocktails. It was good. Very refreshing. 

Service was great and on point. Surely we will be back again when in Vegas.

This location is inside of the Plaza hotel.  We had been walking around Fremont and needed to feed the beast.  It was our first visit to Hash house and had noticed many yelpers pictures of the huge portions.  Needless to say I was going to try it out! 

We were greeted by a very upbeat and spunky hostess.  Upon being immediately seated, our waiter was there to get our drink orders.   I will say their service was top notch and perfect!  Our drinks never went empty and the waiter was the definition of great customer service.   After ordering our food, it was out in the blink of an eye!  

I had ordered the Cobb Salad.  Yes, this huge portion was more than I could handle.  It was definitely something I could have shared.  But the salads flavor and ingredients were just ok.  It was filled with plenty of lettuce but kinda skimped on the toppings.  The ratio was way off.  The chicken that was on the salad seemed to be out of a can.  Bummer.   I would have though they would have seasoned it before putting it on the salad but I was wrong.  

Yes, their servings are enormous but then lack in quality.  Service deserves all of the praise!

This was my 4th time here.............the service is good, the portions are RIDICULOUSLY huge.....and the food is unique. Great place if you are starving for breakfast after a long night and needing to offset a hangover! I have trouble finding many items that I like on the menu, though.....and the novelty of the huge amount of food has worn off.

I was in downtown Vegas for a conference and was stoked to be able to try the Hash House from this location. I have gone to the one in SD many times and wanted to see if they could keep the consistency.

The food was okay. I was a little disappointed. The mashed potatoes and the gravy did not taste fresh, kind of tasted like something that came out of a box. The chicken breast was soggy from the frying. It was meh.

HOWEVER, their Bloody Mary's are off the hook wonderful! If nothing else go for a bloody and same eggs. Seriously, I would go back just for them. (Notice how I am saying THEY) The mix is just the right amount of spice and they don't go easy on the good stuff. The coffee is good ole diner coffee too. So A PLUS on the liquids.

The restaurant is located inside the Plaza Hotel; right in front of the main entrance. This makes it extremely easy to get to, especially if you are wandering up and down Fremont.

Good was good. It's no lie that the portions are huge. They mean it. Unless you're a competitive eater, share. 

The waitstaff was a little lacking. But friendly. We will be back.

We went there after checking Yelp during our trip to Vegas....turned out to be a home run! Crowded waiting areas but was only about 20 minute wait. Food was amazing! Service was good and place was packed on a Tuesday morning.
Great tasting food! Bloody marys are hot and spicy! They have fresh house made strawberry jam ...and it went a home made biscuit. You get a lot of food for a good price.

Had a bit of a wait for our table, but that's to be expected for a holiday weekend.  This location is just like the location on the west side of town.  Good food, good service, and huge portions.  I never leave disappointed.

Food was ok but note not to ask for any alterations on the menu.  Even if u have allergies..they said they could charge me more and put it on the side, I don't care about the upcharge but I don't want a huge bowl of it. She argued with me and said I would piss off the cooks because it's a new system and all her managers were there.  So I asked for a manager and she said they were not avalible.  I'm so confused..I don't want to come back..awkward

If you're in Vegas you definitely have to check out Hash House. The portions are enormous and the prices are just right...

I recommend the tractor combo with the French toast

The food is enough for 2. I ordered the grilled cheese with bacon and tomatoes. It was awesome. The fries were hot and fresh and the spicy bar b que sauce around the plate was spicy. Our waitress Monique was very friendly and attentive. Always making sure we had everything we needed. 
 We don't get to Vegas very often but when we do we always come here for a meal

Was told the wait would be 45 minutes. Wound up being 65 minutes. I'll hold back a star for that. There were 6 of us and we just ordered a bunch of things to get a good sampling of the menu.  The Red Velvet Waffle was the stand out for me. Pancakes and the chicken hash also solid.  A bit pricey, but now with no Dupar's, this is a solid breakfast choice Downtown.  Just be prepared to wait a bit.

The first thing the server told us was that the portions were large enough for two and to keep that in mind when ordering. He was not a liar.

I've seen big flapjacks before, but this one took the (pan)cake. It was not only large in diameter, but thick throughout. We ordered the blueberry flapjack and it overflowed the plate. As big as it was, it did not lack in taste. I especially loved the crispy outside which added a nice texture. Only thing I would have appreciated, considering the size, was two syrups.

We also ordered the Chorizo hash and it was okay. I think the best thing about the dish was the massive biscuit. Would have been nice to have had some jam.

Overall, the food was acceptable. But as for the experience, I prefer to dine without inhaling smoke fumes. I guess that's inherent to dining in a casino, but if you have the option to dine at another location, take it.

The service was awful, it took 15 minutes to get my water and another 10 minutes to order my food. It took a normal time to get my food (about 30 minutes) and its because I had to remind the waiter twice :( and i felt bad nagging him but from the way things were going before I didn't have the time to wait a log time for my food. The food was was pretty decent though.

HUGE portions! I split the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken with my wife and it was more than enough. Even the kids pancake is 14" in diameter.

We're at the Vegas location in the Palace Hotel. The atmosphere is cool and fun.

I'd come back!

Best drinks ever! The super nova, Bloody Mary and kiwi watermelon are winners and the staff are great too. Hearty breakfasts are served so come hungry or share a skillet.  Chicken and waffles are always a treat.
Monique was awesome, true definition of what a server was. Honest with her recommendation and definitely glad I asked! Those hostess could use a pep talk!
Food was ok a little out of the box but creative. Prices seemed a little high but you will not leave hungry.

So disappointed!  My husband and I were seated right away by the friendly hostess but things went downhill from there.  It took 15 minutes for our waitress to acknowledge us and take our drink order.  Then it look 15 minutes just to get those drinks, it was only coffee and water.  Once we ordered our breakfast, it took 35 min to get our food.  I can't say it was our waitress cause someone different brought our food to the table.  From our table we. Hold here the kitchen staff laughing and talking.  Seemed like they were too busy socializing to get the food out in a timely manner.  The food was just ok.  We ordered the corned beef and hash.  I've had much better.  It came with a biscuit on the side which was hard.  It didn't break when I banged it on the table.  When I stuck a knife in it to see if the inside was soft it crumbled into little pieces.  Terrible experience at this location!

HUGE portions and amazing prices! The food is high quality although for those that may have blander taste, it may seem like a strange menu. I would urge you to consider it though because whatever you order is sure to please. My go-to is the quesadilla here and it's large enough for my husband and I to share and feel stuffed full! Highly recommend this place.

Not very busy(Sunday around 5 PM)and overlooks Freemont Street casinos. Service was friendly and very fast. Glad we went to this location instead of Linq location on the strip. We were seated and greeted right away and given our drinks within five minutes. The tea/fresh lemonade is very good!

As for meals, we were naive about the sizes. We can usually eat Cheesecake Factory meals in 1-2 sittings, but these bad boys could feed a family of four(seriously, the bowl of my chicken pot pie was a family-sized serving bowl). Hubby and I both ordered a side salad, which were both the size of 3-4 side salads elsewhere. Could easily be split by 2-4 people, as an FYI. Hubby loved his mixed greens salad with macadamia nuts and said it was unique and the sweet vinaigrette complimentary. My Caesar salad was pretty basic with only four croutons and an over-abundance of manufactured parm cheese. Would have liked more crunch or additions of tomatoes/cucumbers. The four small corn croutons had a stale taste and odd texture. Get a different salad. 

Our son liked his cheese quesadilla(which was very big) and the "fruit garnish" is a slice of orange and cantaloupe. Hubby loved his sage chicken and waffles. The chicken was moist, crispy, and well-flavored white meat. The waffles were fluffy yet crisp. He had a second meal from his leftovers. 

My chicken pot pie tastes similar to chicken and biscuits. They first put down what looks like a huge cracker hat and then fill it with a creamy chicken stew. Lots of veggies, which were fresh and great. Some were undercooked and hard (potatoes and carrots) but it was otherwise tasty. Nothing super unique about the taste of the dish aside from the hat...err...crust. It was delicious, crisp and flaky but a nice chew inside. I would imagine that I will get four meals out of this dish. 

I would go back but go at breakfast and order sage chicken benedict. Breakfast seems to be the star.

Came in a few weeks ago with my sister... the food is amazing!! The portions are huge and again the food is fantastic!!  Well worth having to deal with downtown! The parking at the Plaza is kind of crappy, but that has nothing to do with the restaurant! (just a tip: if you drive a truck, you may want to consider using valet. we didn't and the parking garage is really tight). I will definitely be back, great place to eat, fast service, and great quality food!

Love this place!!! Its always clean and the staff is very nice and helpful. I love the BBBBLT with seasoned fries. I always have to get a to go box!!! My husband gets the griddle eggs and bacon with smashed taters. The taters are very tasty. So worth coming.
If you go to this location of course your going to pay $5.00 for parking. But, if you eat at the Plaza as we did they will validate it and then take it to the main cashier cage and you will get your $5.00 back.

I know Zappos is putting a ton of money into downtown, but no one is really putting out exceptional food downtown.

I had friends in over the Holidays and they are staying at the Union Plaza because they remodeled all their rooms with the furniture that was suppose to go into the fountainbleu, so nice......Super nice rooms!  Got a little pricey around NYE, but room rate next day dropped to 59.00 for a Bellagio quality room.

However...........this was the BEST food downtown by a long shot!  Best food on Property and super nice waiter...Home made tasting food that is quality.  Real veggies  NOT frozen.  We did dinner and three brunches.

Huge portions too!

Did a little Vegas adventure with da' boys and heard them talk so much about this place I had to go. Fast forward 24 hours after a mean night of bar hoppin' and other unmentionable shenanigans  and the Hash House A Go Go was a sight for sore eyes. 
I ordered the corned beef hash with red onion w/two sunny side up eggs, and a large biscuit($14.79)  plus 1 Italian soda($4.49)
The menu and portions of food are impressive. Prices good. Definitely go here the day after'.  I really enjoyed the hash browns and corned beef... the biscuit,,,, a little hard and tasteless. I maybe ate two bites of the biscuit . The rest of my plate was left clean as a whistle... as they say " Finger looking good " 

Hash House A Go Go is located inside the venerable Union Plaza hotel. If your'e budegt minded or blew all your money at the tables stay here and eat here . There's even a Grey Hound bus depot nearby in case you wagered your car and need to get back home hobo style.

This place is always good food but even more of an event..watching the huge portions get hamded out to everyone..the stuffed meatloaf was amazing...the cornbeef sandwich was big.and good too..a bit too much bread tho..a guy we saw had a pancake about 2 feet radius..no joke...

Da bomb...the bees knees, heaven sent, the shiznitz, whatever you want to call it. This places is freakin amazing.  I kept it simple with a regular pancake, eggs, bacon and coffee (what a nerd, I know) and I was pleasantly surprised at how great everything tasted. My wife ordered the chicken and waffles and it was succulent and delicious. The portions are ridiculous, a couple can easily share a plate but I'm not sure you'd want to share though.  The fried potatoes were lightly seasoned, evenly cooked and tasty. The only thing that I had to do a double take on was the corned beed hash...honestly it looked more like shredded pot roast or carnitas than your typical hash. My brother in law ordered it and said it was good, just different from what he expected. Definitely check this place out.

Enjoyed the food. I ordered the tractor driver combo with a pancake. The food came out fast and was warm.  It was actually good. But nothing over the top. It was pretty average. I ordered a mimosa. But the orange juice I. It tasted cheap and made the mimosa pretty weird tasting. The price was good. I would go again. The waitress seemed tired and Uninterested. Not rude but just tired. It wasn't too busy. We went on a Sunday around 8am.
Huge portions...must bring appetite. Andy's Sage Chicken Benedict was awsome...must share cause it's to much for one person. Service was good.

This was our first stop for food in Vegas for the weekend.  It was also our best.  Stopped in Friday evening around 7'ish.  No wait to get in, place was about 3/4's full.  Service was very good.  I ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict.  Food was very good and there was tons of it (like others have said).  One of the people we were with ordered the Meatloaf, I took a bight and it was equally as good.  The wife ordered as house salad for herself and shared off of my plate (and had food left over).  Price is a little high but for Vegas it's reasonable and if you kind of share like we did, it's a good deal.  Total bill for 4 of us with tip was $70 (included drinks/beer too).  Certainly will/would go back again.

Sage fried chicken benedict was the only benedict there, when I asked for regular the server was very rude and told me the only food they have is what's on the menu. The orange juice was mediocre at best and was approximately 6 dollars each ( for OJ!!!) don't go here if you want traditional. The servers were extremely slow and surly.

They say Go Big or Go Home, but Hash House offers everyone the chance to Go Big and Go Bland.

This place offers fun dishes, massive plates, and very little flavor.  They sell themselves as a Midwestern-American eatery.  And the menu is piled up with ginormous plates of meat and carbs in various forms (chicken and waffles, giant burger, chicken and brie sandwich, etc).  The tv show "Man v. Food" helped put this restaurant on the map based on the host's love of the "Chicken Benedict"--which consists of a layer of mashed potatoes with a biscuit, fried chicken, bacon, cheese, spinach, and eggs.  It's huge!  It's famous!  It's okay.  

Every which way you turn on this menu is a dish that should be the greatest thing you've tasted--I mean there's nothing "light" on the menu.  But despite all the carbs and butter and fat on the menu, most dishes are simply decent.  The burger -- flavorless ground beef.  The Chicken Benedict -- surprisingly bland.  The egg scrambles -- fresh, but surprisingly plain.  I seriously want to introduce the kitchen to salt and spices.

I've eaten here several times because of friend's supposed love of the menu, but I just don't get it.  The restaurant lures customers in with the promise of indulging in "meat and potatoes" piled high.  They've got the quantity right, but the flavor is sadly lacking.

Bottom line: Hash House is worth a visit as a culinary curiosity.  But the lack of flavor will prevent most customers from repeat visits.

I came here with my friends after once off them was raging about how good the food was and the giant portions. 
The majority of the food here is fried, so I went for a Cobb salad. My friends ordered bloody Marie's, burgers, pork chops, and chicken and waffles. 
The biscuits with honey were delicious. They were warm and so soft. 
When their plates came out, it was a giant portion garnished with even more food. My salad came out and it was so sad and mediocre, the toppings didn't even cover the lettuce! It didn't even have bacon on it. So I had to order a side of bacon for my meal which was extra. Today I looked up their menu and the salad was supposed to have bacon. I was so disappointed in my meal, especially when the cafe at the Orleans has an even better salad with a much bigger portion of sides for half the price. Oh and bacon isn't extra there.

Stayed at the Plaza Hotel. The first night we were looking for someplace to eat and little did we know that one of the best restaurants on the old strip. We ate here every day we were in Vegas. Delicious comfort food and massive portions. After our first visit we would only order one dish per two people and it was still more than enough. On top of that, the prices were very fair. Had one of the stuffed burgers the first night. It was good, but nothing compared to the meatloaf sandwich I got the following day to help with my hangover. Best meatloaf sammy I've ever had. On our way out, I picked up the eggs benedict. Perfect food for the drive home. My only issue was that it was always pretty crowded and we usually had to wait, avoid the problem and get the food to go.

It was my husbands birthday and he had been pestering me to bring him here so what the birthday boy wants, the birthday boy gets. It was pretty slow, it was a Tuesday night so there were only about 3 other tables occupied. We were seated quickly and our server came out right away.

The menu itself is not very big. For drinks we both decided on the mango iced tea. It was decent but I don't think I'd order it again. I decided to go with the bacon, avocado, cheddar burger, my three favorite ingredients combined, I couldn't resist. After asking for our more than helpful servers opinion, my husband decided to go with the kokomo. About 10-15 minutes later our orders came out, we were surprised to see the fairly large portions. My mouth was watering, longing to take that first bite. As soon as I sank my teeth into my burger I was let down. The burger was so bland, I couldn't taste any seasonings at all. It was a total let down, I couldn't eat half, I politely took the remainder of the burger home only to throw it away. The fries on the other hand were some of the best I've ever had. 

I don't think I'll be stopping by again any time soon. Next time I think I'll try the breakfast to be on the safe side. We had great service and decent food minus the burger.

Yikes!  Went to this location with my son, and we were stunned by the poor performance of the staff. The hostess steered us to sit at the bar (son is 15)...when we reported back that the bar area was for 21 and over, she argued the point.

We were seated under a blown speaker, which was making a terrible racket...we asked the manager for a seating change, she agreed and then never got back to us.

The food was fine, but the poor service and obnoxious broken speaker (why seat someone there?) overshadowed everything.

All of this was relayed to the contact email addresses on their web site, and no response was provided.

Solid pass on this one unless you are seeking incompetence and indifference. I walked in a fan and walked out shopping for new breakfast spot.

Really good food. Excellent, in fact. The portions are huge. Thankfully our server, Bryan, let us know immediately so I could split a meal with my lady. We had the bacon, avocado burger. Excellent. This has become a new must-stop for us when we are in downtown. And we're in downtown a lot.

This place is as crazy as Las Vegas.  The twisted farm cuisine is darn good and the portions are as big as the Grand Canyon.  The staff was great but it did take a while to get all our food.  Could be that they had to go butcher more chickens but it was worth the wait.  I had the meatloaf- darn good.  Others the crazy chicken waffles - also good.  There were no "lunch losers" at our table.  If you want something different and are really hungry- this is the place.  The good news is that I was too full and tired to get in trouble.

Three words:  oversized, overprocessed and overpriced

That really sums it up and there is nothing else to say, but if I don't type more, Yelp won't add this as a review b/c its too short.

No desire to ever eat at Hash House again.

First let me say the food was great. I had a large group from out of town that wanted to eat downtown and I suggested hash hash a go go. When we went to settle up instead if asking for separate checks(pain in the @$!) I asked the waiter to apply cash a a specific amount on my credit card. He made a mistake and charged my card three times the amount. He fixed it and we left giving him a 20% cash tip. To my surprise the initial charge was taken/held from my bank and when calling the manager Leilani she was not pleasant. I am very patient and she interrupted me and basically said call your bank on Monday and they will release the hold. She gave the obligatory I'm sorry but was rude and said we hold 20% on top of the total regardless.. we left our server cash. If you are going to hire people in a management role hash hash make sure they receive empathy training because this manager was void of it! What if I really needed that money over the weekend? Not returning to this location.

I ate here twice on my last visit to Las Vegas and it was really good food. I had a giant waffle and one of their hash scrambles. On my first visit we got there right before brunch was ending and I wanted to order off that menu, but our waiter never came back and then I saw him go over to 2 other tables of people seated after me and then he disappeared into the kitchen. Luckily my boyfriend went and got another waiter to come over with 1 minutes left to order brunch. Very nice waiters, but I would have been very sad if I could not have ordered off that brunch menu. Second trip my food was accidentally given to the table next to me and the man didn't notice so he started eating it! But it was not a big deal because they made me a new one and even took it off our bill - which was very nice since many places only apologize for mistakes and do not comp the meal. Overall the food is great and I would come here to eat again!

The portions are a bit ridiculous but it's so good you don't mind eating it twice.  The wait list was somewhat disorganized and longer than I wanted but once seated, the service was fast and friendly.  I had a Farm Scramble with Ham, Spinach, and Cheddar.  The griddled mashed potatoes were a nice touch.  Next time, I'm going for a Hash and maybe a BLT Bloody Mary.

The brunch spot! If you've never been..I suggest to try this place out asap! I wish they had one here in LA. Their most popular dish is the sage chicken & waffles..a definite must try. They opened a few other HHAGG restaurants but this place has no wait! So if you don't like waiting 45min-1hr..sometimes 2 hr..this one is located inside The Plaza Hotel in Fremont. Good service, place is clean and bomb food.

We went out of our way to try this place, and I felt really disappointed. My biggest complaint was our server Rick. From the second we sat down to the time we left, out experience was completely frustrating. When I asked if the chili sauce on the Crab Cake Benedict was spicy, he put his hands up and said "I don't give my opinion, last time it back-fired". I have never experienced that from a server and we asked if he could bring a side of the sauce to try. He seemed bothered by the request, but brought the sample. It was spicy! I ordered another item and asked for an Orange Juice and Coffee, but forgot both items. I finally got my coffee after I was done with the meal, but we had to leave since we had been there such a long time. The food wasn't anything special and the wait to get in was ridiculously long.

Second time coming to a Hash house and it never disappoints. 
WARNING: you have to come hungry, the portions are huge! 
Part time I ordered the chicken Benedict it was really good. So good in fact that I took a nice long nap right after lol. 
This time I decided to go a little healthier and got a salad, but with their famous fried chicken.  Everything you come to expect from fried chicken,  golden and delicious without being dry.  

If in Vegas abs don't want buffet food but still want a lot of food try this place.  It does not disappoint.

I don't know about this place for most days, but if you're hung the hell over after staying up until 5 or 6 AM on a gambling/drinking binge, I can't think of a better hangover breakfast in Vegas or anywhere else.

The bloody mary was great, was fresh and had plenty of spice.

Half of the table, at the recommendation of Man Vs. Food, got the fried chicken benedict.  This is the ultimate heavy hangover food and, although they could've dialed down the spice in the sauce, was tasty.

The other half of the table tried the chicken and waffles, which were a bit disappointing: the chicken was a bit dry, and the waffles, despite having bacon in the middle, were just ok.  

It was a bit expensive though.  Breakfast for 5 (not everyone got a drink) for $100.  

See a full review and pictures at http://www.bayoucitybites.com/2011/10/viva-las-vegas-hungover-at-hash-house.html
We went here for breakfast on Friday morning. Delicious! Loved the homemade biscuits and jam. The country potatoes were very yummy too!

Definitely a lot more food than a person needs but they do let you know ahead of time how enormous there portions are. Wasn't impressed with the taste of my meal or my husbands. Friendly wait staff, just really long wait time. Prices are great for quantity.
Awesome! Don't need to say anything else but go on an empty stomach. Third time here in 3 years. Can't wait til next year.place is clean staff are nice food is great
I loved it! I will say I kinda went into a little food coma. It was our first time there but I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

Gotta stop here every time I see Vegas! I wish we had one in the DC area! Good service, great food and drink selections. 

Pistachio Mint Iced Coffee 6.99
Electric Blue Lemonade 9.99
Salmon Scramble 13.99
Snickers Pancake 8.99 

43.20 plus tax

We were the Saturday after the 4th and our server completely ignored us! We had to chase down the hosted who then reminded the waiter about our table. 20 minutes after arriving, he shows up with a lame excuse about not knowing we were in his section although he took every order to our left and right. 

Then while waiting for our food, a major fight broke out in the kitchen. I'm not just talking punches, the table closest to the kitchen said someone got cut. A horde of security guards arrived and yellow-taped everything in the kitchen. Then they escorted the bus-boy out. The same guy that had bussed the table to our left (did I mention that they had arrived AFTER us!)

After the free show, our food arrived; one plate at a time. The waiter insisted the kitchen was delayed after the fight and judging from the yellow tape we gave them the benefit of the doubt. 

Then my salad came with bacon, which wasn't on their menu description and to which I have an unfortunate allergy for. So, I had to wait some more for a fresh salad. However, when it arrived, it was amazing. The biscuit melted in your mouth, the salad was crispy and fresh. At our table, we had a couple of dishes. The fried chicken was amazing, the waffles and French toast were favorites, and the ingredients in everything were very fresh. Come hungry though, the portions are NO JOKE!

We were annoyed with the service (they get minus stars; below 0) but the food was top-notch (5+). So average it out to a 2 star experience. Would we come again? I don't know.... maybe we would order out... But might just avoid them all together, at least for a while. 

PS you can get you $5 in parking back if you validate with your receipt. Ask the hostess.

The Cobb salad was big enough for 2 meals. Nice fluffy pancakes and a combo on the kids menu. Decent choices. Marginal service and the wafting of cigarette smoke from the casino. It was convenient. But that's it.
Food is terrific. Portion sizes are huge so we share! Chicken and waffles are an experience all their own, delicious! Pancakes are the size of your head, and so good! A must visit!!
It is a great place for breakfast.  Waited about an hour, but it was worth it.  Large portions of food.  Very friendly staff.

I was taken here by a friend who is a Vegas local. Although I never eat this LARGE. I thought the idea was very cute. 

I ordered the bacon stuffed waffle with fried chicken breast. And it was HUGE. lol. See my pic. The waffle was delicious. Can't wait to try it at home. 

But the chicken breast not so much. My chicken breast kind of bled....!!! How? I can't really say. But it was not cooked through. Maybe the slice was to BIG but after seeing a little blood I was done. 

He waiter (I forgot his name) but he was kinda blunt and didn't really care that often times we were trying to signal him. He joked about the water being from some local lake. I didn't find it too funny because it tasted like it was from the toilet!!! 

I would MAYBE try them again just for the sake of changing this review.

We went to the one at the Plaza in old town because we called the one at the Linq and it was an hour+ wait. We sat right down at this location. For all the hype I wasn't that impressed. There was a lot off food but none of it was amazing. The food is like what you'd expect at a standard diner restaurant. But it wasn't crazy expensive and it came out quick for the size of our party. My wife's french toast was the best thing on the table imo.

This is like the cheesecake factory of vegas for brunch...there are no surprises in ingredients or chef skills here, but it gets the job done!  

I knew portions were going to bigger than normal so I ordered on the healthier side.  The artichoke, mushroom hash was subbed with egg whites and fruit instead of potatoes at no extra cost!

I also had some of my hubby's chicken and waffles which is a highly recommended item since its their best seller.  The waffles are stuffed with bacon..and I liked that they used sage with their chicken.  really nice crunch and batter.

The food here was delicious (breakfast). However the service was so so. Our waitress had an attitude whenever we would ask for something. I asked for my eggs over-medium and not runny but they were runny. The homemade jam was delicious!
This is a great little restaurant if you want to upgrade from a Dennys or IHOP.  Great food and decorum.

AVOID THE FRIED ANGEL HAIR GARNISH! Which comes with the lunch and evening entrees. 

I saw a photo of a giant waffle and had to have it! It was only served during breakfast and brunch hours though. The prices are really high for being inside the Plaza casino. The portions are big and their food is unique. I never had fresh squeezed tangerine juice before and it was sweet, not too tart. My BF said the chorizo hash was spiced just right and was one of the best breakfast items he's had.

I love hash house!  But, this was by far my worst experience!  Took forever for our waitress to get to our table. Ordered coffee and wasn't brought anything to stir it, my fork was dirty, our food was luke warm.  There wasn't any butter or jam, asked an employee for some (since our waitress didn't check on us) and he kept wiping down a table and then went and got it. Overall really bad service. Not the amazing experience I have had in the past.

The novelty has worn off....too many locations....too meh of flavors.... Portions still huge, but paying $14 for a giant pancake, eggs and some bacon is pretty deceiving.... Service ok for a weekday.....  Im still trying to figure out WHY go in the Plaza.... I mean friggin urine stained plaza...... wow....somebody got paid big bucks....

anyhow....its always worth trying once.....Definitely need a menu upgrade....

This restaurant is located in the Plaza Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas. The food here is amazing! The portions are gigantic! My favorite dish was the chicken and waffles. If you wake up with a hangover, this place will definitely cure you! I can't imagine how unhealthy the food may be, but it is freakin' delicious!

The service however, could've been better. Our server looked like he wasn't enjoying his job very much. But whatever, the food was great.

WARNING: Do not order your own dish and expect to eat the whole thing. The portion are extremely large. One dish could fill 1-3 people up, depending on how much they can eat.

So glad we went to HH for dinner, but almost didn't because of the breakfast/lunch description. They do dinner quite well. As far as we could tell, it's like some hipsters took over Denny's and added an interesting beer list. 
I had the meatloaf, and regret to say I couldn't finish it. It was the best meatloaf I've had, but enough to feed a little-league team. I did crafts with the rosemary spear and spaghetti pieces as an added bonus. The side veggies--carrots & green beans were tasty and well cooked. The meatloaf sits on top of pan-fried mashed potatoes and is smothered in gravy. I loved it. 
The other dish was the sage/bacon chicken & waffles. Also too much for one; it arrived with ample, moist ("real") fried chicken, bacon in the waffles and a few strands of green onions. The chicken & bacon were finished, but a waffle or two didn't fit. Judged: very good. 
Be careful what and how much you order. The mains are splittable from what we saw. 
Great beer list with several varieties rated 90%+ on the beer sites. The soundtrack on the house system even played the Pixies and other 90s indie rock. 
We're planning to go back for breakfast.

First experience: waitress was not informed we were seated. Long wait. Then we dealt with shift change. Long wait. New shift prepared a small version of the #1.
Second experience: I went to dinner and had the ribs with the horse radish in the mashed potatoes. Unfortunately my first bite was almost entirely horse radish. When I mentioned it to the waiter he replied," I'm sorry, that's how we prepare it". Ribs were a  disappointment too.

We had breakfast here this morning.  Portions are large so if you go with someone who wants the same item as you, share if you can.  We had tangerine mimosas and absolutely delicious.   Give them a try the next time you're in Vegas.

We've been dying to try this place ever since seeing it on Man Vs Food. It was good, not the best, but good. The services wasn't great. Front hostess was snooty. Our server lagged and had no personality. The servings are huge! We ordered traditional bacon and eggs, with one pancake and a side of potatoes. It was more than enough for us two (women) and we didn't finish it all! My Bloody Mary was tasty too.

My partner and I decided to eat here because of the happy hour from 3-6pm (also convenient since we were staying at the hotel). The main menu is average price for Vegas $20+/entree, but during Happy Hour you can get a whole bucket of deliciously spiced chicken for only $5..What a Deal! The $5 Bacon Mac n Cheese is currently on my top 3 mac n cheeses ever! So Good! 

If you're looking for a delicious relaxing place to eat that's not too crowded, check it out! And their $3 well drinks are a plus!

I like this location.  It's located right next to the dome entrance in the Plaza Hotel.  If they seat you near the entrance, you can see out onto the street.  Great people watching.  Not as impressive as a space upstairs that overlooks the Fremont Street Experience, but pretty good.

Also, you can get breakfast here anytime.  They will only serve the eggs scrambled after a certain time, even on a eggs benedict.  But still, if you want breakfast but didn't wake up until noon, its a good option.  Definitely try the chicken eggs benedict.  It comes over one of their fresh made biscuits. A little spicy and oh so yummy!

Yes, the portions are huge.  But guess what?  One person does not have to eat it all. To go boxes or sharing are both options.  And the best part?  Free wi-fi! Definitely a fan of that.
Food was delicious, portions are huge, staff was friendly.  I had the pan seared chicken and I would definitely recommend it. I can't wait to go back and try something different.

Think about splitting a plate. Orders are Huge.

Located inside of the Plaza hotel, this location is somewhat small. I can see how this place can easily get packed on a busy day. I even spied a rack of those waiting pagers restaurants give you along with a 45 minute wait time.

Luckily for us we were here on a Wednesday morning and we were immediately seated. My boyfriend & I ordered Andy's sage fried chicken wondering if it would be enough. 

The dish was very attractive when it came to our table about 10 minutes later. Sage fried chicken with a maple reduction on top of bacon which was on top of mashed potatoes. There were 2 eggs and a biscuit on the side. It was served with jam & butter.

Everything was really tasty, but not to the point where we were thinking "Woah, we need to come back here the next time we're in town!". It was more like, "Cool. I've been wanting to try this place since I saw it featured on that show. Not bad.". Still, the price of one dish that could serve 2 people was not bad by Vegas standards.

Large portions of delicious and wholesome comfort foods. This location never has a line when I've been at the Plaza. The only problem I encountered was that wait staff response time is a little longer than other Hash House locations in the valley. I think I waited about 10-12 min before anyone came to collect my check and credit card when it came time to pay. Because of that I'm deducting a star. Otherwise no major complaints because this place is great

Here we go ... 
I tried three dinners and even though it is a lot of food , nothing is great . This is over a period of time since they opened in San Diego . 
The pastrami sandwich was not good and is now off the menu , the famous meatloaf is not good at all , and the sage chicken is over-hyped in the press. 
   This is a very well hyped restaurant , so you will try it out for sure .... but will you be back ???

Love this chain! After a year's hiatus, had dinner here after listening to "80s Station" bang out some tight, clean 80's classics. 

The fried Salmon with carrots & griddled potatoes was the bomb. Perfectly cooked with a light crispy corn meal coating. Portions are always huge here, so it usually takes a bite out of the cost (still "reasonably" priced by Vegas standards...). Come here for bkft, but the whole menu is available all day!
if you are into not being served when it is slow. This is the place for you. never tried the food walked out after 20 minutes of no service

Wow! I loved this place! The chicken pot pie was outstanding, the salad was fresh and the service was amazing. We are coming back to eat here again it was so good. It was like having a home cooked meal. If you visit Vegas you must come down here to eat. You will not be disappointed. Now I need somebody to wheel me out. I am so full.

This location is inside the Plaza Hotel in downtown Vegas. I would've given it 3.5 stars but not allowed. The burger was HUMUNGOUS!! The meat was hanging waaayyy off the bun! I had the #5 with bacon, avocado, and cheddar! Yummy! The chicken and waffles were also good! The Electric Lemonade was ok. I think the one on the strip is better.

After watching Man V. Food- Las Vegas, I knew that this breakfast experience was going to be like no other. And oh-my-gawd... the food and the portion could easily feed a village.  The entrees were enormous (3 people barely finished 1!!!), and the flavors were just as bold.  I now understand why Adam looked like he died and gone to heaven, because the twisted food was beyond amazing. 

Ordering Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict was a no brainer since it was the focal point on Adam's trip. And boy, it was nothing short of steller. The nutty corn-flake breading and thick creamy gravy over the bed of mashed potatoes and buttery biscuit was lethal.  It belongs in it's own category. Deadly, but totally worth it!

food was great. i just had the basic breakfast. i am from Indiana originally so i had to eat here no matter what. i have been hearing about this place for a while.  i stayed at the Plaza for the weekend and totally didn't even know i was staying in the hotel with the Indiana restaurant.  only probably was that was a non smoking restaurant that is in the middle of a smoking casino and has no walls separating it.  weird. service was very strange too.  they didn't seem to care too much about anything.

What becomes a legend most? If you have ever heard anyone mention Hash House A Go Go, it's usually followed by exclamations of the portion sizes. Not the delicacy of the, well anything. You'll never hear anyone praise the chef. And you'll probably be looking at someone who the word "Sansabelt" is usually proceeded by, "where are the..?" I'll just say it, this place is for fat people who are probably cheap but think they're too good to go to a buffet. Or their too lazy to make the eight trips back and forth to get the same amount of food you'll get on one entree here. Or too embarrassed. 

My uh food was ostensibly an egg Benedict. I think Benedict Cumberbatch was buried somewhere between the potato farm and the layers of some weird cheese pancake that was covered in the exact same chipotle they serve at ISIS training camps to get new recruits to hate infidels. "Eat so you can taste the hell that is the American Southwest! Death to America!" I totally would understand after eating this. 

Wait. There's more! It's 110 in the shade but the chef/menu committee decided to remind us that somewhere it's Christmas. How? You ask. By impaling a 7ft Norwegian pine smack dab in the middle of my food. And probably poor Benedict Cumberbatch buried in the goo. Who does that? Why? Norway should revoke the visas of anyone currently terrorizing their pine forests. Have some national pride. Don't let Hash House ruin people's memories of your...hmm...ok, you have nothing. 

But I digress. This gawdawful concoction had so many levels of early 21 st century cliches that it should be cited as non ada compliant as there's no elevator to get from top to bottom. Did I mention the tree in the middle of it all? Oh. I did. The "gravy"... Chipotle is not to be used on non combatants according to the Geneva convention. That's been standard since the war in Grenada. If Rumsfeld should be on trial the person who created this time culinary bomb ought to be in the docket right next to him. Hell, I'd spend the night with Dick Cheney and his mean straight daughter rather than eat this again. 

Oh yeah. There's chicken in here somewhere but I never got near it. After a portion of potatoes that could have saved half of Ireland during the famine I was too full to get poor Benedict Cumberbatch to move over to let me power up the ol' chainsaw and cut off a piece of the  Flintstone size buzzards breast. Sorry. So very sorry.

Ended up here twice on the last trip to Vegas cuz it was in the hotel (The Plaza) & I'd enjoyed HHAGG before.

Second morning in Vegas, ordered "The Basic" with eggs over medium , bacon, griddled mashed potatoes, biscuit & side of gravy.

Breakfast came out with cubed potatoes & when I pointed it out, the runner promptly brought out a side of the smashers...not very griddled but whatever, they were delicious.

Biscuit was a little dry so I was glad I had the gravy for dunking. It also came with marmalade which was pretty tasty.

Breakfast was decent & more than I could eat...this being HHAGG and all.

Dinner the next night was Sage Fried Chicken & Waffles
(Two sage fried chicken breasts with hardwood smoked bacon waffle tower, hot maple reduction and fried leeks)

Chicken was tender & juicy with a nice fried crust. It's not boneless...in case that's a make or break for you.

The waffles had a crispy crunch with a fluffy center and BACON!) but needed more syrup, which I got right away upon on request. The syrup reduction tasted more like teriyaki...I wasn't a fan of that or the leeks but that's just me.

Again, too much to eat.

For both meals service wasn't too attentive. They kind of just take your order, check back once shortly after food is served, let you eat your meal then drop off the check. Not a deal breaker for a casino hotel restaurant.

All in all both meals were tasty but I think the main appeal of HHAGG is the huge portions & I'm more of a nibbler. Large servings & buffets are lost on me.

That being said, try it out, the food IS good & if you love hearty portions, THIS is your place.

Here in Vegas for a wedding 
Had to stop at this place before leaving 
It's worth the wait 
Good service along with big portions

With a name like Hash House, you'd think the hash would be the best. It's okay... think of it as machaca without the scrambled eggs. It's shredded beef over potatoes and cheese. Like I said, it was okay. Ironically, they do serve machaca, so I bet it's probably pretty good since the shredded beef was good.

The biscuit and fresh strawberry preserves were oh so good... and the portion was big enough to share.  In fact, all the portions were too big. My kids' pancakes were ridiculous. It was the size of my three year old's chest and impossible for him to finish.

For the price, it was a relative bargain: 5 adults, 3 kids, $80.00. Nice.

Went here mainly because my boyfriend and I were craving some chicken and waffles. Super large portions, good price, food tasted pretty good too. The restaurant itself was pretty home-y (although it could have gone better if the tables didn't resemble medical tables, but I'm just nit-picking here), and our server made sure we felt right at home. The reason for the three stars is that I've only tried one dish, but I will be coming back!

Had breakfast here for our last day in Vegas.  This place was recommended by our friends from Alaska . We had the Man vs Food breakfast special... it was excellent! Service was a little slow but once they Took our order they were attentive after that! I would definitely come back and recommend this place to everyone that is by the Fremont area in Vegas.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon. We didnt have to wait for a table, which was great, since I hear the strip location gets packed.  I had the chicken and waffles.  They use the bacon waffle with 2 fried chicken breasts and leeks.  The waffle was great, but the fried chicken was boring.  Definitely needed to be seasoned better.  Tasted like they just dredged it in a little flour and fried it.  Stick with just the bacon waffle and you'll be good.  All portions here are enormous, so its a good place if you're hungry.

We always have to end our trip here before going home.  Best location of theirs to go to in Vegas.  No wait.  Friendly service.  Fast and always accommodating.  

About 15 min north from the strip (we came from Bellagio)

Definitely worth the trip!!!

My favorite thing to get here is the saged chicken Benedict...  Yummy! But instead of scrambled eggs I get them over easy.

i know most people have an epic weekend of drinking when they go to vegas... this time i had a pretty epic weekend of stuffing my face.

we stayed at the plaza in downtown las vegas and right there in the lobby was a hash house a go-go. i've heard about this place and was stoked that i was finally going to get to try it out. (they've even been featured on man vs. food) 

we get there for breakfast and i know i need to get hash... i mean... right??? they had a million things that looked delicious, including an array of mimosas and the biggest and most garnished bloody mary i've ever seen.  we decided to start with some mimosas.... my bf had the pineapple for about a minute when we realized he actually ordered tangerine, and i had a cranberry. luckily we made the smart decision to split a meal - the portions are unreal. we got the chorizo hash with a side of biscuits and gravy and bacon. 

 after a mix-up with somehow being charged an additional $580 on our room, the concierge gave us a $50 coupon to be used anywhere in the hotel. so the next day.... back to hash house!

after swooning over the 1lb burgers the previous day, we decided to split again. we went with the burger that was stuffed with mashed potatoes and bacon. we added some cheddar cheese and decided to get their house salad with cucumber dressing (yum!) and macaroni and cheese and fries (which we at least shared with friends).  everything was fantastically messy and delicious. somehow we devoured 99% of the meal, minus some burger droppings.... and felt disgustingly full for the drive back to reality.

Are brunch here today and while I enjoyed the food, my bud did not like the egg white spinach  (it smelled funny). Overall service and waiter were excellent. My big complaint was it was hot. Awesome military discount of 25% so that was sweet.

I love this place. I normally go to the one I'm San Diego Ca, so I was pleased to see this one in Vegas. Never a bad time here, the food is GREAT, portions are huge, and the drinks are delicious. 
 I always get the Sage fried Benedict when I go there , it is a meal fit for. Queen.

My first time here! I was really excited to try it, since i've heard nothing but great things!

First of all the service was EH, she forgot my boyfriend's beer, messed up his food order, she never came back to see how we were doing after we received our food, never refilled our waters, and never put a smile on her face. She was not friendly at all. Ruined the experience a bit. 

When the food came out, it was huge! Everything had potatoes, and a huge mound of them! Out of the 4 of us not a single person finished them. Felt bad for wasting all the food. Looking at everyone else's plates around the restaurant, theirs were full too, super wasteful :( 

I also didn't get the colored spaghetti noodles sticking in everyone's food? I bit into one of them on accident, yuck!

This location is much better than other locations. The waffle with bacon is excellent. The service is a lot faster here. I give this place ten stars. I've been here almost five or six times. Each and every time it was worth it.
Great atmosphere, great food, great portions, great service... Best breakfast I had in Vegas overall! Chicken and waffles are Amazing!!!!!!!

Hash House a Go Go is one of the top brunch spots in Las Vegas, specializing in massive portions of fresh from the farm food with unique culinary twists. And ever since it's feature on Man v. Food, it's become a destination spot for curious foodies like myself. So I couldn't resist this and made then my first choice for breakfast when staying downtown.

After much deliberation of the many wonderful-sounding breakfast items, I went for the item they tout as their best-known item, and the one that was featured on Man V. Food - the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict. It consists of a HUGE sage fried chicken breast, fresh spinach, hardwood smoked bacon, tomato, mozzarella, chipotle cream and scrambled eggs, served on a bed of mashed potatoes and a split biscuit. Eyeing the portions of the other dishes - the biscuits and gravy are insanely huge - I knew I was in for a challenge. 

This thing was RIDICULOUSLY HUGE - see the picture I included. And everything was, for the most part, excellent. However, I really couldn't taste the sage in the fried chicken all that much. Everything gets piled together and mushed together after a few bites. Also, the biscuits were a bit hard and there wasn't enough sauce for them soften up, so they were mostly discarded. 

Still, I ate about 90% of the plate, and promptly put myself into a food coma. My plans to go over to the Nugget for poker were delayed by a slight nap and digestion period. This is a great foodie "destination spot" and somewhere that you can literally split a plate between two people and both be completely full. I can only imagine the amount of food they throw out here.

This was an okay experience at best... I got the meatloaf sandwich... Way too big... But I guess that's what they specialize in oversize food... I might try it again... Service and the attitude of the employees was terrible... Typical restaurant inside the Hotel/ Casino... It was Halloween morning... But the employees are true zombies... The manager Cory was nowhere to be found...  Could not get refills on coffee or water... What kind of hash house doesn't refill coffee... The two hostesses were oblivious to the bad service. Instead they were in an in-depth personal conversation with each other...

It was also obvious my server Mandy did not want to be there....

And I said I would try it again... Definitely not this location... Maybe try the one that caters to locals....

I love going to this place for breakfast. I don't normally like pancakes, but I always order pancakes from them. They have options for both meat eaters and vegetarians, which can be rare sometimes. Keep in mind, the portions are huge, so we usually split an order. 

The reason I'm not giving this location a five star review is because the service can be pretty bad. The last time we went, we received our check, and she never came back to take it from us. Luckily we paid in cash and did not need change. Most of the servers don't seem very happy to be there. I have only gone to the Hash House in this location, so maybe other locations are better about this.

My friend and I decided to give HHAGG yet another chance and this trip was the deciding factor I will never eat there again. 

Service was HORRIBLE, 
1. Waitress dragged her feet walking to the table, didn't even get greeted for at least 5 minutes, looked like she was still half asleep, didn't smile, NOO customer service at all. 

2. Asked to start off with two waters, started to also ask for a Bloody Mary, she walked away before we could get the words out, even when we tried to grab her attention. (Fastest she moved all morning) 

3. When she finally returned with waters I asked what types of vodkas she had, she didn't know, my date literally got up and walked to the bar to check it out, because waiting for her would have taken to long. 
 
3. I asked for extra olives in my BLT Bloody Mary, was told no because there was no way to charge for it.... I didn't really think my request was to out of line but moving on. 

4. Received my Bloody Mary, asked for worchestire sauce, she replied, ooo I don't know if I can get that.... Again... What?!?!? 

5. Asked another server for worchestire sauce... Never came. 

6. At one point the server said I'm sorry I worked until 1 last night and then was rescheduled at 8 this am. And while I understand that this situation sucks, I didn't make the schedule, or come to a place of business to receive slow, bad service. (She told all her tables this sob story) 

7. My food came out cold. At this point I knew my date was already at wits end so I decided not to say anything else. But it wasn't even like sort of warm, it was cold. 

8. When we mentioned our dissatisfaction to the manager he kind of seemed lost and confused. He did offer to comp two bloody Mary's (which we later had to have removed from the bill because our waitress charged us for them) 

9. Our waitress never even came by to check if everything came out well after our food was delivered. 

10. I unfortunately did not get the food runners name. But he was the ONLY part of this visit that was a positive experience, when he brought out the food he was happy energetic asked if we needed anything else, he also cleared our plates when we were finished. And I had asked him for the manager he actually came back to the table to tell me he notified the manager, and came back a second time to double check the manager came by. (With no disrespect, he was the African American food runner for the morning shift on 11/16/2013, he would make a great waiter) 

Again, this was the last time I would eat at hash house, worst dining experience by far.
Awesome food. Very nice servers. The homemade strawberry jam was incredible. Killer pancakes!

This is a must when in Vegas, I've found this location to be the least busy I've always managed to get right in. Food is amazing and portions are enough to feed Africa.I recommend getting a bacon waffle because bacon makes everything better. While the mimosas are pricey they don't skimp on the alcohol,I also love the electric lemonade. Haven't had a bad meal or experience yet,I look forward to the next time!!!!
Amazing hash.   Fresh preserves for the mile high biscuits:)  Great Breakfast off Freemont street.

No lie at all, this is for sure one of my favorite places that I've ever eaten. We went twice on our trip and was so happy. The first time my husband ordered the meatloaf breakfast and I ordered Andy's sage chicken Benedict. The Benedict was the coolest dish. You'll see the picture in a second. It was enough to feed four. The meatloaf tasted yummy. . The second time we were smarter and shared a breakfast quesadilla with chorizo. There were leftovers. Hahaha. It was huge! I wish I could give this place more stars. I seriously have no complaints about  the service or food.

Kicks traditional breakfast up 100 notches. So good, different if you choose and a fair price. Location cannot be beat. Plaza hotel has come so far pretty fast. Check it out and avoid the overpriced buffets downtown. A much better deal.

Great service and great food. The only downfall is the ventilation. Casino smoke seeps into this cute cantina. Food was big portions but a little pricey. My partner got the BLT but what made it so high were the lettuce cups they put on the bread.  The pancakes are falling off the plate huge and I got a bowl of oatmeal that was big enough to feed the three bears that also came with a side of fruit to make a fruit salad. If you are staying there it's a good way to start your day if you want to be full. The nitro coffee is great but the regular coffee sucked.  They could also use a better sound system.
Great service, HUGE good food - really creative.  Found by accident, would totally return

So I was pretty disappointed at Hash House A Go Go. How can you go wrong with breakfast items.  You can when everything is a mess and there is no flavor. sigh

Ordered coffee: taste burnt/old sitting there
Scramble eggs with bacon, avocado and Swiss cheese with crispy potato: They literally mean SCRAMBLE. Everything was just toss together. I like my food neatly separated. And it's not like I ordered an omelette. The crispy potato was soggy with no Flavor what so ever.
Hash Smoked Salmon with sunnyside up eggs with crispy potato: The smoked smoke has such a lite tip of smoke, the potato was the same soggy and flavorless. 

When it comes to food I devour my plate like a wild animal with a piece of meat. But at this place I only took a few bites and didn't want to eat anymore. 

I do like that fact that the portion is big but if it doesn't taste good it doesn't matter if it's big or small.

Wasted my time and spending $30ish for breakfast. That's a No No..

We had a great breakfast here and food was very good.
Waite staff, was very polite and friendly. 

The young man "Alfy" our server 

Had a great cheerful attitude,  explained the menu and was very attentive. .....I was nice to see this young man take his job seriously and having fun.

More servers could learn from him...

Great place to eat....

My boyfriend and I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning at 11am. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait, which was totally reasonable and I'm sure shorter than what the wait would've been elsewhere, but we decided to eat at the bar and were promptly served. My BF ordered the pork tenderloin Benedict and I got the HH original Benedict. Both were amazing (and HUGE)! The roasted red pepper cream on the original Benedict reminded me of shakshuka (which I love). We would definitely both go back!
The service was weak. The food too salty and the eggs slimy. The ice tea was so bad I sent it back. I'll never eat here again

Good place to blow $15 on a tasteless and disgustingly large pancake full of sad little dried out blueberries. If you request real maple syrup, they will say yes and then bring you artificially flavored and colored corn syrup anyway.

Got the sage chicken & waffles with 2 friends, one of my friends also got the sage chicken & waffles.  Now we are both sick with a fever.  The food looked disgusting too, not very tasty, this place blows.

Loved this location and how it wasn't congested like the one at the Linq. I was able to be seated right away and our waiter was extremely pleasant. It was busy but it wasn't a chaotic busy. Food came out quick and it was okay. I ordered a dish that had egg whites scramble with salmon....I didn't like the salmon but it wasn't the worse thing I've ever tasted! I'll go back!

Ben  "Awesome food. Huge portions. The cornbread sandwich was very good as was the portobello mushroom burger. Only thing keeping it from a five star was the service. Friendly but we didn't see her very often. All in all a good experience."

Rachael was right on top of things when it cam to stuff we needed. I got the chicken fried steak again and Randy got the bbq chicken sandwich. As always way to much food to eat in 1 sitting. YUMMY!!!!
I INCLUDED SOME PICKS FROM TONIGHT'S DINNER. 

You definitely can't go wrong eating here. And the prices are reasonable too
Over rated.  Food was average overpriced 3 dollars for a cup of average coffee. Service was very good that was the only plus here. Don't waste your time here

Larry was our server. Please change stations. I'd even wait an extra 20 minutes to do so. How can a place of "hash house" dare call country potatoes has browns. Are you kidding me? When a customer orders you probably shouldn't assume they want something other than what they actually ordered. Over priced half wits!

Huge portions - not sure why half orders are not offered as we saw a lot of food waste.  Their entrees are large enough for 2-3 people (even in my tipsy state my husband and I barely finished one order of chicken and waffles)! Food was tasty, service was fast and friendly and it's got a great atmosphere.

Not only are they generous with the food portions - the alcohol too! My mimosa tasted only of champagne with barely any OJ lol.

I forget what our dish was called but it was the combo breakfast with banana French toast. The portion was large but not crazy large. But it did feed two people. It was really good. They serve the banana hot in the French toast and it's still in its peel which is good actually bc the banana didn't get brown or slimy during cooking heat. The eggs has some brown spots from overcooking in my opinion and the French toast was a little soft and either needed more egg or more heat or both. All that being said it was still a great meal. And we had 25% off a food purchase of $25 or more and our food was under $20 but with non alcoholic drinks it was $35 and the waitress took our coupon which made me happy.  Ambiance is ok. Plaza is kinda eh and the restaurant feels fairly chain-like but overall a good time and good meal. Great coffee drinks but we paid for it $$ at $7 and $8 a pop.

Well hash house you've managed to seriously disappoint me again. Thought I'd try to give it a chance seeing as its been 3 years later. I thought maybe the service would improve but I guess I was wrong. This place has got to have the world's worst service. I'm starting to think this is one of those jag restaurants that purposely has really, really, REALLY bad service. Rude waitresses that absolutely forget about you once sit down. This time I was also disappointed in my food as well....I've decided the only thing worth eating here is the brown sugar banana pancake. Sure your portions are big but when your foods only so-so what's the point of super sizing it?!? Seriously though, WPRST. SERVICE. EVERRRRR!!! If anything, I'd recommend that you call and place and get it to go.

Lo triste del downtown  las vegas tu dinero se evapora  con el precio de los restaorantes fuimos a comer alliy gran decepcion esperaramos 45 minutos por una hamburguesa de  21 dollares con el jugo pagamos 42 dollars y llevabamos 5 dollares de descuento .el camarero era bien amable le dimos 5dollars de tip yo enferme del estomago toda la noche en el bano y mi amigo decia vamos a un buffe .solo encontramos hamburguesas en el downtown las vegas .muy bien para aquel que tiene costumbre de ese tipo de comida .nos fuimos al hotel rio alli comimos en el buffe por 30 dollares y ademas salimos muy complacido definitivamente nunca mas comere en el dowtown .

Great food and drinks. Very interesting and unusual menu. Reasonable price for quality.

Service was a tiny bit slow, but maybe it was just me.

My absolute favorite breakfast place in Vegas! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. This is a must every time I visit Vegas. 

Always has great service. Sometimes you'll need to wait, but boy is it worth it. I usually get the chicken and waffles and they are to die for! Melts in your mouth. The presentation is beautiful and I had to snap a pic of it before eating because it was so beautiful.

Service was great!! We were going to order two orders of the chicken and waffles but the waiter recommended us getting just one because the portion was huge. That was nice of him!!!
