Waffles were thick and amazing, the chicken was nice and crispy but I like it seasoned so I added some salt and pepper. Also, I had a mimosa and that too was great. I would come back once more.

Visiting Las Vegas again, and decided to stop at this restaurant for breakfast/brunch before our long drive home. It was absolutely delicious, as always. I had the chicken and waffles, and hubby had the bacon burger. (It's a little pricy, but you're in Vegas) Okay, what you need to know, is that the portions are HUGE. They are shareable for two. The other thing, if you think Starbucks coffee is strong- this place out does them!!!! Their coffee is high octane... And you'll be on a caffeine rush for two days, lol, if not more!  (Maybe ask for 1/2 cup, so you can add milk and some hot water) If you like black coffee, you'll be in heaven. Our waitress was very pleasant, and service was great, as always.  We will definitely be back when we're in town again. Thanks for the good eats!
Ordered the chicken and waffles. SO AMAZING. Our waitress was super sweet also! Awesome service and amazing food!

Come hungry. Huge portions.

I found this on Yelp and was craving a big breakfast.  I was NOT disappointed.  My husband loved it and he is a big breakfast critic.  This was beyond big portions and everything was not only cooked excellently but the presentation was well done as well.

My kids could not finish anything, btw.  So I strongly suggest you order 1 item for kids to share.

But this is a great breakfast spot!
Brown sugar banana pancake was AMAZING!!!!! I also tried the Snickers pancake which was just okay....

The Plaza may be a bit run down (and smelly... whatever they use to "mask" the cigarette odor, just stop), but Hash House is worth coming here! It isn't as busy as the other locations, and they are super friendly. I had friends that came into town, and they allowed them to sit down first so they could surprise me when I got there! We even had a few extra people, and they brought us another table so we had the room.

Food is delicious, but be prepared for huge portions. I was only able to eat about half of my biscuits and gravy. Did I mention that they came with mashed potatoes?! Just about all of my favorite foods rolled into one. My friend got the chicken and waffles, which got a huge thumbs up. My 4-year old goddaughter got the cheeseburger off the children's menu and it was the size of her head! Deliciously seasoned fries.

The only con was that we had given the waitress cards and cash, and asked for cards to be run first. We should have had $10 left over in cash, which would have been part of her tip. Unfortunately, she decided not to bring our change back, and we had to ask for it. Shady trick. She got tips anyway from all the card holders, but she could have had more if she just did the right thing.

My family had been going here for years - this last trip the service was beyond bad and the food was mediocre at best - I tend to not leave bad reviews after only one bad trip and many good but the response I received from management via email after not getting anywhere with the supposed manager onsite was to imply I was lying about the length of time it took for our order, original beverage orders and subsequent refills and the actual meal itself - when I responded to that was suggested I go elsewhere and that he serves a number of people a week without incident - after reviewing other yelp reviews it seems that something is going on there and they indeed have a problem.  So beware - there are not that many similar restaurants on Fremont and as our Vegas trips always include at least a day on Fremont we will be looking for another standard to eat at - have visited three to four times a year for about 6 years - I even took a group of 20 here for a birthday breakfast I loved it that much!  Too bad!  We visited August 7th around the noon hour.

This place is insane. Everything is huge. Can we just about the sage fried chicken Benedict specifically ? I was starving when I sat down but as soon as the plate came out I instantly became overwhelmed. It has more layers than Shrek !!! Biscuits bacon fried chicken mashed potatoes eggs all smothered in this amazing chipotle cream. Topped with a tiny "twisted" little strawberry. This plate was featured on man vs food, and now I know why !!  I'm a little upset that they don't provide wheelbarrows to help me to the car !!!

I had heard so much about Hash House, I had to make a stop while staying downtown recently.  Busy at breakfast time, but we were able to get a seat right away at the counter. The portions are enormous, but I'll admit the flavors let me down a little. Everything was good, but I had really expected something really memorable. I had the Meatloaf Hash, which I couldn't finish - and that doesn't happen often! - I would have liked a richer flavor in the Meatloaf, but it was still good, which chunks of Potatoes, Onion, Pepper, and topped with a Sunny-Side-Up Egg (my choice) it made for a heavy breakfast. I also couldn't resist trying the BLT Bloody Mary. I don't like Bloody Marys, and I didn't particularly like this one, but it had plenty of kick, and a full Leaf of Lettuce, slice of Tomato, and thick slice of Bacon. Not a cheap beverage, but when am I ever going to have the chance for one of those again!? I still think it's a "bucket list" restaurant, but don't over-hype your expectations, and you'll be fine.
seriously gorgeous food, and tastes amazing!  Staff could be a bit more friendly, but the food makes up for it

For a place with hash in the name, you'd think that they offer hash browns... spoiler alert, they don't. 

I know that's not the same type of hash, but this place just wasn't my cup of tea. The stuff offered was just a bit too over the top and the wait was REALLY long to get seated. Not your traditional breakfast or lunch place... if you are in the mood for some off the wall dishes this is your place.

From 6/2/16 

Came to Hash House A-Go-Go because we heard so many good things about it, plus we were hungry and this looked like the place to be. 

We were seated, looking through the menu you could tell this was not the place to go if you are counting calories because the portions are generous. 

I ordered the Vanilla Waffles with a side bacon. As I suspected, the portions are big and delicious, so this was going to be one of those meals you can't finish, but leftovers are fine by me anyway.

I enjoyed this place, and could see myself coming back here at some point
This is a cool little place. The portion sizes are enormous! No cheap but will not disappoint either!

Super nice and accommodating staff. Yummy food and huge portions (I should have shared my plate). I got bfast bacon scramble with grilled mashed potatoes. The biscuits and strawberry jam are homemade, best biscuit I've EVER had.

Second time in two days eating here as we are staying at the Plaza. Our first server was excellent but this morning our server is trying to handle five table at once and we only seem him once. As soon as we for seared he got quadruple sat, a suffers term. 

He never check on us to see if we needed more coffee or if everything was alright with our meal. In still waiting for the check and some one to remove my dirty dishes that been in front of me for 8 minutes. 

Good food but our server is whack and concerned  about quantity and not quality

A gem in downtown, try it! 

I know there are more than a few of these places around. We've been to two in Vegas through different trips and it doesn't fail to delivery quality, real, homemade style food. Portions are insanely big and the off kilter take on hometown, scratch food is just right. Waffles and chicken are a no-brainer to order but you can't go wrong with anything. Heck, the crab cake is on par and this is a hometown food place in The Plaza; they're doing it right. Salads are huge, ingredients fresh and dressings yummy. Go ham on the whole menu, don't think you can go wrong.
Food was good alot of food big plates two people can share one plate

Ridiculous portions at a reasonable price! 
Since this is almost the only decent breakfast at this end of Downtown Las Vegas (Dupar's closed and MTA requires walking through the homeless hoard), I expected the standards to be less than stellar. I mean, really, they have no competition. 
What I found was a delightfully clean, efficiently run, full service diner.
Kudos to the Hostess (I am sorry that I did not get her name, BUT, she had purple braids, so maybe that will identify her?) who made arrangements for us to accommodate a dietary restriction for someone in our party. This was real customer service!
Our Server made his dislike of the accommodation clear, but adhered to (it looked like he complained to the Hostess).
We were also impressed by the older gentleman in the red shirt and jeans who brought our food. His demeanor was that of Hoosier and someone who had a stake in the place. It is great to see that work ethic.
A solidly nice, homey, experience.

I was so stoked to try this place after seeing it on T.V. Looked so tasty and innovative. I ordered the meatloaf and my girl ordered some pasta. We both didn't care for the meals and ate very little. They did only charge us for one entree and gave us half price deserts which was nice. The crazy thing was o brought the meatloaf home and even my dogs wouldn't eat it . I'm sure there are great items on the menu but stay away from the meatloaf and pasta
Best breakfast I have ever had. Went twice while in Vegas for 3 nights. Had chicken and waffles and crab cake Benedict. Both amazing. Definitely share!
Love this place!! The bacon waffle has strips of bacon, not bits like other places.

Best breakfast type food on Fremont street. Like the classics and the new twists on them. Big portions, so be prepared to be full. The sage fried chicken is great. Jack, our server was a very prompt and helpful waiter. Would highly recommend if you are staying in Fremont street.

Outstanding!!!!!

From service to food, they're over the top. HUGE portions and phenomenal food!!!!

Drinks are super strong and more than worth the money. Some of them you can even take the glasses home.

Quick, beyond friendly and did I mention GREAT food??

It's a must stop when in Vegas!

Hash house never disappoints. Every since I saw the episode on man vs food I knew I had to try it. I ate this location before but never did a review. So I went a second time and they deserve the 5. Ordered the sage fried chicken . The sauce and mash potatoes next level. The portions next level lol. At the airport now and still eating my food.

The food here all comes as giant servings, unique, and tastes delicious. The service was just OK. We sat at the bar for lunch expecting faster and friendlier service. Didn't really get either. Food came out fine and was delicious as expected. We do recommend the menu and the taste. The Casino that the restaurant is located in is really kinda a dump. Low class casino, claims to be renovated. Not really. However, it's worth walking through the Casino to have a meal at Hash House.

Went here for dinner, great experience. The waiter was very friendly and would accommodate to any request. Food was very good, they serve very large portions just as a heads up.  They brought out homemade biscuits and homemade jam with honey butter it was to die for. I ordered the burger and it was phenomenal. If you ever get a chance check it out.

Amazing food..great portions as in share size portions.. this one doesn't have the best wait staff but it's definitely a stop for anyone that is near by.. oh and if you go in the main lobby doors, you won't be accosted by the time share people. ;)

Stopped here for a cheap Las Vegas breakfast.   We didn't get the basic under $10 meal.   My advice, DON'T!!!!  The other meals for a few bucks more are worth the money and then some.  The Andy Sage Fried  Chicken Benedict was FANTASTIC.   The Country Friend Steak was OUTSTANDING.   I don't typically rave and capitalize words for effect, but this place was too great to not speak up!  It really is your loss not to stop by and enjoy this place.   I am not affiliated with this place and trying to drive business, don't miss this place!

The food is so good here that we came twice on our trip! The atmosphere is very "dinerish ". We had the chicken and waffles the first day, my personal fave. The portions are sooooo big that my husband and I shared and STILL didn't finish!  The second day, we had fried chicken eggs benedicts, my hubby's fave. Again, we shared and STILL didn't finish!   I highly recommend this place!

I was told about this place about a friend. She told me hat every serving was huge. I didnt think that it will be so much food. It really surprised me. The service was great as well. You have to get the pancakes. You will be surprised. I will go back in my next visit to Vegas.
Huuuuuge portions! I enjoyed my chicken pot pie. Great environment for families. Be prepared to share. Sooo much food

I recently went to Hash House A Go Go. I was last there almost 3 years ago. I was so excited to take my wife, who has endured my many tellings of how good the food was. Well, I was severely disappointed. 

We shared an order of the sage fried chicken and waffles. My memory must not be that good, because they sprinkled corn and bell peppers on the waffles. Yuck! 

I also requested some biscuits. They were really dry and tasted like they have been sitting out for most of the day.

Everything seemed to be much better a few years ago. I will definitely not ever go again the next time I'm in Vegas!

I need help walking back to my hotel. I am not able to finish half of my plate. This is hands down the best meal that I have had in Vegas. The prices are very reasonable and the service is phenomenal. Tina is knowledgeable of the menu and attentive. Definitely a do again!

Finally got a chance to try this place. They weren't kidding when they said its huge portions. I went to the one inside The Plaza Hotel in downtown Vegas. It was a Tuesday morning about 10am - no wait. 

Our server was nice and gave us a run down of the menu and gave us a few recommendations. I went with the chicken and waffles (of course). After placing our order, it was about 10 mins before our food came out. 

OMG! There's no way I'm going to finish this, and I was already planning how I was going to drop off my leftovers back at my hotel. 4 waffles on the plate, and 2 chicken breast in the middle and a knife stuck in the chicken. Lots of garnishes which I just knocked off the plate to get to the good stuff. The waffle has bacon right in it - no not bits. Actual bacon strips. The chicken was good, not overcooked. I was only able to finish 1 waffle and 1 chicken. The rest was taken back to the hotel.

Definitely gonna come back and try some other dishes.
It features southern classics with a twist.  They serve LARGE portions here so plan on taking home what you can't finish. I had the Chicken and Waffles here and was unable to finish it all.

Love love love!!!  I recommend the meatloaf sandwich! The lines are crazy but well worth it! The customer service is excellent. The pancakes are the full size of a plate so bring your appetite. I recommend you bring a drink with you while you wait. They also prepare some pretty good Bloody Mary's! A must try. Been to the one at The Quad and the one on Fremont Street. I recommend Fremont if you don't have the time to wait.

My boyfriend and I decided to go out to a late dinner at Hash House, service was okay.  The hostess were friendly and welcoming, but leaning on the host stand a little to much.  We had to order off the late night menu, I got the grilled cheese sandwich, It was decent.  Way to much tomato and only one big chunk of avocado.  It was thrown together and sloppy, hard to eat.  Mike was our server and was good. Took him about 15 min to get my strawberry lemonade margarita, but was a very good drink for only $8.  All in all it was a decent dinner but hope for better service and food next time.

Omg if this isn't the most delicious place to eat ever. We stayed on Fremont street and wanted to try something new. There was no wait and the food was awesome. HUGE size portions for a reasonable price. We went for dinner and back the next morning for breakfast. Everything is good here and their potatoes are to die for! Drinks are a reasonable price too!

if you are a breakfast enthusiast and/or a lumberjack, this place will amaze you. but if you're like me and don't like to go overboard on your breakfast portions, Hash House scores a "mehh.."

i've eaten at a different Hash House several times before, and i usually opt to share one of their dishes with another person because the serving sizes are ginormous.

the service was great, but the breakfast and lunch dishes are literally stacked with ingredients, and some of the dishes my family ordered looked more like 3 meals combined into one. for example: my brother's "bacon + eggs + potatoes + hash browns + biscuit + gravy + omelette + chicken benedict" aka "the WTF" (served with a knife through the top and some sort of sage plant pierced through the biscuit).

all i needed for a satisfying breakfast was a hot cup of coffee and their french toast, which was actually delicious and not too huge of a portion. thankfully, they did not overkill the french toast as they did with the others' meals.

-civilities.

Food here was amazing. Great prices, HUGE servings. We tried the meatloaf hash, avocado scramble, French toast, and the huge famous chicken dish. Everyone in the group loved their meal. Also the watermelon kiwi drink was very sweet, but very good. I got the non-spiked version but I bet the spiked is out of this world!

Disappointed. Came here because I was craving an eggs benedict and based on the reviews I thought I'd give it a try. The menu has crazy cool options, but not that many pescatarian/vegetarian options. The Bloody Mary I had was disgustingly sweet. I ordered the smoked salmon scramble which was OKAY, but not as expected. They over charged me as well. Would not eat here again

Hash House a Go Go? How about Hash House a Yeah Yeah! As a foodie, I'm appalled for never knowing about this place, even if it is a chain. My cousins turned us onto this joint and it's one that will go on in the memory book.

The food is freakin' fantastic! The portions are huge! The price is quite affordable! The menu options are outstanding! And now I'm freakin' hungry!

Whatever you do...next time in Vegas, go visit the Hash House. Especially if you ever crave Chicken and Waffles! YUM

Based on reviews we were not expecting much but was very pleased with the service and food. We love the Hash House in San Diego and was pleased to find this one in downtown Vegas. The food was great and service fantastic. There was enough to feed a small army so come with stretch pants. This place would make a killing in Scottsdale. Love it!
So good dont know why others are hating on it was so tasty and huge portions!

Make sure you bring your friends because it will take 2-3 people to actually finish a dish here. The potions are HUGE. A ridiculous amount of food really. On the plus side it was really good food. (Diameter of pancakes are about 20 inches)

Bloody Mary wasn't very good. I'm a fan of spicy bloodys with a ton of garnish but these tasted sweet for some reason. Gross. 

Service was ok. Probably could have checked on us sooner but overall fine.
I'm sorry but this place has just ok food,  ok service and very long to get your food.  If you have a free breakfast from the casino eat there.  If not go to the cafe.  Cheaper and faster.

Definitely the worst Hash House I've ever been to. Meatloaf was great, skillet was awful. Waitress looked like she hated her job and didn't want to serve us. We had a coupon for being hotel guests so we purposely ordered extra, and the waitress and manager said the coupon was for BEFORE TAXES so we were $1.20 short to use the coupon. Coupon didn't say anything about that, and I've never heard of it. We will definitely not be going back to this Hash House ever again! Also, there was an ant on our table, and while we were there another table was complaining to the manager too. Beware!

Hash House A Go Go instantly became the "go to" for my girlfriend and I when we first visited Vegas, more specifically Fremont Street, several years ago. The menu features simple, mid-west style, comfort food. When was the last time you read a menu with references to Indiana?

I've come to learn that this "chain" originated in San Diego. Hash House is all over Vegas, but we enjoy visiting the Plaza location. If you happen to be in Reno, Chicago or Orlando, you too can enjoy their outrageous portions.

My youngest son nearly fainted when he saw the size of his pancake on a previous visit. And hands down, our favorite menu item is the Fried Green Tomato Stack. Sadly, it's seasonal and was unavailable this visit. However, we have never been disappointed by our selections.

This past weekend, we decided to make Hash House our last dinner in Vegas. We even ordered (and shared) the Hammered Pork Tenderloin. It features two giant deep fried pork tenderloins and some amazing smashed potatoes. Not to be out done, the Blue Crab Cake appetizer was deliciously moist and generous. And the molasses drizzle on the plate was practically licked clean off.

Great service, a fun quirky menu and atmosphere, and always delicious food are clear winners. Can't wait to be near another Hash House!

I hate to say anything bad about this place, because the food was so good, but damn the service is sooooo awful!

I think we spent a total of 3 hours here! and 3 of our orders were butchered! 

I ordered the roasted Chicken, garlic, onions, asparagus and rosemary house hash and asked them to add mushrooms to it. They forgot the mushrooms, but that was the least of my concerns after they ruined 3 of my friends meals. 

One of my friend's ordered Andy's Sage Fried chicken which is one the menu favorites items, and he never got any fried chicken with it! Wtf?! We told the server twice and he still never got his fried chicken....

Another friend ordered eggs benedict without bacon, because she is a vegetarian and after sending it back twice, we figured the 3rd time would be the charm and guess what it still had bacon on it.

Oh and a 3rd friend ordered a house hash as well and asked for no cheese on it, and they brought it out with a shitload of cheese on it *sigh* 

We asked for those 2 meals to be removed from the bill, and even that took another half an hour to get taken care of. 

I had such high hopes for this place and they failed! Such a shame, because no one wanted to waste any time eating there again after all that. Good food, kinda pricey, but terrible terrible slow as hell service.

Good luck getting what you actually ordered here! The only thing that I ordered that came out quickly was my breakfast Jameson shot, go figure.

You better be really hungry if you plan on coming here. Everything they serve comes in huge portions. You really can share a dish with someone unless you are extremely hungry. We came in about 10:30 AM and it was packed already. We had to wait a good 15 minutes or so. They have a really big menu to choose from, basically all the breakfast food you could think of.  I would definitely recommend coming here at least once. If I lived Vegas, it wouldn't be a place I come often.

Food - 4/5   My Chicken and Waffles were great. That sage paired very well with the chicken and syrup. My only disappointment was that they didn't give me enough syrup. Also, that watermelon ice tea was on point!!! So unique and refreshing! My SO had Corn hash and she was disappointed. The beef was not cooked crispy like she wanted. I am guessing they cook everything with a twist here so everything might be made in a different way. 

Service - 5/5 Our waiter was great. No complaints.
This place was very very yummy!! The plates are big serving & the drinks are good & super cute. The service was prompt & new exactly what to suggest & must have  will self visit again

I freaking love the hash house. Since it's so epic, we'll usually go here for "epic" occasions. Our most recent visit was on my BFs 30th for brunch. What a great choice! Our whole group was impressed and in awe over the huge and yummy selections. I am now a fried chicken and waffle fan. Seriously, their sage fried chicken is like OMG the best friend chicken I have ever had. Dreaming about that...

This place is amazing.  The food is HUGE and amazing with the flavor combos.

I got the Andy's Sage Chicken, which was very good.  I can't wait to go back here!

Well was my first visit to HH from all the reviews on television and from friends I decided to give this place I try. The portions are huge I ordered the Chicken Sage waffles and boy everything was great. They served me to large bonless chicken breast along with 4 waffles and I had to ask for a to go box for the other half. Anyway if you want large portions come to the Hash House A GoGo!
So good and the service was great to. Family of 5 and ate for under $50 and a huge portion.

First time here. We were told the portions were big, yes they are! If you can split it, definitely do. Most of the plates are left with half the food not eaten. I had the Original Farm House Benidict, it was huge. I barely ate half. There was a roasted red pepper sauce instead of the usual hollidasie sauce. Not sure I will get hat one again, it reminded me of marinara sauce, more of a dinner item. 

Our server Sonia was great. Constant refills and very sweet. The only issue I had was woth the hostess when we first walked up. We had to way a few minutes (I know it's horrible to have to wait) but we hungry. When she finally walked up she had am attitude about having to be at work. No smile, mad at the world attitude. (Might want to rethink her being the first face the customer sees.)

I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

We ate breakfast here all three mornings that we were in Vegas. The portions are ridiculous. If you can agree on an item, share a plate. For example, pancakes are about 14" in diameter. A waffle is about 7x12. Both were delicious. The French toast was good, but not as good. The grilled mashed potatoes beat out the cubed fried potatoes hands down. The bacon was meh. Morning cocktails are expensive so we passed. Coffee is actually really good and we are pretty picky when in comes to coffee. Recommend.

Why do some people love this place? The food is a greasy mess of heart stopping crap. Yeah, yeah the portions are huge but if it's crap, who cares? The grilled cheese sandwich was OK but the cheddar potatoes on the side were a tasteless mess other than the cheese. My buddy got some sort of breakfast covered with white gravy that looked like an Exxon oil spill. If all you want is a food orgy, knock yourself out but in Vegas, there are so many better choices. I should have gone across the street to Du Par's.

Wanted some breakfast and found this place. Saw the menu and was a little overwhelming to make some decisions (which is not bad). Ordered a basic breakfast (eggs, bacon, biscuit and potatoes). The only thing I liked was the bacon. Scrambled eggs were under and the potatoes were suppose to be crispy...not. Are server was nice but once we got the food, we didn't see her again until I put money on the table to get our bill. Don't waste your time and money here.

When a coworker of mine heard that I would be going to Las Vegas, they told me about this place right away, and after hearing them rave about the food, I definitely had to check it out. This location is the one in downtown Las Vegas near Fremont Street, and it is also located next to a casino. We were seated pretty quickly and had great service throughout. The menu is nothing short of overwhelming with all of the great dishes that they had to serve. Once we made up our mind, we ordered and even our server advised us that we may have been ordering too much food. He was absolutely correct. Their portions are HUGE and even sharing one order of the French toast between 4 people was barely enough. My group and I had the chicken and waffles, one of the benedicts, the tractor driver combo, and the French toast. It was easy to see that we would have a lot of left overs. The food itself was very tasty once you got over the fact that everything as huge. The food definitely had a lot of flavors even though the presentation seems a little rushed. It is definitely a great place to have a bite to eat and just a heads up: you may need to call someone to cart you out of there once you're finished.

I came into Hash house for breakfast after a long night of drinking and dancing.  I asked to sit at the bar because I figured I'd order another drink.  I had the sweetest server ever.. I think her name was casey.  She made me an "Instagram-worthy" tangerine mamosa and it was sooooo good.  For breakfast I got the bacon avocado scramble which was delicious!!  Casey's fun and spunky personality made the experience 5 stars!!!
The perfect breakfast off the strip. Everything was delicious and quick for a Saturday morning. I would highly recommend
Food is yummy, they give you a GREAT BIG portion of food and the price is well worth it, service is great, our waiter was prompt and friendly I'd come back.
It really is THAT good. Size of portions are huge, do split them. Great service, I believe his name was John, very friendlyand knowledgable.
What Can I Say?...Well I Sat At The Bar...Drinks Were Mediorce But They Are Not Known For The Drinks.If You Come Here Make Sure You Are Hungry Because The Portions Are Huge.

i went here on friday night around 12AM with a party of 8. we were already staying in downtown vegas, so we decided to go to this new location of hash house. ive been to the one in san diego so i expected the same. it is located in the lobby of The Plaza hotel, which was recently renovated. the lobby looked pretty cool. like an old hotel trying to be strip worthy. anyway, we were seated right away. there were only a few other parties in the restaurant at the time and we were seated in a long booth, which kind of was annoying if you were sitting in the inside and needed to get out to go to the restroom or something. 

anyway, the bf and i ordered the sage fried chicken benedict. i had this at the san diego location and it was pretty good. the bf hadnt had it before, so we decided to split it since i wasnt that hungry anyway. the waitress says "that will be a $2.50 charge to split it... or you can get a side order of something if you want..." so i look over the menu and all the side orders were $4.50. maybe if i was hungry, i might have just ordered a side of fries or something but i knew i wasnt gonna eat much so we just decided to suck it up and pay the $2.50. i should have just not said anything to begin with and just ate off the bfs plate. oh well. you win some you lose some. this benedict came with a chipotle sauce on top instead of the usual hollandaise sauce which was a bit spicy. personally i think the dish tastes better with the original sauce. 

my cousin got the meatloaf sandwich, which was a huge sandwich in between 2 or 3 inch slices of bread. the meatloaf was actually pretty bland. my other cousin got the sage fried chicken, eggs, smashed potatoes and biscuit. i forgot what its called, but it was basically like the benedict but without the sauce on top. my cousin asked for a side of gravy and the waitress again said there would be a charge. no thanks. 

a friend got the fried chicken sandwich, which was the sage fried chicken in between the same 2-3 inch slices of bread. he said it was good. it came with a side of fries which i tasted and thought it was pretty salty. another friend got a regular breakfast plate of eggs, smashed potatoes, ham and biscuit. 

i wanted to try the chicken and waffles since it has slices of bacon within the waffle. but they stop serving the chicken and waffles at 11PM. boo. oh well, its okay though because more than one person after wards said that the waffles arent that good anyway. 

overall i was disappointed. i wont be back and i dont recommend it.

O.M.G they said it was big portions but big saying this is big is link saying the grand canyon is just a break in the rocks . My wife had a plate of sage fried chicken and I had a plate of the meatloaf we knew we wouldn't finish but at the end it didn't look like we had started.  tip come hungry and share a plate with 5 of your friends good food good service good $
Portions are crazy large.... Split if you can! Food was amazing. Ate at the counter and was treated very well. Only down was one hostess was a bit of a negative Nelly.

OMG the chicken & waffles were amazing! The waffles are vanilla with bacon inside and the chicken was cooked perfectly and paired so well together! We also ordered the salmon & potatoes were cooked to perfection! You can not go wrong by getting anything on the menu! Beware portions are HUGE! We decided to come to this one because the wait was only 15 min & all the other ones were over an hour! So worth the short drive to old downtown Vegas!

Love these restaurants.  Have visited both their San Diego and Las Vegas locations.

Sure, they have large portions, but the food is also delicious and fresh.

Do yourself a favor and give them a try!

Yet another wonderful experience at HHAGG!!  

There were four of us girls, two of us being seasoned HHAGG eaters.  So we knew not to order one meal each!  

Between the four of us, we split the Snicker's pancake, the french toast, a side of potatoes, and bacon.  There was MORE than enough food, and we had some left over!

The food was AMAZING as usual.  Everything was so delicious and fresh!  

Too bad the service wasn't really up to par with our food.  Different waitresses kept coming over to take our drink orders and then none of them actually BROUGHT them.  Plus, we saw our actual waitress once, and once only.  Someone else (eventually) brought us our drinks, she took our food order, someone else brought the food, someone else checked on us, and someone else brought us the check.  So tell me why HER name was on the bill??  Questionable...

I would have to say this would be the first time going to a Hash House a Go Go.  Which seems to be an okay place.  

Located inside the Plaza Hotel, close to the front of the hotel.  You have a decent view of the Fremont street.  Also located next to the check in desk.  

The restaurant itself, did look a bit small, but decent in a way.  Very well decorated and color scheme seems to be dark but warming in the same way.  Staff seems to be nice and entertaining.  Service was decent and average.  

The menu was a bit confusing, but ordered a Tractor driver combo, that had eggs, bacon and pancake.  The waitress asked if I wanted one of their famous pancakes and got the Apple Cinnamon pancake.  The wait was decent, and when the food came, I didn't realize how big the pancake was.  It was bigger than expected and it was actually good.  I wasn't able to finish it, but it was decent and presentation was good.  

My recommendation, its a good morning place to have breakfast.  The food was cooked decently and the portions are bigger than usual.  If you are in the area, try it out.
Runner service great, wait service not. Water took forever. Fries snd bacon bacon both good. Bread pudding a huge letdown...dry, dry, dry.

Huge portions and some interesting menu items. Referred to as "twisted farm food", I would say it's worth a try, but I wouldn't make the effort to return. Maybe it's because I was more than slightly hungover from the night before, but when the famous fried chicken benedict arrived at the table, my stomach almost felt worse. It's so huge and hard to figure out where to start. I basically ate the mashed potatoes and a bit of the chicken, and left the rest to the bf and to save for later (we slowly finished it throughout the rest of the day as we waited for our flight home). On top of the benedict, bf also got a salmon scramble and we were surprised it was thoroughly cooked though it was supposed to be smoked. I've had smoked salmon scrambles elsewhere where the salmon was still light and refreshing.

As others have said, you can probably order 1 dish for every 2 people, but if you really want to try a lot of things, just be okay with having a lot of leftovers.

Looked up this place and saw the pictures and reviews, let me note clear, the internet is a lie. I took my family here for brunch on Monday the 5th of September, the service was horrible not once did the waitress come to our table to ask if everything was fine or to bring us water (as any other place would) or even refills, the good was horrible, my Niece and wife order fruit bowls and the bananas' were not RIPE (green) and brown on the inside like if they were frozen, the blackberries and blueberries were all squashed. Would you let a child eat a NOT ripe banana? Come on! The "chicken pot pie" the chicken is actually turkey! I asked to then speak to the manager where he told me " that's how the bananas are there fine" and for you guys I shall upload the pictures. I recommend here to no one as I'm still extra disappointed in the establishment.

They serve up some huge portions but does it help that it's huge portions of very mediocre food. I think this place is popular just due to their oversized portions and interesting plating but not so much on the actual tastiness of their food. The chicken and waffles were probably my favorite dish that I tried.

I find this place to be MIND BLOWING. The food is insanely original and innovative, for example, my girlfriend had chicken and waffles. And while the menu item doesn't sound so enthusiastic in the description, what ended up on our table was 4 pieces of syrup drenched fried chicken piled high and speared into waffle cakes, stuffed with BACON!

Bacon! Stuffed into a WAFFLE! Can you imagine that?

Some crazy shit here!

The service is slow, but it's understandable. At the time we arrived to eat here, our waitress was serving 7 tables in the early morning. She can alternate between Spanish and English (she's Caucasian), and had some unruly tables full of grumpy, whiney old people to deal with. 7 tops is ALOT of people to feed. So we had to give her credit for keeping her cool under pressure.

The atmosphere inside, versus outside the Plaza casino was just as significant as The Griffin bar on 6th street and Fremont. You have your shady fuckers bumming around and looking for change outside the casino (Fremont happens to be a major place for bums to mill about, and also is the drop off point for newly released inmates from the Clark County and City jails at the Golden Nugget valet), and then you got the more sociable folks coming inside to eat. 

Security and the staff do a good job to keep trouble out, if not appearing to be overworked.

Who ever doesn't like this place is CRAZY! I used to live in SD and would go there all the time. Having one in Vegas is just perfect because you need the large portions for a hangover. Chicken and Biscuits are always a fave, along with their french toast. Bloody Mary's are also a must here they know how to make them. Anyone looking for a good breakfast and large portions must come here. Plates can easily be shared with 2-3 people.

Stayed 2 nights at the Plaza- this restaurant is in the lobby so we had breakfast here.  Great food- way too much of it!  Breakfast was so good and fresh that we went both days - the second day the service was a little confused - half the place was empty but we had to wait since they were short staff??? On a Sunday morning??? Other than that-  I would suggest breakfast- they make their own " homemade" biscuits that are amazing!!!!!

I'm writing this short review of the Plaza location of Hash House because Travis K's post caught my eye on my welcome page. Let me start by saying that my wife and I are huge Hash House fans. We go to the West Sahara location regularly and have been to to the M Resort location as well and never had a bad experience. I wish I could say the same for our one trip the the new Plaza Hash House. The food was as great as it is at the other locations, but the service was very poor. There wasn't a friendly face in the restaurant, our meals were not served at the same time (lunches for the 5 of us arrived over about a 15 minute span) and it took nearly 20 minutes to get our check after our plates were taken away. The couple that was with us enjoyed their meal, but were so put off by the service that they said they probably wouldn't return. We assured them that the other locations didn't operate like the Plaza location. And no, I'm not a hyper-sensitive Yelper. I worked in the service industry for years and I understand the difference between a busy establishment where people are busting their butts and maybe it causes me to wait a few extra minutes. I have no problem with that. This restaurant was about half full and there was a lot of standing around going on. Hopefully the owner of this location will take some of these reviews about the poor service to heart and make some changes. I hate to say it, but my guess is that the employees of this Hash House are from the Culinary Union which for me would answer a lot of questions.
Great restaurant and food, horrible location.  The Plaza is old and dirty.

Ok I thought LA food was good until i started trying out Las Vegas food. This place blew me away for some of the most insane and visually pleasing brunch creations I've ever seen. I got the crab cakes Benedict and it was a crazy amount of food piled high on a huge plate. There were so many components to the dish I absolutely loved every bite. You have to try this place if you go to Fremont street or stay at the Plaza!

We were a little offput bu the reviews, but it was close and we were starving. The inside is like a 90s style diner. Probably could use a bit of an update. 

The menu is pretty large. Our waitress warned us that if we picked anything, we would probably want to share it. Thank god she told us pr we would have been overwhelmed. 

We ordered the chicken fried steak plate. Dang, was it good. It allegedly had sausage gravy, but it tastes like bacon gravy to me. It came with rustic style mashed potatoes (meaning not whipped) that were DELISH. 

I do have some gripes which aren't much. The CFS plate comes with green beans, but uou only get like 6-7 green beans. 3 cups of mashed potatoes but only a handful of green beans? And the biscuit. It was so.dry. Painfull dry. Even dousing it in the jelly it was like sand. 

Even with the gripes I have to give it 5 stars because of how good it was. My husband honestly wanted to go back the next day and said it was at the top of his CFS list. We are from Texas, so believe me, we know chicken fried steak.

DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION! They have very ignorant & selfish people. Our waiter was a big rude female dog! && when I asked to talk to a manager he was rude as well! I just hope they didn't spit in my food! Save yourself & just go to a different location!

As good as the Hash House at the Imperial Palace/Quad/LinQ whatever it's called now. 

Actually, this one is slightly better because when we came there was absolutely no wait for a table. I think it was a Monday though so that may have helped as well. 

Food was consistent, just like I remembered, and service was good. It's a bit out of the way from The Strip but worth a try if you want to get away from the usual crowds of people.

If you are into a hearty breakfast, and you also enjoy being told "Ask us about our beers" as you are seated, you must consider Hash House in the Plaza Casino for breakfast or brunch. My experience here was based on this, and I left completely satisfied and beyond full. If you're a party of 6 or more, you may have problems getting a table, so do consider the bar, especially if you want a beer. The selection is varied, the bartender knowledgeable. 

Obviously with a name like Hash House, the lure - and the top items on the menu - will be the hashes. These are huge, served in iron skillet-pans. They aren't your traditional hashes with the meats and potatoes nicely cut into small cubes. This is more like pulled meat with whatever else is included, on top of a pile of home fries, usually with 2 eggs and a jumbo biscuit with a large sprig of rosemary growing out of it for garnish and optional flavor. One person in our group opted for pancakes instead, and he was told not to order quite as many as he wanted - and rightly so. The pancakes were larger than the plate, probably larger than a Frisbee. 

The price of breakfast here, not counting coffee, was perhaps a few bucks more than a breakfast buffet at one of the better hotels on Fremont St., but I left here equally full and more satisfied in terms of quality. If I had to label anything in the area as "best hangover brunch," a hash breakfast here would win.

Tips: 
1. There will be a wait especially on the weekends. It's ok and worth it.
2. Order anything with fried chicken. Even for breakfast. Personal fav is the fried chicken Benedict.
3. SHARE BETWEEN TWO PEOPLE. The plates are enormous. If you don't share you'll have leftovers, and who wants to eat soggy microwaved leftovers in Vegas? No one. Just share and save some money.

The food was so fresh and delicious! Our server was nice and our food came out fast. I ordered the waffle combo and my fiancé ordered the pancake with a side sausage.
The portions were huge! Easily shareable with another person. I will definitely come back.

This was our second HHAGG experience. Great location, wait was only 10 minutes. Food was awesome! He got the Apple Cinnamon pancakes, large slices of apples baked into a giant cinnamon pancake! I got the Corned Beef Hash, large portion of shredded corned beef and swiss cheese over fried potatoes! Yum! Great service and reasonably cheep for the amount of food we got!! Will definitely be back!
Always a good choice for breakfast in Vegas! Sage Fried Chicken Benedict, Red Velvet Pancakes & Biscuits and Gravy our some of our favorites.

Very, Very disapointed in this place. I ordered Pancake, Eggs, bacon. The pancake was ok, the eggs were burnt they were all brown, the bacon was way over done. There prices for breakfast are way way to expensive, especially when the breakfast was nothing special. The service wasn't great either, the guy kept coming to my table like 100 times asking me if everything was ok, I guess they dont believe in silent service or letting someone try to eat there overpriced breakfast in piece.

Been here twice now, but needed the second trip to make sure I wrote an appropriate review. Before ordering here please be aware that this place serves HUGE HUGE portions. I didn't even come close to finishing my plate and I have  pretty big appetite. Prepare to split or share food because they won't do a half order.

We stayed at the Golden Nugget in Downtown Vegas so Hash House a Go Go was an easy 5 minute walk. Not 100% sure what the parking situation is here, but most hotels have Valet, and I think they have there own lot somewhere down the street. 

On this trip I order the Sage Fried Chicken. Again, huge portion. The sage really came through on the chicken and the sauce was amazing. The chicken was fried, with a great crisp on the outside, but not greasy. It was placed on a bed of egg and bacon, which was followed by an enormous pile of hash potatoes, on top of two home made biscuits. The potatoes are great but there is way too much of them, and the biscuits are fantastic. Unfortunately the biscuits are stuck under the pile of potatoes so in order to eat them with the chicken you have to rescue them from the bottom of the plate. 

My Fiancee ordered the French Toast. One order comes with three huge pieces of French Toast topped with a caramelized banana and pecans. She ate one and a half pieces of French Toast before calling it quits. Overall she loved it and would order it again after trying a few more things first. 

I found the menu hard to read because it was wayyyy too cluttered. Also, we were there on a Wednesday at 11am with basically no body in the restaurant and the service was kinda spotty. We got seated right away but it took a while for someone to get a coffee order. We then had to get a busser to ask our waitress for a refill. We also needed some extra plates and had to ask the host to find our waitress for that as well.

My wife and I came here after a show on the Strip and drinks at the Fremont Experience and it was the perfect end to the evening, at least for me. We were both craving a snack and a cocktail waitress recommended Hash House. Funky decor and vibe to match the clientele. Apparently, we were sitting in the booth where Neil Patrick Harris ate. I didn't see his autograph, but my wife tells me it was there.

We just wanted a snack of some kind. I was disappointed in the small dessert menu, but I followed my wife's lead and got the biscuit and added the gravy. My wife suddenly took ill from a long night and we had to change our order to go. The waitress was awesome and by the time I came around with the car, my wife had paid the tab and was waiting for me. 

When I returned to our room, I had my food and have to say that it is my new standard for biscuits and gravy: not too much goo and just the right amount of savory sausage. The biscuit was light and fluffy and I went to bed happy. Kudos.

Holy crap!!!  Serving sizes are ridiculously huge! We had the sage chicken and waffles, and the chicken pot pie. Absolutely delicious, both dishes.  Our server, Alfie, was also very helpful and courteous... experience was awesome.
Awesome! They have huge portions.. You've been warned! I got the Texas Rancheros Eggs Benedict and it was delicious, but also way too big for me. I recommend splitting it with someone special.

Do not get the burgers. They're huge and flavorless. So gross. 

This is a gluttons heaven on earth. Everything is made super - no - quadruple sized. You just can't make burgers taste good at that size. Not possible. 

My husband's pancakes on the other hand were delicious but sickening after a few bites. When the pancake is the size of a SmartCar it's hard enough to finish- when it's covered in sugar it's even harder to finish.

My husband and I came here after hearing rave reviews about the burgers. He ordered the Smoked Bacon, Avocado & Cheddar Burger and I ordered a burger with sweet peppers. The portions were huge. We immediately cut our burgers in half to save for later. While the portions were generous the taste was just OK. The patties didn't taste like they were seasoned at all. The ingredients were fresh.

Our three year old enjoyed his grilled cheese sandwich.

The service was prompt and the restaurant was clean.

I think we'll give their breakfast a try and leave the burgers to Tommy's.

Had this on my list of places to visit if we had the chance and BOOM we had the chance.  WOW this place was GREAT.  We split a Sage Chicken Fried Steak salad.  BIG tasty piece of Chicken a meal in itself.  Good Salad under it too.  I had the BBLT good good good.  Tasty bacon, Great bread.  Good Good Good.  A good good family place to go.   TRY IT if your on FREEMONT street in DownTown VEGAS love this place.

Me and my boyfriend came yesterday. So we got seated by a lady. We got our drinks but then the waitress didn't come back to take our order. Then we notice there was only one waitress in the entire restraunt. Everyone around us were getting service, except for us. She took so long that we ended up leaving. Not to mention she seemed kind of rude.

Went there for a birthday lunch for my boss.  Asked for water with lots of ice. Got four ice cubes. Asked for a glass of ice, never brought it. Ordered the Basic, breakfast with sausage, got bacon. When we were all finished (there were eight of us), our dishes never got cleared off the table. Waiter brought the bill, over $100, we all put in. Waiter came back again to get the bill/payment and we weren't ready, still no dishes cleared.  We were finally finished with the bill and put it down, the waiter came by and scooped it up.  We finally got up to leave and left a full table of dishes.  It was at least 20 minutes from the time we finished until we left. Unfortunately I was not in charge of the bill or there would have been NO tip. Terrible service, waiter didn't listen.  Will never go back.

This restaurant is located in the palace hotel and after coming here I'm extremely disappointed. To start off we had a group of 5 and we were told that a table for us would be a 30-40 minute wait at 2:30pm so we were offered the bar and said okay but if a table opens up to let us know. Well two 6 seater tables opened up and no one said anything to us until we asked and were told that we would be paying two separate checks one for our drinks at the bar and another from anything we ordered after we moved to the table so we just stayed. Then my wife was trying to order the HH Big Quesadilla and she wanted it without jalapeños because she's allergic and the waitress flat out said no. Then she asked for a Texas Ranchero and again she said no and she said it's because it's in the sauce. I asked well can we get a sauce without  jalapeños and her answer was "Uh...no." I was immediately frustrated and my wife just got up and left. It was frustrating because she didn't even take the time to go ask in the kitchen if they could! The food is good and you get large portions but it's not great or amazing. I'd take the time to find another place.

Wanted to try this place the last time I was in town. So, I was excited that they opened this one since I was staying here. First time went and sat in the restaurant. Service was not so good. The busboy had to call the waiter to take our order. When the waiter came, he had an attitude. Ordered the Roasted Chicken Hash w/ asparagus, garlic, rosemary. The amount was huge. It was good..... but it felt the pieces where a bit too big. Like they just peeled the chicken off the bone & It was a dry. I went a second time to give the place another chance. This time ordered it to go. I got the Corned beef hash & eggs. I guess they don't have knives in the kitchen becuz the corned beef was shredded into big pieces. With the size of the pieces, the corned beef was tough & chewy. The only good things was. the eggs where perfect (over easy) and the toast was perfect. Oh, they only have marmalade if you eat in & honey if you order to go. The portions where worth what you pay for......

I have eaten at several locations of this restaurant, and none of them disappoint. The food portions are huge, the service is efficient, and the food isn't just all gimmick, it actually tastes pretty good as well.
Huge free biscuits get you started, and that's enough to fill you up for a week. The entrees are huge, and delicious! The Fried Chicken Benedict and Chicken and Waffles are delicious and huge.
Definitely worth a stop in if you are super hungry!!

I absolutley love the chicken benedict. The Benny is consisting of fried chicken, bacon, mashed potatoes, grilled cheese, and Smoothered with gravy goodness. The serving is huge so share it with a friend if your a lightweight. Or just unbutton your pants and pig out solo... always my choice! The pancakes are also a great choice, not only are they massive in size but the pack tremendous flavor as well if you happen to not be in the mood for a gargantuan benny. One of the top 5 breakfast spots in sin city in my humble opinion.

Good food and plenty of it! We love going when we are in town. Service is always fun and great!
Fun atmosphere! Be ready to eat because to portions are ridiculous!! 
I try something different every time. This time I went the grilled cheese with bacon... WOW!

I've been meaning to come here for the longest time and finally, I decided to treat myself for breakfast.

I've always heard great things about this place and wanted to experience all the feels of this restaurant!

I went up to the host desk and there were two people there, one host on the phone, and the other just staring at her. After a few minutes of not being acknowledged I had to interrupt and ask if there was a wait.

The young gentleman apologized and told me the wait was going to be about 10-15 min. He did offer a seat at the bar, and since it was my first time, I wanted to full table experience.

After 20 minutes, I was seated.

While I was outside waiting, I noticed there were many people waiting to be seated, but while I was lead to my table, the dining rooms didn't look busy at all...perhaps they were understaffed today. 

The waiter I had was a nice guy but didn't bother to introduce himself. I knew what I wanted and placed my order and my ice tea came out pretty quickly.

Not too long after, my steak and eggs arrived. The plating of my food looked like a piece of art work, very colorful and very appealing.

The steak was cooked to my liking, medium rare, but I felt the steak was very thin. 

The grilled mashed potatoes were good, though a very huge portion. 

My eggs were perfect! Sunny side has always been my favorite. 

The biscuit was pretty huge, just shy of the size of a baseball. Served with marmalade and some fresh fruit tied it all together.

The whole experience all together was ok. Nothing stood out as a WOW experience.

The food, as pretty as it looked on the plate, didn't have any flavor. The dining experience from beginning to end wasn't a story worthy experience. 

The waiter and the hosts don't engage any of the customers.

Three stars is a fare gauge of my first time HH experience. 

The prices are a little more higher than any other diner but it's worth paying for if the food is fantastic and the experience is high level, not mediocre.

:)
Very disappointed, overpriced, eggs undercooked, steak overcooked, service deplorable. Snotty front counter person and table very dirty. Save yourself the dissatisfaction and go somewhere else

Portions were great,  coffee was amazing,  service was excellent.  Bacon was kinda chewy and the "crispy" potatoes were mushy and needed salt badly. My eggs were underdone, but my blueberry pancake was phenomenal (and enormous). Get the pancakes,  but be prepared for a wait. Fortunately,  The Plaza has my favorite slot machine (Goldfish), so the waiting may be the best part of your meal.

Subpar brunch food... not sure what the hype is about. We waited close to 1.5 hours during Life is Beautiful so not sure if the wait is normally this long but it was ridiculous. Oh yeah and their lame wifi does not work for guests. So yea, you'll get pretty bored waiting here.

 Service was horrible here too. Server totally neglected us, forgot utensils, forgot our requests, etc. I got the Marshmallow Mocha drink which was way too sweet... 

They have GINORMOUS portions so you should just share. My fiance and I just ended up sharing the chicken and waffles plate which was just okay. The breading of the chicken was a little mushy and not crispy. Even though we shared, we only finished probably 2/3 of the food.

Ugh. would not come back. Waste of money, time, and calories!

If you're starving or just a glutton, Hash's serving sizes are right for you! The plates are like photo frames. I shared the chicken and waffles ($18) with my friend and still had left overs. The chicken was perfectly juicy with crunchy skin, and the waffles had BACON baked inside  They also have drinking glasses that are "street legal" that you can take with you. Cute country atmosphere, great meal presentation.

Meh, I went to one location one time and it was pretty forgettable. This experience wasn't much different. Place was crowded so we waited ten mins which wasn't bad. The host was loud but in a good way. Smiled a lot while she took us to our table. We were put in a booth along the outside of the restaurant. We were next to this glass that separated us from the casino. Worst part was how gross it was. Finger prints, mouth prints and food splatter all over it. I wanted to post a pic with this review but I really don't like those types of pictures on my Yelp. Honestly though we went early so we know t wasn't all from that day and with the amount caked on we knew it was sitting there for DAYSSSS. Maybe make it side work or a daily cleaning ritual because no guest should sit next to that while they are eating.

Our server I wish I remembered her name but she had glasses and blonde hair. Very sweet girl. A little quick to take our order. Other then that better service experience at this location than the other one. The coffees took forever which I know she probably doesn't make. It was the Caramel Latte and s'mores latte. For $9 the s'mores one MAY have been worth it but the caramel one wasn't. It was overly sweet and barely tasted anything coffee in mine unlike the other one. So kinda not worth it and had like 4 sips "/ pretty expensive four sips lol.

The banana French toast was good. The way the cook the banana in the skin was rad. Smear the banana on the French toast with a little syrup and it's amazing. The quesadilla we had was mediocre at best. Barely any avocado in it though I paid extra for it. The cheese over powered the eggs. The tortilla part was hard and not soft so I can tell it was sitting in the window longer than the French toast. 

I don't see myself running back here anytime soon. At least I gave them another shot...

After having a great experience on a previous trip we just had to go back.

The menu is pretty small but pretty much everything is good and the portions are HUGE!  One order can feed two people.

They do have a late nite menu but the portions are slightly smaller

The reason for the 3 stars was the lack of service.  Although the food tasted great the wait time between the first order and last was at least 30 minutes and we all ordered at the same time.  Some orders did not have fruit even though on the menu it clearly states that it's supposed to have it.  Was told by the waiter that on that particular order does not come with it.  After requesting for a refill on water our waiter passed by our table 4 times avoiding eye contact until he came by with the pitcher of water.

I'm not sure how good the service is on breakfast but the service for a Saturday night was pretty bad.
The food is big and is good.. The service is ok.. Just don't ask to put chocolate chips in your pancakes because they get upset.. Like is a big deal. Other than that is ok..

if you're looking for a BIG breakfast than this is the place for you.  The chicken benedict was masive but delicious and the hash dishes were wxcellent.  This is a "stick to your ribs" kind of restaurant.  Add a bloody mary if you're recovering from a wild night.

What a great place for breakfast in Vegas!  Of course we'll have to visit for lunch or dinner next time! Everyone enjoyed morning cocktails of mimosas and bloody marys...I enjoyed the coffee and fresh cream myself.  I believe everyone was satisfied with their meal choices - I really enjoyed my ham, spinach & cheddar scramble after much debating about my meal choice.  Two of my companions shared one of the hashes and couldn't even finish their huge dish!
Our waitress was friendly and efficient once she got to our table...that would be my only issue, costing them a star - it was busy and took extra time to get to us to take drink orders.  She redeemed herself by quickly getting our orders and then the kitchen got them out quickly and beautifully presented!  
I would say Hash House would be a great place to eat in Vegas...at the Plaza Hotel it was walking distance to our Fremont Street hotel!

I do have to say the portions here are huge. This location is very popular and crowded but they move people in and out really quickly so that wasn't an issue at all. The price of the food was a little high for the quality of t in my opinion. My girlfriend and I shared the Andy's Famous Sage Fried Chicken and honestly it was not meeting my expectations. I'm not sure how you dry out fried chicken while simultaneously under cooking then reading but they pulled it off. The mashed potatoes under the dish were bland, boring, and honestly just didn't belong with the dish. There were 3 pieces of spinach so why even bother putting it on.

On the plus side: the Caramel macchiato iced coffee was great. Service was exceptional. And the presentation was really well done.

Honestly I would have given this place 4 stars- but the service has been so lacking. 

The food is great and it is HUGE. Chicken Pot Pie, egg scrambles, I haven't had anything here that was ever less than fantastic. 

The service though... man. I've been here multiple times and it's always the same. Waitresses act too busy for you and rarely checking on you. The person I was with ordered a different scramble (omelette) than I did, and the waitress repeated the order back to us. The runner then brought out two of the same scrambles.

We let them know this wasn't what was ordered (the runner, since our waitress was no where to be found & couldn't be bothered to bring our order out to us) 
They finally bring out the correct order but are SO condescending. 'I would have bet on my life that this is what you ordered. Enjoy.' Uhhh. Good thing you didn't place any bets then because it was definitely not what they ordered! Or what she repeated back to us.

Don't expect any refills, you probably won't get any.

We have been to 3 other Hash House rest. & the downtown one was the worst. Service was bad, toast came way after eggs, coffee was  late & had to ask second time for it. Lettuce in salad was yellow, pecans sparse, slow service. We won't be visiting that one again. Go to the M location. Very nice.
Super friendly, super delicious. Portions are HUGE  (as advertised) but I felt bed wasting so much! Friendly staff and and great location in The Plaza.
Jerry is a great server, Chris the manager is a super nice guy, Cory too, and the chicken and waffles are absolutely amazing!

Had an old school hot chocolate to start. ($4.99) 
It comes in an oversized cup with four full sized marshmallows floating! Ordered a Farm Scramble - Hardwood smoked bacon,onion, avocado and Swiss )$12.79).
Comes with a biscuit and jelly and crispy potatoes. 
Meal was fabulous, more than you can eat! The potatoes were the only spoiler as they were chunky and not extra crispy like i requested. 
Meal portions here are Huge so sharing is my suggestion. 
Free refills on coffee ($2.99)

First time here but I've been wanting to go for some time now. I sat at the bar otherwise it would have been a 30 minute wait. No wait for the barkeeper and I ordered a cold coffee and water to start. For food I ordered chicken and waffles. Pretty good amount of food and tasty too. I finished it all but one last waffle. I just couldn't do it. For dessert I got a white Russian. I would definitely go back. There's so much on the menu I want to try.

I have never had Waffles and Pancakes until I visited this place. Whoa ! Who knew it could be that good, I always thought it was an odd combination but it works. You can't beat bacon INSIDE a waffle, right ?

So grotesquely overwhelming, multitudinous, bombastic, and monolithic that it's like a volley of regret straight to the aortas of your now barely pulsating heart. That beating organ is now like a deflated tire after roaring across a police issued spike strip. 

How does Hash House a Go Go exist? Even if you're drunker than a 19th century prospector, it's still easy to feel bad about stuffing your face with the food that's served in this restaurant. Forget reading Dante's Inferno; this place is like living the third circle of Hell. Everything is perpetually slathered in gelatinous gravy, propped up by creaking pillars of bacon, or slathered with butter and pancake syrup.

But...

It's so good. 

If your girlfriend is laboriously attempting to make eye contact with you, even as you ram fried chicken the size of a Buick down your throat, your brain will still refuse to emit shame. You will make her sign a disclaimer, before you enter the restaurant, that says, "As your girlfriend, I will still love you even after your body absorbs seven biscuits in thirty nanoseconds."

And you know what? That obligatory story about how quantity overwhelms quality is an old wives tale when it comes to the hallowed ground of Hash House a Go Go - everything here deserves to be stuck to your incisors. 

So go on and make it rain, Hash House a Go Go. In this case tears of defeat and of joy.

My husband and I went here on a whim after we missed the local breakfast buffets. Holy. Moly. Why haven't we come here sooner?? EAT HERE NOW. 

Our server Alfie was amazing. His service was timely and suggestions were spot on. This place DOES have the best chicken and waffles we have ever had. We also had the French toast - uhhhh YUM. Shared hot chocolate and the caramel mocha. Both sooo good. If you want tasty food, great value, and great service, come here!! And ask for Alfie.

The portions are huge and sharing an entree is wise.  Food is tasty, but the waiter we had was not so attentive to checking for drink refills. I had to ask another server and a busser for iced tea refills. That is what made this place miss a 4th star. But again, good food and great portions. SHARE an entree!

Food is really yummy.

I had the chicken and waffles and it was so good. I shared with my sister because it was a lot of food.

Their pancakes can feed 3 but taste great. The breakfast potatoes are also really good. 

Love this place
Huge portions! Epic food creations! Quick and friendly. Ate here multiple times and it was killer!!!

I like this place. It's actually a hidden gem on Fremont St. The service was cool, quick and efficient. We had the "Man vs. Food" Fried Chicken Benedict. DELICIOUS! 

Huge Portions....and the staff warned us. So we shared the meal and still ended up with leftovers.

We are semi locals in Vegas and have eaten everywhere.  This is best place we have eaten in years.  Tons of food, no skimping on fresh ingredients, great menu with breakfast all day.  As an example, a side of mashed potatoes comes in a hugh dish, chock full of bacon pieces and other stuff, with full slices of bacon on top, whole thing buried under cheese toupe.  Prices reasonable.  highly recommend.  Have bottled beer and fancy drinks.  I suggest they add beer on tap. Wish they would open places in Los Angeles area.  Would be a hit.

Legit one of the best burgers I have ever had. Unreal. Juicy and just melts in your mouth, you can basically them stuffed with anything! And great service! Also highly would recommend the kiwi watermelon vodka drink!
Mucho deliciouso the food is pretty darn legit, good and big serving of food, really filling! Taste like authentic mexican food

This place was on my list to check out in DTLV...and it was pretty good. Service was slow, even though only myself and 3 other tables were there, but the food came and I was happy. Huge portions of standard-faire breakfast items...of course had hashbrowns. It is located right in the front of the Plaza casino and is nice to envision Old Vegas here, that's why I like the Plaza. Basically drunk food, but in a good way.

You absolutely must try this place. It is delicious. The portions are huge - one plate will be big enough for two people to split. Even their drinks are enormous! Servers were fast, attentive, helpful, and friendly. Fun place. Wait time is around 20 minutes. Would love to come again.

The most amazing food!!  Best crispy chicken I've ever ever ever had!!  The Sage chicken and waffle was amazing!  The waffle had bacon and the chicken breasts were sooo juicy and crispy!  I must revisit.  Till we meet again Hash A Go Go.

Make sure you come with stomach and not hungover. One meal is enough for 2-3 people! The chicken and waffles were amazing! It was fried and seasoned perfectly. I'd order just the chicken next time we come, even though the bacon in the waffles were awesome. Just wish the waiter checked on us and didn't forget our drink.
They have amazing food here. The portions are massive. The prices are reasonable for what you get and the service is excellent. We love stopping by when we are in town.
Great food!   I had the chicken hash. Not was so well seasoned.  The portions were so big that I split it with a friend and we still didn't finish.  I will be back!

If it were possible to have half a star, I would have done that.  This location is the first thing you see when you enter the hotel located just off Fremont.  However, don't be fooled -- there is nothing special going on here.  Quite honestly, we should've left after being seated as the lady working the front had the worst customer service. Yet we gave it a chance. 

Then our server -- slow as ever -- came over.  Don't worry, he didn't have ANY manners.  When someone says thank you, a simple "you're welcome" will suffice. 

While waiting way too long to order, we heard an employee (the lady with colorful hair) repeatedly cursing.  Mostly talking about how she didn't want to be at work, with quite a few more "fucks" in that statement. 

We will spare you the details as to how bad the food was. 

All in all -- DONT FUCKING DO IT!

The food here is good but the portion sizes are grotesque. After seeing what was being brought out to other customers, my husband and I decided to split the Texas Ranchero and a side of fruit. We're both good eaters, and we got stuffed while still leaving easily 1/3rd of the order on the table. For one entree! The pancakes we saw being brought out were literally the size of a large pizza. It's so incredibly wasteful, both in terms of the amount of food that must be thrown out every day and that they're charging $16 for an entree that only a linebacker could attempt to finish. How about cutting it in half and charging $8 or $10?

What a cool find at the end of Freemont street in the Plaza hotel.  We were looking for breakfast food and trusted the yelp reviews and they were right as usual.   I had the chicken and waffles and it is more than any one normal human can eat.  Two big breast and 4 or 5 waffles.  I was hungry and I am a big man and I left a lot of food on my plate.  Portion 5, chicken 4.5 waffles 4 price 3.5 service 4.  We will go back next time we are on Freemont street.

Solid spot to eat on Fremont. Waffle was delicious and my wife loved her burger. Great spot for morning/brunch. Would have given it a 5 star but the wait was a little over 39 minutes to get in and then another 20 minutes to get our food. Long wait but will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas.

Delighted by our waitress (Sonia) and her knowledge about the menu and recommendations.  We decided to get the HH Bloody Mary and the BLT Mary!  Great options.  We split the chorizo hash and it was really good!  I'd like to come back and try the Man vs. Food chicken!  I am happy that we made the trip!  Well worth it!!

It was amazing! I ordered the Man vs. Food Favorite. I should've known it was beyond huge, but it was totally worth it!! I had a full to-go box filled for later. The mashed potatoes are spot on. Our server was friendly.

How can anyone dislike this place? Huge portions, good food and good service. Just found it by accident and was very satisfied. Portion was so big and tasty I couldn't stop. Had to when I started to sweat. And great beer selection to top it off.

We decided to try hash house a go go after reading several positive yelp reviews.

We were a little put off when we got to the Imperial Palace location at approximately 1 pm.  The line/wait was insane and the crowd was already extra loud and extra drunk.  Blame it on Sunday afternoon football I guess. 

I called The Plaza location and was kindly informed that there was no wait at the moment. We made way over and were seated immediately.  Our server was awesome and attentive and the food was delicious!  My husband ordered the chicken and waffles along with a side of biscuits and gravy, and I ordered the infamous Andys sage fried chicken w/spinach and chipotle cream.  EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!!

I accidentally ordered the wrong Andys dish and I offered to take it to-go while I ordered the correct dish, but the gentleman who brought my food over said not to worry about it and got the right dish out to me in no time.  It was extremely nice of them considering I was the one who made the mistake.

Service was a little slow towards the end but not enough to make me think anything less of the place.  We enjoyed our dining experience there and definitely look forward to going back!

The food wins every time!! Our first time in Vegas and we had to visit this place. The food portions are INSANE!!! I had the chicken and waffles and it was sooo good! Come ready with a huge stomach!!! The wait staff were pretty nice as well!

I had the basic breakfast with 2 scrambled eggs, crispy potatoes, biscuit and I didn't get any meat but you have a choice between bacon, sausage and ham. I took a star away bc the chicken sausage is encased in pork so it's not really an option for those who don't want pork. Bummer. But what I got on my plate was more than enough food. Everything was GOOD. Scrambled eggs on point. But the star was the biscuit!! So so so good. Also had the s'mores coffee thingy. It was good but it was more of a dessert.
Really great portions and super huge!!! Pricing is reasonable for the portions they serve. Had the banana maple pancakes and absolutely bomb.

This restaurant was recommended for breakfast, we went for dinner and everything was good except from my fork to my mouth. The service was awesome and the presentation of the food exciting, it is something you would see on Man vs Food. The portions are HUGE, enough to share with at least three people, if not more. I ordered the Benedict and it was easily a four people portion. I love a good eggs Benedict, but this dish was lacking and I could only eat a few bites. Pretty dry from the biscuits, to the chicken and bacon which was way over cooked. This place gets great reviews and has celebrity credibility, I'm sure it was just the fact we were there so late. The restaurant prides it's self in being "farm fresh". I'm going to tell you, it was not farm fresh quality and I wouldn't go back, nor recommend this diner joint.

The friends love this place. I on the otherhand went for breakfast, got the breakfast and wasn't totally stoked. The eggs were ordered over easy and we're pretty raw in the center, on both plates. If I return again I will get the eggs scrambled and won't be as disappointed. We sat at the bar. Service was good. Just a shame about the eggs.

Poor service.  Close to $40.00 for 2 breakfasts!  Food was fine.  Nickel and dimed all the way!  Waitress served highest priced items for everything we ordered.   We wanted the $5.99 side of biscuits and gravy.  We got the higher priced full breakfast.  We ordered orange juice and of course was brought the extra large ($4.99). We complained to the manager who did take $8.00 off our bill.

Food and servers get 5 stars!! Hostess gets a big fat  ZERO!! I had never been here and was excited to try it when we got to the hostess she looked at us and then looked away and continued to shuffled through papers after standing there for a few minutes we just decided to let her now it was 6 of us she continued looking annoyed with us like we were bugging her then grabbed menus and just walked over to a table set the menus down and walked away.
