Never spoke to us once.
Hash House is consistently great whichever location you go to. This location has no wait, unlike the other ones. Huge portions usually means sub-par food, but that's not the case at Hash House.

Unprofessional as ever! How can you tell someone they'll lose their table if the entire party isn't present but you're running your mouth while we're waiting to be seated. I asked was she the manager because clearly she was talking like head hancho. However, the lady next to her watching her run her potty mouth was the manager. What a joke! I ALMOST FORGOT TO ADD THE FOOD WAS DISGUSTING! My plate, my friends and boyfriends.

This place is a big no thanks. The wait staff doesn't know how to handle even a mild rush. It took quite a while for us to be seated, place an order or get a refill. 

I ordered an egg white scramble with fruit. The serving of eggs was small and tasteless. I don't think they used salt or pepper even. The fruit was mostly frozen fruit and just mush. The melon wasn't ripe and the banana was completely green. Eggs and fruit should be the easiest meal but somehow they couldn't even do this right. I didn't even finish my plate and ended up getting a snack somewhere else after we left. 

What a waste of time and money.

During my week stay at the Plaza I must have eaten here at least 6-8 times.  The portions are INSANE but this girl knows how to eat so I wasn't worried.  That being said...I was NEVER able to finish my food and since the hotel rooms don't have a fridge or microwaves the left overs just go to waste.  

The service was always wonderful...such a friendly and courteous staff.  I even had several waiters pose in pictures for me.  During my visits I had a meatloaf sandwich, farm scrambles, pasta, chicken...just a variety of dishes.  I loved everything I ordered.  If you're staying at the Plaza this will be your "go to" restaurant and you won't be disappointed!

It was time to leave Las Vegas, so we met up with everyone around 10am at Hash House A Go Go in the Plaza, we again were a party of 12, but 3 of our guest needed to order, eat and leave to go catch a flight back to Cali.

Our server was fast and friendly, understood they needed to go, got there order out to them fast and dropped the check off  without any issues. I love a place that can work with you like that.

After checking out the menu, I found out that it was a full menu, you could order lunch as well as breakfast, I was happy for that because this time I was not in the mood for breakfast, though their biscuits and gravy are killer! 

I went with the BBQ chicken sandwich, bbq chicken breast covered in sauce, topped with onion rings and cilantro on a whole wheat bun, I sure wasn't trying to be heathy, but this was what I wanted! And for not additional price you can swap out the fries for their famous mashed potatoes, just do it!!! Those mashed potatoes are the bomb!! So good!  The sandwich was perfect, so dang tasty, I could have gone for a little bit more sauce, I liked saucy, but other than that, it was delish baby!

My friend ordered the chicken and waffles, and if you haven't seen them, they are huge and had some waffle up for grab, heck yea I tried one, that waffle was stuffed with BACON!!! OMG, BACON stuffed waffle!! Man next time I come back Ill have to remember to order that! 

I really enjoy Hash House, it's a definite stop whenever in Vegas.

Went here the morning after NYE this year after staying in the Plaza. This was my 4th or 5th visit to Hash House, but my first visit at this location.  From past experiences,  I knew not to order the Sage Chicken Benedict, as it's dry and tastes like baby puke. I'm a big Benedict fan. So that's a let down. So my first choice was another random breakfast, but there was something in it that I didn't like,  and they wouldn't modify it. Back up plan was the salmon Benedict.. it was just gross. Dry. Fishy as ever. Stunk. I wouldn't call it a Benedict. Hollandaise sauce and eggs on top of bread of some kind is what it should be. Not dry potatoes, dry biscuit, and dry protein covered in puke sauce. Large portions of that does not make it better. Service was mediocre. Energy sucked. My dining mate also was not happy with his food. It's large portions of eclectic concoctions that don't mesh well together.  If you do go here, stick to pancakes or waffles. Their savory dishes leave much to be desired.

I love this place. Every time we come to Vegas, this place is a must!! The food is great, the portions are humongous, the price is decent, the service is great, what more can you ask for??? I have never had anything bad from here! Speaking of service, our server ( Rebecca) was awsome. She had a really wonderful attitude that I appreciated since my awful experience at the plaza hotel in the casino with a rude worker. She was a breath of fresh air! I will never go back to the plaza's casino but will definitely go back to the hash house in the plaza!!! Thank you Rebecca for your positive attitude and wonderful customer service!!

Wow !! The Sage Fried Chix Benedict dish was ORGASMIC !! Huge and I ate the whole thing ( Never ate the rest of the day) Every bite uncovered bacon or eggs or a biscuit, this is a close to glutanny as one could get and walk away unscathed !! This dish was a work of art and the chef a rockstar in my mind, wish I took a photo of it !! I will return and you should too !! Plaza charges 5 bucks to park but get the tix validated and the main casino cage gives you your 5 spot back !! "Nuff said !!!

The FOOD is HUGE!!  They have the same menu as the original location but the food didn't taste as good.  Not to say that the food didn't taste good, but I usually order one of the breakfast griddles with salmon and it lacked the same flavor as the Sahara location.  Nonetheless, the staff was awesome.  We were seated quickly, served quickly, and got our check right away as soon as we were ready to bounce out of there.  So nice to have a busy restaurant take care of you even those there are tons of other people to cater to as well!

I really liked this place.  It bills itself as an American breakfast with a twist.  It sure does have a nice twist.  I had the corned beef hash.  Nothing normal.  This hash has monster chopped fried potatoes and the corned beef was not little chunks of beef but long tasty strings.  The twist is also the meal comes with cantaloupe and a slice of orange with a sprig of sage in the toast.

Average at best.  Slow service.  Big potatoes which are nice.  I suggest 4 people coming and sharing 3 meals for hungry eaters.  The flap jack is a bit doughy.  All in all decent breakfast and large portions for the price.
Great food! Not to happy about the waitress keeping some change of mine, not getting a receipt also. Not Good! For that reason you are getting only 2 stars.

We started at the MGM grand and were bound for this place located in Old Vegas.  It was as my friend said, "Harld & Kumar's White Castle."  We traveled such a long distance on public transportation to reach our final destination, Hash House A Go Go.  It was as if the place was glowing.

Great service, huge portions, tasty food.  We freaking had a photo shoot as soon as our food had arrived.  It was as if the food was Brad Pitt.  Then nothing but silence at our table, because our mouths were full of food.  Tips would be to share your meal, unless you want to have left overs.

Hands down the best breakfast I've had. They use local ingredients and the portions are huge. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The wait for our table wasn't long maybe 10 minutes but they were busy. Our food probably took 15 minutes.  That's a good turn around time.  The decor was cute and inviting. The hash and Benedict sauce was to die for. The biscuits were huge and flaky and the bacon was thick and tasty. Everything on the menu is huge so don't underestimate the size based off the menu. They serve real cream with your coffee too! Did I mention I love this place?! It's a must go for Vegas.

I've been to 3 different Hash Houses in Vegas, and this was one of the best, we got seated immediately, too, which is a bonus in itself.

We ordered 3-4 plates between the 5 of us and it was too much food. The portions are huge and it was all delicious. 

The ribs were delicious and tender, the chicken was juicy, moist, and tasty, and the mashed potatoes were the bomb.

After picking up my bib packet for Saturday mornings 9/11 Remembrance Run 9./11 K race I am running, the lady & decided to grab some mid afternoon lunch. Being in the eclectic people watching mecca of the west (also known as Fremont Street in Las Vegas) we settled on checking out the newly remodeled Plaza Hotel, and our first foray into the quirky "Hash House a Go Go" which just opened recently.

After getting welcomed and seated we both decided to feast on this big, bad sandwich:

"INDIANA FAVORITES

Big O'crispy hand hammered pork tenderloin sandwich
With onion, pickles & of course ketchup on a whole wheat bun served with your choice of side. You'll think you're back in Indiana!"

So when Tommy our server came to take the order, we rolled with it.

Except I made a fatal food service customer error.

I asked if I could have some *lettuce* added to the above.

See, as a former Hoosier, I grew up with pork tenderloin sandwiches. The staple of VFW Post lunches, greasy all night diners, and fairs & festivals. Except, as the HH description notes, it is not served with the 'traditional' IN combination of lettuce, tomato, and mayo. Understanding this, I figured I would compromise, and make just a minor deviation.

"Can I get lettuce added to mine also please?", I asked.

*pause*

Tommy: "you want lettuce on yours also. Uh, well, I can add it, except it would come as a side, so it will come as a "side item", and its an additional upcharge for $2.00. Did you want me to do that?"

Me: (silence while mentally calculating how two leafs of iceberg lettuce retails out to $2.00 in food service). "Um, no that's okay, I can't justify that".

Good thing I didn't ask for tomato and/or mayo then.

The meal came out and as described, the hammered tenderloin was HUGE. Mind you, this is how it is depicted.

Mine appeared a bit differently: Less fanfare in the presentation. Which was still okay. With no pickle. The thing is HUGE. And wasn't too bad taste wise.

Tommy was a great server. Brought a refill of drink out before less than 1/4 remaining- always a gold standard. Pronounced my last name on debit card spot on, which can be difficult. 

Tommy also said "I checked with the manager about the lettuce and she said that they could not do it without charging extra... which I don't agree with personally".

So all in all, this particular server is on top of his game. The food was decent, yet not remarkable. And my bill for the sandwiches, soda, lemonade and the fries? A staggering $39.00 for lunch with no adult beverages.

That's right. Kind of a pricey lunch for what you get, however I guess the portion size makes up for it.

With that said, the fact that you cannot make a simple addition like iceberg lettuce is the reason I will not go back to HH in Las Vegas. I can buy an entire head of lettuce for about 99 cents. I understand restaurants making profit, and certainly addition or substitutions can cost more. 50 cents extra? no problem, I guess. I come from an area where tomato is a seasonal item and can actually cost more off season (i.e. 'deluxe' on a burger). I guess for the same price I should have ordered the hamburger which comes 'deluxe' instead.

My point to the review/rant is that customers in restaurants often do need to make substitutions or changes out of dietary concerns, and I get that. However the server discussing it with the manager and her standing firm on that kind of a request for such a simple item is a bit out of line. I can get lettuce on by $1.29 BK double cheeseburger for nothing, because it is an inexpensive item. An upscale restaurant needs to have *some* flexibility to its policy on adding "vegetables" as a side item. Had I ordered a "side of lettuce", then I would expect to be charged more for it because that is known as a salad. I should have asked to trade for the pickle I never got on the sandwich instead and called it even.

I don't make a policy out of speaking to managers. The last time I did so (calmly and as we left) it led to a fight in the relationship, and I don't need that hassle either. So what is one to do?

Vote with my money.

And that is why I will not be back to Hash House A Go Go.

Everything is really, really good. My favorite is the sage chicken benedict, but I've also had the tenderoin, home made corned beef hash (so delicious!), chicken and waffles....delicious.  My husband was not impressed with the chicken pot pie but everything else has been really unique and tasty.  We took friends who also raved.

The food portions are massive! They're massive and they're delicious! I had the chicken and waffles and I tried a few other dishes of friends. I wish we didn't find this place on our last day of our 5th trip. Regardless, the place is good and I look forward to returning next year.

My sage fried chicken Benedict was amazing!  Portions here are HUGE!  I wouldn't recommend the stuffed burger.  It was very bland!  Also the BBBLT was plain and was totally shut down by my sage fried chicken Benedict plate.

The portions are on the large side. My husband and I were able to share our breakfast. Fresh fruit and crispy house potatoes were a plus. 
Enjoyed our meal so much, we ate here again on our 2nd day.

You better come here hungry . the portions are HUGE and i mean HuGE!! You definitely get your moneys worth.The food tastes and looks amazing . the staff was really nice and the food came out quick . great family dinner.will definitely make this a new Vegas stop.

Took an out of town friend here to eat, actually the food was plentiful, and good.  The problem is I charged my meal, $43.16 and rounded up to $50.00 

Checked my debit the next day and someone added $1.79.   I will dispute it when it clears my account.  Granted it was between 16 to 17% and not 20%, I was just making it an even number.  I'm not happy that someone changed my amount on my receipt, it's called stealing.

If you charge, check your charge as soon as it posts.  Granted it isn't allot, but if they do this to the customers and they (the customer, blows it off because its only a buck or 2) it adds up and a very bad practice.

Always a great meal no matter what location you are at. And seriously who complains about large portions?!  Best banana pancakes I have ever had. The only bad thing is the wait so just get there before 10 on the weekends.

My boyfriend and I went twice, once for dinner, and another time for breakfast (using our restraunt.com coupon).

For dinner, I had the griddled cheese and he had the stuffed burger. They were HUGE, we were not able to finish them. Delicious though, and our waitress was very nice. We tipped her a little extra. I also tried their strawberry lemonade margarita and it was AMAZING.

Breakfast was a little more disappointing, but not because of the food. I had the pancake combo and he had the chicken and waffles. Also huge portions, but at least we (well, me at least) were able to finish them. I also tried the kiwi watermelon lemonade which was also amazing. 

Our waitress that day was nice at first, but getting the check took forever. When she finally came back it was to confirm that we were the people with the restraunt.com coupon, then she was gone again for another 10 mins. It got pretty annoying, especially because we had finished some time ago and our plates were already gone. The waitress the day before had a party of 32 she was attending to, yet she was still able to tend to our needs in a timely matter!

After getting off a redeye to Vegas with two girlfriends, we were extremely hungry and in need of coffee.  Stopped by because some friends told us that this was THE place to go.  First off, it's a pretty nice restaurant...for where it's located.  It was clean and there was no line (7 am in Vegas, go figure).  They get a start for that.

When I say that we were extremely hungry, we were.  But the portions of food are SO extreme, I don't know how anyone finishes their plate there.  This is the restaurant of gluttony.  The three of us could have shared one meal and still had leftovers.

Other than having a massive amount of food, there's nothing special about this place.  The biscuit was rock hard and tasteless, the hash was nothing special, and the potatoes were MEHHH at best.  The food took almost 25 minutes to come out.

I'll never go again and definitely not recommended.  Especially for you Hawaii people who know a good hash.

We went here to celebrate my brothers birthday Father's Day and it was a great great choice. I've only been here once before but that was several years ago I am glad that we came back. Our server Christy(or Kristen) was awesome! She was very pleasant and funny!! We went for breakfast/brunch and I must say their menu is unlike any other. It's very over-the-top and tons of food which is awesome! You totally get what you pay for and I can't wait to go back!
Consistently good. You can't beat their sage chicken, whether it's with waffles or just eggs. Huge portions! Fast service too.

I must admit that I came here with high expectations as I've seen a few specials praising Hash House A Go Go however when I finally was able to try this Las Vegas legend I was not very impressed. Unable to order the praised pancakes, since there were no gluten free options, I opted for a scramble filled with sun-dried tomato, basil and goat cheese: three ingredients destined for perfection. It was to come with potatoes and fruit and a side of bacon (which was an extra $3.95) when my food arrived it looked delicious and promising, but my side of bacon was rather sad and turned out to be cold. When I asked for a new side of bacon some was brought to me immediately and I'm convinced it was simply because it was microwaved. I'm guessing so because I've microwaved plenty of bacon myself. As for the scramble, it was good, but not the best I've had and the potatoes although tasty were not evenly cooked. 

The service was good, but the overall experience was not worth the price/the hype.

I almost did not go here because of the reviews that I read but I am glad that I DID!

Some places get kinda screwed by uber sensitive Yelpers and this is one of them.
This place is meant to be fun, fresh, and big. It delivered for me and we came back two more times (one time was for more Budweiser in a bag)

The food was huge and delicious. Our server was slammed but he could see that we were good energy people so he made sure to keep us entertained even though he was slammed.
We were drinking Hamms beer and Budweiser in a bag at 8am which was super fun and then the food came out...
Well as you can see in all of the pictures, the food was huge. Lets not forget that it was delicious too!

Biscuits were warm and fluffy, chicken was moist, and meatloaf was perfectly seasoned. 
I really like what they are doing here and if you are staying downtown then this is a pretty cool place to eat if you have the time or if you are super hung over

Recommended by many folks but never made time to go when in Vegas until my daughters fastpitch team decided to have their Team dinner here and boy was it worth the wait.
The restaurant was very accommodating as we where a large group and actually closed off a section of the restaurant for all of us. The menu is overwhelming as they have such delicious menu items to choose from! My Huckleberry sin drink was delish and my food was even better! I believe it was called the Blue Crab benedict? I literally could not even eat half and was stuffed to the MAX! Make sure you are hungry when you go here as their portions are out of this world! Our waitress was very attentive and we had excellent service.
Alfie our server Alfie was awesome. We had the sage chicken eggs Benedict as featured on man vs food. Holy shit it was good. Mother in law had the banana French toast. She loved it. Come here!!!!!!!!

Pretty good place to eat if and when you are in the mood to really EAT...serving are pretty much big and you can order one and share it ... check it out .. for me it's just like a diner....again if you are into big servings then this is your place to eat.....
Great breakfast, service was awesome and good prices for the portions. I wish they had one in Colorado!!!
Super huge portions. Will get sick if you eat it all...lol... Kidding. Ordered a cheesecake but the inside was still uncooked, runny... Yucky. Waitress was kind of rude. Won't go back.
Hash house never disappoints. Martha was super nice and handled a busy morning very well. If you need a place to eat downtown Vegas, hash house is definitely a place to go!
Hash House A Go Go is my favorite spot for breakfast on Fremont.  The Bloody Marys are fantastic, and the meal portions are very large.

Was with a group of 6... Took a hour to be seated. Within that hour we already decided our food but it took another hour to get out to us!! Service was terrible! Couldn't even keep our drinks refilled... The burger was tasteless and greasy and my fries were soggy.. It was just terrible overall!

If you don't go here you are missing out. Prices are great for the portions you get. I would highly recommend splitting meals. You will probably split a meal and still have leftovers. Our table got several different items. The banana French toast was awesome! So delicious and exactly what you want if you're craving something sweet. You get three huge slices and can get items on the side if you want. I got the bacon, avocado, onion, and Swiss farm scrambler. It was super good! Biscuit looked awesome! I wasn't too impressed by the fried potatoes - they weren't very crispy and I didn't end up eating many. My friend got the meatloaf hash and really liked it. She could only eat about half of it. A couple people who are Bloody Mary connoisseurs got the BLT Mary and were impressed - and these people have Bloody Marys every weekend, so they must have been great. The most amazing thing was the Andy's Save Fried Chicken Benedict. Oh. My. God. It was on man vs food. This thing could easily serve four people. It was so damn good too! The fried chicken was perfect and had a good spice to it. The combination of everything was on point. I have literally thought about it each day since trying it. You will not regret it - just make sure you share! Also, be sure to get the 25 oz Budweiser in a paper bag. It's too classy to pass up.

So this has always been one of my favorite places to eat with my wife (your going to want to share) but when she suggested we have our daughters 21st B day party here I thought it might be really expensive but after looking at the menu w did it. 

As usual the staff was awesome. I mean way above their normal good service. Rachel was so awesome it really added to the experience and management kept coming around and making sure our group of 30 were all being served and happy. 

Since we typically share, I haven't tried too many dishes here because my wife is not big on trying new things. OK, I'll say it, she likes it simple and she likes it that way. Today I got see some new dishes. One of the most amazing was the chicken pot pie. That is definitely my new order. Oh wait, my son had the corned beef sandwich, maybe that's next. Another friend had the salmon and that looked really good. Oh man, this party may have blown my desire to share.

Thank you HH staff for making this a memorable event.

This place is actually good. Went here for the second time (but first time at this location) this time I decided on a burger and it was quit delicious. The Patty was stuffed with cheese, avocado, and bacon I believe. Big portion, at a good price. The only downfall was the service at the time. Our waiter seemed rude to me. I think at any job you should try to be happy and do your job, without any complaints.

Our second visit to the Hash House and it was well worth it! The portions are HUGE (bring a friend and share)...... Prices are good.

Wished I had known they had a Gluten Free menu. Instead I ordered what I thought would have been GF and asked for no bread. Come to find out, they do offer GF bread. Wish our waiter would have asked/said something when I modified my order.

Would recommend every day!

HORRIBLE SERVICE. Came in around 10 o'clock on a Friday. REBECCA was my server. 

I started off ordering french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. I specifically asked for my French toast on the side... I don't like syrup touching my eggs

The food takes a little while to come out and of course they bring it out all on one plate. 

Next I ask for some extra syrup. They only give you your tiny bit with your order...

I end up waiting maybe 5 minutes and REBECCA brings me a side of butter. When I asked for syrup????

She apologizes and said she will bring me more syrup. 

So I wait and wait. I watch her bring out water and food to other tables. Continue to wait. Keep in mind I'm not eating food. I'm waiting for my syrup...

REBECCA DROPS THE CHECK... MEANWHILE THERE'S PLENTY OF FOOD ON THE TABLE BECAUSE I DID NOT GET SYRUP!!

So disrespectful. I ended up asking someone else for syrup and eating my cold french toast. They're lucky I didn't leave without paying. I hope she didn't expect a tip

the original is bad and i'm mad at myself for letting a friend drag me to the plaza location against my better judgment.  i'm giving the place one star because there is no ability to give it a zero.  answer me this: how can mashed potatoes with cheese and bacon have no flavor?  it's really an amazing feat but hhagg pulls it off.  the meatloaf sandwich also suffers the same fate.  these dishes could actually be edible if the cook would discover salt and pepper.  my buddy (who is much less picky than me) was suckered into the chicken and waffle dish.  I previously made that mistake, but given his forgiving taste buds, I chose not to steer him clear.  the highlight of the evening was when he commented that the field of fried leeks piled on the dish tasted like hay.  he then proceeded to ask the server if the owner of hhagg also owned a rosemary farm.  priceless.

We went for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. Seemingly not busy, but waited 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. Then proceeded to wait without a check in for 25 mins for breakfast. The food was not great, and was cold. She never checked on us and never asked if everything was to our satisfaction. We had to ask a busser to ask if he could track her down for the bill. Suffice to say we will not return.

The food is great, waitresses are super super sweet. But let me tell you something about the jerk of a manager they have working here. Ed, a bigger & much older gentleman, supposedly the manager, is so unbelievably rude. He came over to us, and immediately said "Move your luggage, this is a walkway". (He literally commanded me). Not only is the walkway about 4 people wide and my tiny suitcase is the size of a small dog, but as I dropped my phone and clearly struggled to put my very heavy suitcase under my feet, he watched me struggle and didn't once offer to help. Note, he stood there staring for the full duration of me putting it away. As a woman, I've never struggled in front of a man who didn't offer to assist me. It wasn't even busy, at all. I mean, I was STRUGGLING, and he just scoffed & walked off. Nothing like having to enjoy a meal with your feet uncomfortably sitting on your luggage. We watched him ask, "how's it going?" to various other tables right next to us, but never came back to us. The food really is fantastic, but as a place that serves primarily breakfast foods, how do run out of orange juice? Next time that happens, just send Ed to get more oranges. He wouldn't be missed. I'd opt for another location if you can.

Wow...Wow...Wow...

I cannot say enough about Hash Hash.  I ate at this location on 3 occasions during my recent trip and was never disappointed.  Actually had the trifecta, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

The trucker breakfast plate is amazing, including the pancake that is bigger than your head.  I had the Meatloaf sandwich and it was to die for.  The sides are are also crazy big and outrageous.  The mashed potatoes with bacon and cheddar could easily be a meal in itself.  

After our 1st meal we did figure out that one entree could easily be split among 2 people (with room to spare).  When staying at the plaza the coupon book has a good deal in it.  There are also discounts available on restaurant.com.  After a couple hours of BJ I was also able to secure a comp meal for 3 here from the Pit Boss.

Don't miss it and don't believe the haters.  This place rocks!

Service is always on point. You always feel like you're their only customer. We got there early, so there was no wait. Be warned that the portions are huge!!! Way too much for one person to eat and you almost feel like you're wasting food. You, of course, can bag up the leftovers but if you're staying downtown what are the chances of you having a fridge or a microwave to warm it up. The bloody Mary's are to die for!

Let me warn you, if you chose to eat here and do not tend to eat a lot I would recommend to split a meal with a friend. Hash House A Go Go does not play with portion size. Their entrees are the size of your head! 

I ordered the chicken pot pie and it was enormous. It was really good but impossible to finish. My friends ordered the eggs benedit, chicken and waffles, and basic breakfast- all which were too big to consume for one person. 

Overall, great decor and service. Would recommend to all!
Great food. Only reason to go to the Plaza. Entire family loved the food . Good price and huge portions.
Great breakfast. Monique was our hostess and she is amazing, sweet, kind and quick. Really appreciated great service. Recommend the basic breakfast with grilled mash potatoes. Yummy!

This joint is awesome. They have large potions large enough to share. The 
chicken n waffles is the best I ever had. I just wish the waffles were a bit crisper, but I guess the bacon in the middle of the waffle made up for that.  Roscoes' chicken n waffles ain't got nothing on this place! NOTHING!

Several locations in Las Vegas. We stopped in the old Vegas location. Conveniently located at the entrance of Fremont street. I have visited the various Nevada locations. Staff was helpful and quick but relatively non impressing. Entertaining he was.

We were seated at a table not too long upon arrival. Waiter answered questions that we had on the menu as we contemplate various items. We had a request for an item
staff was unable to provide but waiter was nice enough to joke with us when the food came.

Execution of food was on point. Large oversized and well portioned to the price of the meals. Hot and delicious were the chicken and waffles I ordered. The dish was seasoned right. Hot was the syrup. Ascetics of the dish were stunning.

Overall gold experience not the best but not the worst. Not sure what delay in getting food out. Overall good. I would come back. Nothing egregiously bad. Better than average was this location.

My husband and I loved the very nice presentation of the food. The biscuits were very tasty as well as was the chicken and meatloaf. We will try the stacked foods next time. Great place to eat at. Staff was great and very attentive.

This was just a place we found while waiting to check in. The staff was friendly when we entered very early in the morning. My wife and I began with a delicious and spicy HH Bloody Mary. Large and flavorful. Beware: plates are very large. In fact, they get larger as the day gets longer. I had the corned beef hash and it was tender, spiced great and almost put me in a food coma. My wife had the steak and eggs that were cooked well, with a side of mashed hashed. She was pleasantly satisfied. They have fun food menu items that won't disappoint. The serving size is remarkable. One plate can feed at least two.

Worst breakfast ever :( . I am so disappointed. Had their special with eggs, meat, potatoes and a pancake. The pancake is too large and tastes terrible. Fried eggs are tasteless. Bacon undercooked. Potatoes terrible. Coffee bad.

Was quite overwhelmed by their portion sizes here (huge!).

Certainly a great selection of food and drinks.

We were a bit overwhelmed by it but certainly were up to the challenge and managed to finish our orders.

If you've never tried this place, you need to!

You ever look back at a meal and say to yourself, "thank god we shared that." I don't say it often but in the case of this place, it couldn't be more true. 10 AM Vegas breakfast is early but we had somewhere to be. Yelped and Man vs. Food verified that this place was worth checking out. 

One dish was all I needed to vindicate this decision. A fried chicken eggs Benedict that literally could of fed a family of five. We couldn't even finish it, and I'm no dainty eater. I smiled in my best food coma face as patron after patron tried to tackle this behemoth single-handedly. If you're under two bills, don't even think about it. 

Easily one of the best breakfast dishes we've ever had. Look at the pic!

Easily THE BEST breakfast I've ever had. I originally ordered the #1 Farmers scramble but it had WAY too much onion in it for my taste. I switched it out for the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and WOW!!!! Absolutely delicious. Full of flavor. HUGE portion. Could easily feed 3 people for $18! It's worth it though.

We come here every time we visit LV. And each time it exceeds my expectations. Some of my favs are the chicken and waffles, chorizo hash, and the Snickers pancake. The bloody mary's are good, but I wish there was a smaller, less expensive option. The mimosa juice options are really nice touch. My friends really enjoyed the oatmeal and benedict's. Love this place.

First time here! First impression was the smell wasnt too pleasant. Smelt like they used a dirty rag to clean our table. We moved and then were greeted by a very nice server. We got the Kokomo meatloaf sandwhich. It was delicious! Huge portion!! Highly suggest it. Would be back but hope that the smell goes away.

Food and service was great I order the basic and a cocktail at 11am yes it's vegas so why not. Food was tasty I got two scramble eggs biscuit bacon and potatoes and fruit. I love that they have more than one location .

If you are going to go to a hash house, I would suggest going to a different location. The food here was pretty eh, my dad ordered a bbq brisket sandwhich thinking it would taste bomb, but the meat was super dry and it was just mixed in bbq sauce. It also came with a salad with 2 pieces of SOGGY croutons, which was super dissapointing. I ordered the spicy grilled chicken which wasnt super bad but it did taste a bit dry. The fries that came along with it tasted pretty good and crispy. Overall, I would go to a diff hash house a go go location.

Huge portions!! It's a good thing we shared our plate. Tons of flavor in every bite went about 1130 very busy. Can't even remembered what we order . It had chicken biscuits gravy all over. Ooh man we loved it. The kids menu comes with a cute tractor toy for an extra 4 $ and it looks like the one on your table with all your condiments in it. Great for families and children.

Best tip for this place:  You need to be hungry when you go to the Hash House a Go Go! The portions are huge and the food isn't served on regular plates, it's served on platters. My husband and I both got the farm benedicts. He got the pork tenderloin and i got the sage fried chicken. The sage fried chicken benedict, starting from bottom to top-- spinach leaves, a split biscuit, griddled mashed potatoes, sliced tomato, bacon, fried chicken breast, griddled mozz cheese, scrambled eggs, and chipoltle cream sauce! It sounds odd but it's to die for. I don't think we even made a dent in the food it was so large. Two people can definitely split one meal, maybe even three people. I also had the old school hot chocolate which was topped with 4 huge marshmellows and chocolate sauce. Very good. The service was great and they gave you plenty of time to order. Everything looked so good it was hard to decide. The prices were excellent too especially for a Vegas restaurant in a hotel. For the amount of food we got, 15 dollars per benedict was very good. We probably had enough leftovers for 2 days. This will definitely be our first stop next time we're in Vegas.
Service was great. They were quick and friendly. The only thing is you have to pay for parking (@ the Plaza Hotel) portions were super huge.

I've actually been wanting to try Hash House A Go Go for years now, having first read about it probably a decade ago. We didn't quite make it on the last trip, so this time I was determined.

Our first attempt to hit the restaurant failed miserably, as we attempted to eat at the location on the strip around lunchtime and the wait was well over an hour. A few days later, we stopped by the location inside the Plaza on Freemont and the wait was a reasonable 15 minutes. (As an aside, I love the system they have. As soon as you put your name down, you get a text saying you're in the system. And then when your table is ready, you get another text. It's amazing.)

Obviously, I just had to order a hash, so I went with the Corned Beef ("Corned Beef, red onions and swiss cheese"). It arrived pretty quickly and it was enormous. The tender meat was slathered in cheese and onions and was, of course, quite irresistible, while the two sunny-side-up eggs were cooked perfectly. The dish was also accompanied by a soft-baseball-sized biscuit and a cup of homemade peach jam. (That jam is amazing, by the way. It basically tastes like a peach pie in jam form.)

My only real complain here is that the food was not hot when it arrived to the table. It had clearly been sitting under a heating lamp for a few minutes and that's a shame.

Been on my foodie hit list for a while and finally got to go for brunch.. Everything was really good. The biscuits and gravy was some of the best, if not the best I have ever had.. I highly recommend the chorizo hash, the chorizo was excellent.. Will be going back when we are back in LA..
Was there 8/23/13 and 8/24/13 Best breakfast, great service and better food. It's worth the time or drive any day of the week. Banana pancakes my wife enjoyed  and the country fried steak was  great.

I had never been to a Hash House a Go Go before but have read plenty reviews for their twisted farm food and decided to try them out for breakfast while I was staying at the Plaza.  I don't see why all the negative reviews but I had a pleasant experience here.  The service was friendly, no one dropped my food on the floor.  The coffee was piping hot and the level never was allowed to hit the bottom.  I really enjoyed my basic breakfast.  My husband got an apple pancake and the thing was huge.  Even he could not finish it and he is usually the one who finished my plate when we go out.  Now that is a lot of food.  

I forget what was here before the Plaza remodeled, but everything looks new.  The place is near the check in of the hotel and right off Fremont street so it's an easy walking distance if you happen to be staying somewhere else or even if you wanted to park at another casino.  I'm not aching to go back but I would eat here again.

Went there on a Sunday morning, place was nicely busy.. food smelled really good. After much perusing of the menu, we made out choices, scrambled skillet with grilled mashed potatoes for me and Crab cake Benedict for my friend. We kept hearing about the world famous "chicken and Waffles", and saw it go by a few times.. looked very tasty.. We didn't want to be left out of some world famous chicken and waffles so we ordered one to share. Our breakfasts were delivered and were of a very respectable portions. Both were very good. Have to say that Lo-Lo's chicken and Waffles still has this place beat. The chicken was good as was the waffle, but neither were anything special..

Overall, a really nice place to grab a bite... Oh, the bloody maria's are very good (but needed a little more horseradish :)

OK place with big portions.  The wait staff is crap...must be the management teaching them how to be crappy...or trying to make more of a buck.  The food comes in high quantity...but not quality.  I can do without the mashed potatoes, biscuits, and iceberg lettuce.  My Cobb salad was kinda smallish.  No butter for the biscuits.  No sweet-n-low.  I've been to the original in San Diego and it was really good there.  Something must be up with management or something here.  We ate here twice...but will look elsewhere.   In the hotel.  We were warned of a wait at certain times.

This place was so good. The portions were amazing, and the food was delicious. I ordered a latte with amaretto syrup for breakfast, and I got a latte with amaretto alcohol. It's Vegas so I should probably have been a little more specific. Also I'm from the Pacific Northwest where we have everything in syrup form for our coffee. Other than that the place is great

Definitely not for the weak stomach, or faint of heart, and most DEFINITELY those on a diet.  The portions are HUGE! And what's even better, it tastes amazing. Friendly service and great food, who can ask for more...well maybe ask for a doggy bag because you won't be able to finish what is in front of you.  Great for breakfast, and probably great for lunch and dinner.  Husband had the sated fried chicken and waffles.  WOW, a work of art...and who would have thought that fried leeks could taste better than onion rings?!?!
The sage fried chicken and bacon mashed potatoes were amazing. The portions are huge. We really loved this place.

Was pretty damn good, got the fried chicken and waffles. Only reason it got a 4 star is because I didn't receive a refill on my water.  Definitely recommend checking this place out, it's in the Plaza hotel.

I came here a couple weeks ago following a wedding.  This was my second Hash House experience and was just as awesome as the first!  I will say the same thing I said on my review of the Hash House at the Linq-the portion sizes are huge and can be a little intimidating, but that is their thing.  You have been warned.  The food also comes out fresh as it is made so you might not get it all at once, but at least it isn't just sitting back there.  Depending on what time of day you come, you might be waiting for a little while, but I think that it's worth it.  I know some will disagree, but you can't please everyone, right?!  I had breakfast for dinner (brinner) that consisted of pecan french toast with maple syrup and golden bananas with a side of bacon and scrambled eggs.  It was wonderful.  My husband had a chicken dish served with the pumpkin mashed potatoes and a tomato compote on top.  It was incredible!  I kept sneaking bites. Everyone needs to experience this place at least once!

Great food! Ate here because it was conveniently located in the Plaza Hotel. Had the Chicken fried steak, yum! Big portions, nice presentations, average prices for a hotel restaurant $9-$15 average for breakfast. We had a coupon, score! No complaints

Love hash house a go go.  Creative and delicious menu.  We have never had a bad choice.  One of my favorite things are the Fried Green Tomatoes.  Unfortunately they are seasonal.  If you are lucky enough to get them they are big and juicy stacked on top of a big chunk of watermelon.  They also come with a delicious sauce.  The quesadilla is huge, I can't believe they found a plate to fit it on!  Not your typical quesadilla, it comes on a bed of mashed potatoes.  If you have a car or are staying downtown try out this location.  There is not a huge wait like the one on the strip always has.  If you want to experience the full menu come between breakfast and dinner.  The menu late at night is limited although still good.

Vi hade inte provar den amerikanska klassikern friterad kyckling med våfflor förut, hörde att detta stället var bland de bästa på det, eftersom det var nära så passade vi på. Priserna såg lite höga ut, men i förhållandet till storleken på portionerna så var det billigt, men helt ärligt man hade lätt kunnat dela på en portion, men vi är ju i USA :) Maten var jättegod servitörerna trevliga, kanske lite bullrigt men det var helt okey.

This has been my favorite place for breakfast in Vegas for years. This was my first time at this particular location and it did not disappoint. The staff were happy/friendly. Service was FAST. This location is tiny which makes it feel even more quaint and gives it that downtown feel. And they are on open table! Brilliant!

I love their menu; it's a great mix of offerings. And of course the servings are huge. Good think I like to share........

The drinks are great, too. Oh, and they have nitro cold brew coffee! Amazing! It doesn't even need cream, it's already creamy deliciousness.

So I was excited to try this hip, cool comfort food breakfast. Here is the breakdown:

The food was a solid four stars. It was really good and a little different.

The service was three stars. As in many Las Vegas eateries, they just don't seem to pay that much attention to customers.

Th kicker, though, was the parking. You pay $5 for the Plaza self-park as you enter the lot. Then you get your ticket validated by your food server, who tells you to take it to the booth for a refund of your parking fees. There are no further instructions - or signs - telling you that it isn't the parking lot booth where you paid. No, it's the cashier booth in the casino. So that's three stops to get your parking fee returned. Oh, and the parking lot is about a hundred yards from the hotel - past the Greyhound station.

Food was good. I didn't order any of the main attractions (chicken and waffles) but the blueberry HH pancakes were delicious, biscuits and gravy very good, Bloody Mary good (bloody martini not ) , the chorizo was ok but nothing special. Our waitress was very friendly and very busy. We did make the mistake of going to breakfast around 10 am on 4/20 (didn't think anything of it until we left our room) and the wait was long. But it seemed like everyone had "waked and baked". The next day we ate at 930 and had no wait whatsoever.

This is my favorite breakfast spot in downtown Vegas. If you are with a buddy, I suggest splitting your meal as the portions are huge! 

Our server was helpful, but never overbearing. The restaurant is clean, and is very casual. 

I ordered the roasted chicken scramble with crispy potatoes instead of mashed. It was tasty, but definitely needed some hot sauce to kick it up a notch. However, the biscuit with their homemade peach jam was the star of the plate!

I would come here again for the cheap eats and large portions!

Service is absolutely terrible at this place! If you get a server named Mandi, request a different one immediately.

To begin with, I was sat in a booth that did not allow high chairs, apperantly it is a fire hasard to have a high chair slightly blocking a passage way... so then why was a sat here??? We were moved to a different booth, In which the crapiest server I've had in a long time was stationed, Mandi. 

We sat for about 10 minutes before mandy greeted us, by the time she finally came by I was ready to order. I asked for an Avacado burger and my gf had the brown sugar banana pancakes. To drink, we both had water. 

Mandi brought out our waters NO STRAW. Don't you just hate that lol. I would have loved to asked Mandi for straws but she was no where to be found. So I sipped straw-less. 

25 long minutes later, she finally shows up and lets us know she will find out what is taking so long with our order. She comes back to the table food and all. Makes me wonder if the food was ready before hand and she just then got around to checking. 

The food was amazing, it was worth the wait, my Avacado burger was yummy and HUGE. My gf's banana panckaes were so good too! The food is why this place even has 3 stars from me. 

Halfway through my meal, my water runs out... but where is Mandi? My lovely gf offers to share her's. 

We finish eating, time to pay the bill. We wait and wait but no Mandi? wtf... I have a 2 year old with me, they get impatient fast and I have to sit and wait for another half hour, till finally my gf goes and looks for her. She finds her visibly eating in the lounge area... oh we were pissed. We left the money, an angry note to the manager.

Great food, good prices and LOTS of it. Had pork and the chicken and waffles (you have to do that if you visit here). Be prepared for huge amounts of goodness. Good service too. Located inside the Plaza Hotel on Fremont and Main. Open way late.

Went there a couple weeks ago for dinner before a show.  I ordered an appetizer for my meal, my wife ordered the meatloaf sandwich.  I anticipated the sandwich would be more than she could finish, so the appetizer was the right choice.  Meatloaf was tasty, as was the appetizer I ordered.  Had we ordered full entrees, there would have been way too much food (keep that in mind when ordering).  The prices were a little steeper than I wanted (I was looking for a trendy-dinner experience, yet prices were closer to $20+ a plate), but I attribute that to the portion sizes they provide.  Service was ok.  Our waiter hung out behind the bar talking to one of his colleagues a bit more than I would've liked (i.e. we could've used refills on a couple of occasions when he was chatting), but it wasn't overly intrusive.  I'd give this place a 3, but my wife would give it a 4, so I'm rounding up for her.
I seriously can't complain about anything the food was as amazing as well as the service! I highly recommend the chicken with waffles. :)

Comparing this location to the Florida one that I've also been to, their quality and food was all very similar as I remembered it.  I had their chicken and waffles and their chicken benedict that was on man v. food and it's super good!   Hash House A Go Go are known for their huge-ass portions but if you're super hungry...... you miiiight be able to finish them lol.

At this location, I had their salmon sandwich (was trying to go healthy) but was disappointed in the overall taste.  Bread was whatever, I liked the crust on the salmon but it wasn't necessarily juicy.  Just a bit dry...

I'd only come here for their fried chicken-related entrees as they are the most popular and the chicken is always tender.  First time?  Get their chicken benedict.

Sage fried chicken and waffles with bacon inside of the waffles and syrup to drizzle on top....as well as crab cakes with a pesto pasta? Call me a run on sentence but those two entrees were running tasty on my taste buds!

My brother and I shared both entrees since there are HUGE portions at this restaurant. 

We are two big dudes so we were satisfied with our order. The food was a delight. Lol who says that? Me.

Just appetizers since I know portions huge.  3 large ribs, just OK.  Thin sauce and average flavor.  Nachos and guacamole.  Served in overdone taco shell and guacamole didn't have a lot of flavor.  Will return and try one of the highly rated items.

The Food was okay...and the waitress was nice, but the hosts and the servers were terrible.  I went to the restroom to find that my party had been seated so I asked the hostess where my party (gave her the name) was seated, she gave me the side eye  and said "I don't know, go inside and look."

When the food arrived the server so clumsily placed a plate with a pancake and eggs on the table that the mini pitcher of syrup on top of the pancake toppled over and spilled into my friend's lap. The server just stood there as my friend and I were scrambling to grab the two napkins on the table to wipe syrup off clothes, arms, fingers and the table.  I said "can we get some more napkins!!??" She said Oh ok...came back a few minutes later with a small towel to wipe the table...to which I replied "syrup is all over our clothes, I need a damp towel and more napkins because we used them all trying to clean up your mess!" When she finally came back with the towel and napkins she asked if we needed a new pancake....in my head I'm thinking are you serious right now?...but I said "well as you can see all of the syrup spilled...so no we don't need another pancake but can you bring some more syrup" "ooh!" She replied "ok!" 

Needless to say I will not be going back.

The food is OK. The portions are HUGE. The service is TERRIBLE. I had to repeat myself several times for the waitress which after the 5th time was terrible. The waitress rarely checked on my party. I did not enjoy the service. I ordered the red velvet trucker combo with ham. It was only ok. The waffle lacked flavor, but the ham was good.

always worth the drive up to hash house at the plaza when in vegas. the plates are enormous, more than enough for 3 adults to share. i always get Andys sage fried chicken benedict and a cup of coffee. and i always need a to-go box! the sage fried chicken is well fried, smothered in cheese and sauce, hefty strips of bacon on top of fluffy scrambled eggs, biscuits, and amazing mashed potatoes!!!! its wayyyy too much. but too good to say no.

The service, food and location are great. If you want to get away from the strip, then this location would be perfect. I'm giving this one star because I ended up with food poisoning. Spending the night in the bathroom is not the way someone wants to spend their vacation.
best fried chicken I've ever had. It must have been partly do to the sage. So good. Waffles were whatever. I'll definitely be coming back.
This was the only place in Vegas I repeated on my trip and I went back three times. The Sage Fried Chicken was perfect. I have dreams of it!
Throwback restaurant with HUGE portions of food. Fast service and good prices for what's on the plate. Over at the Plaza Hotel right inside the front doors off Fremont Street.

First time to Vegas!! Couldn't find seafood for some reason on a Thursday night!! Asked the lady at our hotel front desk where something good was. She said the Hash House an told us it was across the street from the hotel. An since it was our anniversary an hungry as hell from walking thru the Craziest environment ive EVER seen!!!! We went there! First off the hostess was really nice!! Sat us down within seconds of walking up! Our waitress Christine i believe was her name. Was awesome!!! Explained everything thoroughly! An said the portions were larger than most. Well she didnt lie!!!! I couldn't finish my meal!!! I just got a stuffed hamburger with mushrooms an swiss an fries!! An my wife got the blue crab cakes an some prawns on a skewer. An a few Huckleberry Sin drinks ( absolutely delicious ) an didnt have to ask for more alcohol in my alcohol!! Will stop here everytime i come back!!!!!

Chicken and Waffles for my wife and the Pancakes, sausage and eggs for me. Seriously the Chicken and Waffles would of been sufficient for both of us.  I wish someone would of told us about the large portions.  However the large portions and  ambiance of the food was fun. I recommend this place if you're and breakfast lover.

Located in The Plaza Hotel Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. So this place is a little nuts. The portions are huge. With all of that the food is great and interesting. I had the duck breast it was a little chewy but still very good. The only issue is the price of drinks, they are downtown (otherwise known as the land of cheep drinks) and they should drop the prices accordingly. If you find yourself downtown and want something fun give this place a whirl. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!
Good food! Kind of overpriced and the servings were huge...share with someone and you'll be good! Drinks are fine and it was a cool experience.

Nope don't order tha Bloody Mary the mix they use is terrible. Positive side Mimosa OJ was great! Ordered a scramble egg meal and with bacon avocado and onions yuckmy eggs were drowned in onions never again

OMG the BROWN SUGAR BANANA PANCAKE!!!!  We went there twice on our last vacation to eat the BROWN SUGAR BANANA PANCAKE!!!!  The bananas are sliced in half the long way then laid on top of the pancake while it cooks.  Brown sugar melts on the bottom and forms a crispy crust!!!  There is no need for syrup!!!  MMMMMMMMMM!!!!

Love their breakfast!  Had the chicken asparagus hash which was excellent. Also the steel cut oats and fresh fruit was huge, with lots of fresh fruit.  Portions are large so if do not have a big appetite definitely recommend splitting a meal.  Service is also good so when I am looking for breakfast downtown this is my go to place!

Rolled into Vegas for a girls weekend and looked up the best place for Bloody Mary's.  We went straight to Hash House A Go Go in downtown.  I followed the servers recommendations and ordered the BLT Bloody Mary and the Chicken and Waffles.  You will not leave hungry, the portions are HUGE! The BLT Bloody Mary comes with toast and mayo on the side and bacon lettuce and tomato in the drink.  It was like getting a little appetizer with the drink, I loved it.  The chicken and waffles were beyond huge.  The waffles were stuffed with bacon, what a great idea I am so trying that at home.  Overall the food was good, the Bloody Mary was great and the staff were all friendly and attentive.  Oh, don't let the environment (run down area) dissuade you, the restaurant is clean and enjoyable.

Did you know there's a Hash House on Freemont?  
Me neither!
But luckily it sits inside the Plaza, and if you've never been and you're really hungry, then a-go-go there!
Massive portions of high-end tasting food is the best way to describe this place.
I'm always a sucker for the chicken and waffles - the chicken is wicked tender and moist, and I love the fried leeks all over the plate.
This time we tried the sausage and biscuits too, and they were "almost Texas-good", said my American-born husband. 
Highly recommend sharing an entree, unless you're like my hubby and I who don't agree on breakfast tastes (I like sweet/savory and he's a spicy chorizo kinda guy).

Wandering around the streets of Fremont, I was hungry (surprise). I ended up here because I was looking for brunchy foods. I ordered a shake and the Snickers pancake with eggs and sausage. 

As we waited for our food, my eyes grew large as I saw plates coming out of the kitchen. I wondered how I was supposed to eat it all! Luckily, my kiddo and I had agreed to share a plate. 

The shake was presented beautifully and full of all the creamy, fatty goodness you would expect. The pancake was very large with bits of Snickers throughout. The sausages were flavored well and balanced out the sweetness of the pancake. The eggs were hearty to round things out. 

Overall, I was completely full when I left.
Great restaurant, huge quantities and fair prices.  Always a go to breakfast spot.

This place never disappoints!  The third location I have visited and the food has been great each time. I wish I could review something else, but the only thing I ever get is Andy's Sage Chicken Benedict.  Give it a try and really consider sharing - it's ginormous.

Hash House A Go Go was a convenient spot for my family and I to have lunch at due to the fact that it is located right in the entrance of the Plaza Hotel and Casino. We hopped off our long flight and decided to grab a quick bite to eat after checking in at the hotel. My brother had been to this establishment before and actually recommended it to me, so I was actually really excited to have lunch here.

The restaurant definitely gets a star for their friendly staff. Our waitress there patiently took our orders and brought us everything we asked for in a timely manner. She had a cheery attitude and overall, made me feel much less stressed after my long travels. Later that night, I also came back to drop in to the bar to order that Watermelon Cocktail that the hotel had advertised on every wall. The bartender was also friendly and helped me out with my drinks quickly.
They do some pretty cool drinks and that warrants another star. During that lunch break I ordered a banana latte, which was fantastic. The warmth and general sweetness gave me a sense of nostalgia and made me feel like I was home. The Watermelon Cocktail that I got later on was also very good. Not too sweet and not too sour. Overall I was very happy with those.

Unfortunately, I was not that impressed with my meal. I ordered a mushroom burger and fries. I love mushrooms--usually I'll eat anything that it's smothered in--however, my burger tasted like it was lacking some flavor. I can't put my finger on what it was missing, but it just seemed sort of soggy and bland. The fries were great though and that really lightening the whole plate.
The atmosphere was as you could expect from a hotel lobby restaurant. The entire place was flooded with that strange smell that floats throughout the Plaza Hotel, almost like old cologne mixed in with the trademark Las Vegas cigarette smoke.

All in all, I'll probably dip back in for a drink or two if I'm ever in the Fremont Street area again, but I'll hit up a different place for lunch.

Love this place! The portions are amamzing, the food is wonderful. I enjoyed it so much, I ate here 2 days in a row. We even had the same server both days, Rachel and she was incredible. I'm so happy to know there's one in the Dfw area. I will definitely  be trying the local one.
Crab eggs benedict was sooooooo delicious and easily big enough for two. Happy hour tater bucket was perfect finger food with our beers. Will be back for sure when we're back in town!!

Others in my party wanted to go here, and I had heard mostly positive things about it, so I didn't object.  If you like big breakfast and don't mind paying $15 to $25 per person for it, this place will make you very happy.  Service was good, food was good.

So why only 2 stars?  It's not you, it's me.  Personally, I'm not really into going out for breakfast, and when I do, I often get non-breakfast food and I'd rather go someplace inexpensive. When I splash this kind of cabbage around a restaurant, it's because I am getting dinner, and when I eat this quantity of food before 6pm I feel like crap for the rest of the day.  For these reasons, this place wasn't for me.  There are plenty of affordable breakfast options within a 2 block radius of 1 Main Street.  

The cheapest thing I found on the menu with any amount of protein - and by any I don't mean very much - was the bacon waffle at about $9.  It was good for what it was, but I wasn't really into it.  With coffee, tax, and tip that's like $14 for breakfast, for something I wouldn't otherwise have ordered.  I didn't see anything else I wanted for under $10, which is my hard breakfast limit.

Others in my party seemed very satisfied with their monstrous plates of chorizo and eggs, etc.  and their bacon bloody maries.  Some of them got a waffle on the side as well.  Rolling in coffee, cocktails, tax, and tip, I think most of them were spending around $25 to 35 each by the time they walked out of there.

Next time, I'll opt for the Cafe Cortez coffee shop or the Main Street Station buffet.

We both had bacon and eggs for breakfast. My wife's eggs were scrambled and mine more over easy. You cannot fry eggs and serve them with burnt edges. My wife's scrambled eggs were good. I was hoping for more than just two pieces of bacon. When you serve bacon it should not be sitting on the shelf for more than an hour before serving. Cold bacon? Toast poor.
Will not return there in the future.
Jon our Server gave EXCELLENT SERVICE. Great huge portion, just walked right in,coffee never went low in my cup.

Wow...All I can say is WOW! This place is freaking delicious! The portions are humongous so do share! HH is located inside the Plaza Hotel near Fremont, btw.

So... first we ordered the Chicken Fried Steak which was so darn good! Recently we've been trying CFS at various restaurants we've visited w/in 3 states and this one is definitely in my top 2. The potatoes under the the gravy were amazing as well!

Second item we ordered was the French Toast dipped in banana cream, w/ pecans and fried banana. This was so delicious, no syrup was needed, so sweet as is.

Can't wait to return!

P.S. If you stay at the Plaza Hotel they give you a lil coupon book that has a coupon for $5 off your bill.

I felt the service was not stellar at all. Waiter rushed in and was like, can you hurry up. I had never been there before and I asked a question about the menu, he seemed irritated that I had asked anything. In my opinion, they should give you a hint that the portions are HUGE and can be shared. There was so much food left at the table and 3 of us ordered the same thing. Some of the food coming out of the kitchen did look good but with the service we received, I do not think I will go back.
One of my favorite places in Vegas- a must every visit. They give you a ton of food, and it is delicious. My favorite is the banana French toast!!!

The food is huge here and absolutely delicious,the service fantastic, the hostess was very helpful with a bit of extra special attentive to us also with a tat of history about the place,I had 14in. flapjacks w/ banana cook inside, with scramble eggs,one chicken sausage,the little lady had french toasts w/ cook open face banana w/ pecans on top.Parking can be a problem downtown,but if you park at the Plaza Hotel parking lot its $5.00 take your ticket give it to your hostess get validation then you have to take your ticket to the hotel cashier cage to get your money back........that's a lot of work we 're going to try one of the other two Hash House A Go Go where there is free parking.
Great food! Amazing Bloody Mary's! Huge portions. Nice atmosphere. Decent price. A very good hangover location :)

We had a late night and being hungover we needed a hardy breakfast. Most of the good places were closed but we saw this place. We lucked out that we had to wait 2 min to get seats as when we left there was a huge lineup. We had the waffle with chicken on top. I'm so glad we shared it as it was huuuge!!!! It had bacon in the waffles!!!! This place is definitely worth a try.

We've been to Hash House on Sahara many times, but this was a first for the branch at the Plaza.  Generally, reviews haven't been as good for the newer venues, but we were happy to have experienced good service and good food.

Surprisingly, they were willing to accept the restaurant.com certificate that we'd bought for Sahara but, alas, our $50 one was too big for the two of us to use, and the $10 one turned out to be good for breakfast or lunch only.  And we were there for dinner.

Hubby and I shared a burger stuffed with roasted red pepper and smoked mozzarella.  The burger is a double, so it was really easy to split.  We also a portobello mushroom sandwich with peppers, pesto, and goat cheese.  Both were terrific.

We didn't have to wait long to be seated, served, or to get the check, which was welcome, since our reason for being at the Plaza was to see The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas.  And we finished dinner with time to spare.

What an awesome place for breakfast/brunch. Definitely coming back here. Their portions are huge so keep that in mind when ordering. But honestly, I don't think anything you order here would disappoint. Plenty of options to chose from for every craving. If you're in the Fremont area of downtown Las Vegas, make sure to check them out.

Went there Friday 3/30/2018. I ordered the fried chicken with eggs, hash, bacon and a biscuit. The chicken and biscuit were both hard as a rock. The chicken was dry and I had to chew it for a long time just to get it down. I was trying to impress my date so I started out using a knife and fork to cut the chicken but pieces kept snapping off and shooting to the floor. That was one tough piece of chicken. The eggs,  hash and bacon were good. My date had a burger...I didnt taste it but it looked delicious.  I did eat some of her fries and they were excellent.

By the way...this was my third visit to this location. First time that I left disappointed.

This place is so good! The waitress was super nice, and was glad to give us her favorite dishes and drinks when we asked. She also told us that the dishes were big enough to feed two people at least. We didn't listen and still ordered separate entree and had a lot of leftover's. It's right off of Fremont Street so it is local to everything. I absolutely loved it and one hundred percent recommend it to everyone.

This trendy little spot is located at the and of the Fremont experience inside of the Plaza Hotel. The ambiance is industial gothic with perfect lighting, diamond plating, steel topped tables and vlack and red coloring. 

For breakfast today I went with the banana and pecan infused french toast With two over easy eggs 2 slices of bacon and fried taters. The french toast was perfectly gridle friend to a delicious golden brown, topped with one whole in the skin banana and a generous amount of pecans a mouth watering delight! Bacon is bacon and eggs are eggs, both perfectly cooked to order. The fried taters were perfectly crunchy but lacked seasoning. The coffee was a 2 bean roast with the most awesome Caffeine punch around. Fresh squeezed orange juice tops it off. Grade A++

The waitstaff was friendly and the time to order and for the meal to arrive on our table was less than 15 minutes.

Over all on my next return to Las Vegas this is definately on my food eateries list.


Dayne

The portions here are insane. A table of 4 sitting behind us shared 1 meal. My husband and I ordered the fried chicken Benedict and a pancake. You get plenty of food for the price and everything was good...the chipotle cream sauce was so yummy. The pancake is the size of a pizza so beware.
Food: 4/5. Service: 4/5. chicken & waffles; sundried tomato, goat cheese, basil scramble; meatloaf hash.

We tried Hash a Go go's at The plaza. Pricey BUT Huge portions. I had stuffed burger adv, bacon and cheddar. My husband Had Chicken and Waffles. Everything tasted Yummy. We liked it alot. The waiter Bryan was Awesome!
 maybe we went at a great time- 5pm, but service was great.

Service was good here.  Luckily wasnt too busy. And don't be a cheap ass, come on people,  I only gave a $15 dollar tip on a fairly pricey bill and she came and hugged me from excitement for giving her her first good tip of the night, I can't believe people are so cheap. Anyway.... the food was good, just a bit pricey. I had the bone in ribeye medium rare and they cooked it right. Don't remember what my girlfriends sandwich was called, but it was like a corn beef sandwich kind of.  Big portions. Fun place to come with friends.

We came in with a big party for my daughters birthday, had a reservation, our waiter came by to check on us, his name was Roberto and he was AWESOME.  He took drink orders and did not mind taking food orders for appetizers from some and waiting for others to come in later to get theirs.

The entire evening, he was very attentative and really cared about our well being.  He also had other tables besides ours, and through the entire night his attitude was above reproach.  He was so good at what he did he should be a manager not a server.

I have been to many places and our server here was one of the best I have ever had.  The food was aweseom as well, the portions are way more then one person can eat, so we did a lot of splitting.  At the end of the meal, he made sure the cake we dropped off earlier was ready for us.  When we were all done, he was nice enough to do separate checks for people who wanted them.  I am telling you at not time did his attitude ever change from AWESOME!!  He is a true asset to this company and I made sure he was well compensated for putting up with the crowd we had.

I'm mostly giving this place a 5/5 because it absolutely deserves higher than the current 3/5 rating!

We went this morning (a Sunday morning) around 10a and Only had a twenty minute wait! They were friendly and accommodating to our party of five including a baby in a stroller. Our waitress came over almost immediately and service continued to be quite quick from there. Since I'd been to another location before, I know how large their portions are. My husband wasn't eating, so the rest of us shared a bacon, avocado and cheese scramble and a side of chicken sausage. It came with one huge biscuit, strawberry jam, crispy potatoes (you can get mashed if you prefer), a wedge of cantaloupe and a wedge of orange. The absolute best part of the meal was how cheesey and flavorful the scramble was! There was so much cheese that when you pulled a bite away with your fork, there was a lot of gooey, stringy cheese trailing behind. Yum!! Major win!! I was also impressed with the chicken sausage  - two HUGE links. 

Like I said, I've been to a Hash House before. And I enjoyed myself. But I have to say that this visit was what made me feel like I need to come back more. I will certainly think of this place when it comes to having breakfast when family is in town. There are other dishes I need to try! The table next to us ordered the corned beef hash and it looked great!!
Food was amazing!  Huge portions! The server we had was really nice and kept my drink filled the whole time!

Got one of their recommended breakfast plates with fried chicken, eggs, bacon, mozzarella cheese, biscuits, potatoes and Chipotle cream house. Sounded great. It wasn't. They piled stuff on top of the chicken which made it soggy, the biscuits were dense and flavorless. The potatoes needed seasoning. I didn't like it at all. Asked for a side of biscuits and gravy because I didn't want to eat more than 10 bites.... And that sucked worse. The gravy had no flavor, it tasted like roux /flour and the biscuits were still hard and no good flavor. Disappointed. I had chicken and waffles years ago and liked it.

We have a large group in town for a family gathering/vacation and have frequented the other hash house a go go's in the area. Upon arrival the place was nearly empty so we got right in. Our waitress started out spunky and nice but it was only a front. She brought waters and gave us menus. As we were looking over what to order and who was going to spilt what we noticed the people behind us had Mac n cheese (which was not on the menu). If our waitress had explained that there was a happy hour menu we would have known. She came and got our drinks and food orders and told us we couldn't move seats. I guess they do their check ringing by seats. About 20 mins pass and still no drinks. Drinks finally arrive followed by our apps and food. Nearly all at the same time. 
I ordered the BBBlt with salad. Salad was great. But I've never had croutons that were soggy in the middle. Outer portion was crunchy but inside was gross! Cut into my BBBlt and there is a hair attached to one if the tomatoes. I sent the plate back and the waitress asks if I want a replacement. On the other side of the table a meal was dead cold. The waitress sends it back to the kitchen. 
We all finally get our food back and enjoy as best we could. 
Side note: ranch is .95 per container! 

Checks arrive. My meal was not comped. When I asked the waitress she said that they do not comp meals since I asked for a replacement. Wtf! 

We went round and round. After getting the manager involved the meal was finally removed. But the waitress kept coming over to tell me why she couldn't comp it! She said I was committing fraud since I requested a replacement sand which. 

All in all...we won't be back and if you hair in your food...well you are paying for a replacement sand which.
Portions are huge so share with your favorite person. Our server John was a cool Cat and had great service! The hash was great and get a drink it's worth it.

Horrible customer service. Manager would not substitute toast for eggs despite having an allergy. Would not even discount the price for not including eggs. We we told that we could purchase something else and what did we expect coming to a "farm fresh restaurant". We are locals and will not be eating there ever again. So disappointing.

HUGE portions, big menu selection. Great breakfast after a night of gambling or drinking. The stars of the breakfast orders at my table were the banana-pecan french toast and the meatloaf hash (though it is not over hasbrowns but diced breakfast potatoes). The blueberry pancake was good and one pancake is enough for a person - at least 12" in diameter. Fast, friendly service and they treated the child with us nicely, providing crayons and an inexpensive kid's menu. They also have a hefty military discount. 

The downside was that it was very loud - with competing music playing from the casino and overhead. :(
We had the chicken and waffles they were good definitely worth sharing with another person

Huge portions of good food! I had the grilled pork tenderloin with glazed pecans and honey mustard. Came with mashed potatoes and veggies. 

   Good service.

Whenever I visit Vegas, I normally always go to hash house a go go. Huge portions, heavy types of dishes. Even when I asked the waitress if one dish was more than the other, she responded with all the dishes are ridiculously large and will make you stuffed! 

I ordered the sage chicken Benedict. WAYYY TOO MUCH FOOD for one person. I highly suggest splitting the meal with another person because they give you a lot! 

The corned beef hash is bomb and the chicken and waffles are always a great meal to try. :)

The portions are huge!   I agree with the reviewer who said they should offer sharing.   

I think there was a "basic" breakfast on the menu that was like $9.99.  

Had a scramble and it was great.  Everything in the plate tasted good, the eggs, bacon, potatoes.  The potatoes were perfect, no hash browns here.  The biscuit was huge, and the homemade strawberry jam was delish.  

I have eaten at most of the breakfast spots in downtown Vegas, and this place is now one of my fave places.

Holy yumminess! This place is so fun. The atmosphere and food are amazing and the prices are very reasonable for Vegas. The waffles and chicken are SO GOOD. Huge portions, so share with a friend. We will definitely be going back.

I saw this place on the Travel Channel and said "If I ever get to Las Vegas, I'm eating there."    Last week my friends and I finally went to Las Vegas for a week vacation and made it a point to eat here... and it was the BEST meal we had the whole trip!

The size of the plates alone took up 1/4 of the table.  The amount of food you get is absolutely ridiculous.  Plus the honey biscuits they give you... OMG they have to be a pound apiece.  

I had the famous chicken and waffles and almost had an orgasm at the table.  The waffles had bacon cooked into them and the fried chicken was perfection.  It had real maple syrup on it too, not that fake crap. 

 My friends got meatloaf and stuffed hamburgers.  All you heard during dinner was "Ohhh my god this is soooo goooood!".  

Our waiter was awesome and gave us the souvenir drink glasses for free.  I wanted to try the bacon bloody mary but my tummy was telling me NO!!!!

The prices were more reasonable then I thought they would be.   For 2 people to eat like pigs and bring more than half the food home, along with drinks, was only $37.
