After dinner we waddled back to our hotel and laid in the hot tub for a few hours to digest.  Then after a few hours of drinking and gambling, we ate our leftovers and they were even better!  LOL

I've heard they just opened a new location in Chicago and I'm definitely going to find it!  Hmmm, maybe I shouldn't or I'll be broke and weigh 400 pounds!

I'll keep this short and sweet since we ate here twice in 4 days. It's convenient, but admittedly feels over priced. The food didn't seem like anything special to me, but the portions are huge. The staff is slow. We were the only two people sitting at the bar and we didn't see our waitress again after she dropped off our food. The second time we were in a booth and had to ask three separate people for coffee refills. I can't say I'm very impressed.
Food was amazing and so was the service! Large portions at a great price. I still have 2 more days left in Vegas but I'm betting that this will have been the best meal experience for the whole trip!
Seriously one of the best chicken and waffles I've had, the plates are huge the food is great and reasonably priced given the fact of what it is. Both locations are solid too. Recommend for sure!

Whenever I am in vegas I make it a point to eat here. I have tried several of the the food on the menu and they don't disappoint. Today I ordered fresh squeezed tangerine juice and it was absolutely amazing !!! Taste just like a tangerine It is my new fav drink.  Today i has the Texas ranchero and I was soooooo satisfied the flavors are amazing . I definitely recommended this place to everyone.

Server was cheerful and friendly and we were seated at table right away ..BUT my food was served cold and not a single person in our party even thought the food was even average.. A large portion of food does not a good meal make..

My mouth is too small!! Couldn't fit all of the food in!! I'm all seriousness though, the wait times are a bit excessive. I don't know that any pancake or waffle is worth an hour wait. Xoxo EatWithReese

Ordered the corn beef hash and am completely satisfied. The meat was perfectly seasoned and shredded and the dish came out in a hot skillet. Friend ordered the chicken & waffles --- another huge portion of food. We are currently experiencing a food coma, still at the table lol.

Portions are HUGE, it's definitely a good idea to split a plate with someone. I've been here a few times and I've never had a bad experience. If it's your first time I'd definitely recommend the chicken and waffles! The food here takes comfort food to another level, everything here is delicious!! The wait time can get a little crazy at the linq location but I've never had to wait to be seated at the location on the old strip. This is a must try spot!
Nothing new to add...food is always great and HUGE portions. Been to the original in SD and two locations in Vegas and have not been disappointed.

This is a really good restaurant!

They've got all kinds of cool and unique menu items. It's a little pricey, but  the portions are huge! So you don't feel ripped off at all, like at so many other places that serve gourmet food. They even serve Nitro cold brewed coffee, which is extremely rare at a restaurant.

We had the meatloaf, which was really good. It was so big me and my wife split it, and I was actually full afterwards. I wish more restaurants would serve portions like this.

Our service was not that great. Our waiter took our order, then we never saw him again until I asked another worker for our check. Some other staff member brought our food. No one ever came to ask how everything was ever. But other staff were around, and they were helpful if you flagged them down.

The main thing I didn't like is that this particular restaurant is right next to the casino at the Plaza, so it was incredibly smokey just like the casino. I hate really smokey places, and that's all you could smell here.  I would have given it 1 more star if it weren't for that.

Located in the lobby of the Plaza hotel, it's by far the shining star of the restaurants in that hotel.  Its on the pricier side but the portion sizes are huge.  We had breakfast there and loved every bit of it.  The only downside is if you're staying in The Plaza, you can't really take any leftovers back to your room as they don't come standard with refrigerators.

I use to frequent the Orlando location often and I was always curious to see how the Vegas location compared. To start off with the restaurant was understaffed on a Wednesday night. The bartender was waiting on basically all the tables. The facility seemed older and worn and it was lacking air condition. It was so hot! Apparently this is one of the "nicer" locations in Vegas. We ordered two chicken and waffles and the service was good considering there was only one waiter running around. The poor guy was making drinks, bussing tables, and taking orders. The Chicken and waffles tasted just like the ones in Orlando!

The food here is always great! Service is spectacular the quality of the food itself is high grade. Just a awesome spot in general. Chorizo and eggs are a must try. I normally to eat chorizo anywhere else bUT home and the hash house changed that.
This place was soooo delicious from the salad to the chicken and waffles, I actually ate there 3 times... definitely going back there next time...

Good for a meal "the morning after"... I did not get the hash so I cannot speak to that but my eggs, bacon and asparagus scramble was yummy and the biscuit was ridiculously huge - wished they served it with butter but I refrained from asking for it. Each plate had a sprig of rosemary on it so I felt it was kind of wasteful. The cousin got the pancake - yes only one as it fills the entire plate - see the pic- and is seriously the size of a head! The meals run $11 and up and the portions are grossly huge - just what one needs after a night out on the town.

EDC food. The chicken (2 breasts or thighs? Can't remember!) and 4waffles were the size of my face and boy was I starving after a night of dance bf my legs off. Service and speed were excellent! Portions were humongous it was a days complete worth of food for me even w again. All the dancing!!!

OK, as stated before we are big HHAGG fans but the last two times, while here in Vegas, not so much.  This time orders were wrong, 2x, things forgotten, long waits for orders.  This is sad for us.  This place was unique and so good before they exploded with so many locations.

I was very disappointed with our meal at this restaurant. Not only was it an inconvenient walk from our hotel room, but it was very hard to get connected to the restaurant. Once I did call, the man who took my order was incredibly friendly and when I picked up my food he was very helpful and made sure to label everything and included extra sauces and utensils. 
The food was okay. My Caesar salad was a definite disappointment. The dressing was horrible, the chicken was good, and the lettuce was warm and on the verge of wilting.
My boyfriend ordered Andy's Sage Fried Chicken & Bacon Waffle. It was all right, but was over-priced.
The French toast is scrumptious! Didn't get to try the Bloody Mary and I'm totally bummed about that because I hear they are amazing. Will have to come back.

I ordered the "Andy's Sage Fried Chicken - Hash House Farm Benedicts."
It came with Fried Chicken, which was slightly too crispy but cooked well, bacon, raw spinach, raw sliced tomatoes, mashed potatoes, biscuit, scrambled eggs, and topped with a chipotle-like sauce. All the components were stacked on top of each other. The price was $16.99. 

I gotta admit, the fried chicken was good. As good as some fried chicken places in LA. So there isn't a really huge surprise. And the fact that cooking fried chicken at home tastes as good... doesn't really justify the reputation this restaurant holds.
After the delicious fried chicken, the rest of the story was bland. Mashed potatoes were worse than most places, especially a dish holding a $17 head. Similar to the raw spinach, the raw tomatoes were both bland and lazy. And the tomatoes were especially hard. The bacon was over cooked and old, and added a horrible texture to the dish. 

The large size of this chain restaurant may be contributing to their descending taste.
All in all, I would rather hit the other well-known eateries (Nacho Daddy, Freedom Beat, Pig Gastropub, etc) rather than starting your day with a large, unappetizing brunch.

The food was good. This is more about the excellent service we received on 12/18 @ 9:50pm. O cannot for the life of me remember our waitress name, but she was f'n phenomenal. She came over and said, kitchen closes in 4 minutes if you're hungry (in a polite non threatening way). I actually offered to leave because I hate doing that, but she said absolutely not, stay! I asked her for a suggestion, took one of her recommendations, and it did not disappoint. My daughter wanted a fancy schmancy ginormous hot cocoa and she suggested the smaller kids version which was the exact same. Yes please!!! Food came out piping hot and she didn't over stay her welcome but came around just enough times to help. It's like she had this intuition to serve. Love it! Note: portion sizes are ridonculous. I ate a 1/4 of my hash and fed two more people.

Very good. We had a large party of rowdy adults and our server played along very well. The food was really good. The portions are very big and can probably be split between two people unless they're hearty eaters.
Ate here every morning Great food ,huge portions, great price, try the"ggs bendict", "Sage fried chicken and waffles" "corn beef hash" .....mmmmm
Food is always great here, portion sizes are enough to share. Service has been a little off with our last two visits.

*** Pros ***
* No wait, walked right in
* Acknowledged, seated right away - drinks served quickly
* Delicious breakfast! I had the HH Original benedict with long strips of bacon, fresh slices of tomato, plenty of biscuits, 2 beautifully poached eggs, a gorgeous red sauce (creamy pepper), garnished with a sprig of rosemary, slice of orange and pineapple. 
*** Cons ***
* This HH is located in The Plaza, a very old hotel/casino near Fremont Street

Me and my Fiance wanted to eat something late nite, came across this place in Down Town Vegas! Great lil joint, Wanted to get the  Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict like advertised by Man Vs. Food... But It was a lil to overwhelming for me. My girl got the normal breakfast - Egg whites, bacon, potato hash, and biscuit! Me on the other hand I got The Big Tractor Driver Breakfast - Sunny side eggs, Sausage, potato Hash, and one freakin Huge buttermilk Pancake! It was yer usually breakfast late nite eats, but I think next time we are gonna try the Fried Pork chop sandwich, and the Man Vs. Food Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict!

As a local SD Hash House Patron .... it was Bobby? Who told us to try the Vegas spots.  This one in Freemont held up the service and food as the one in SD!  A huge huge shout out to Kenisha who made our large party feel at home and immediately made us feel like we were at the SD location!  Food is spot on as usual, but the extra added welcome from Kenisha made it all that more special!

What a great breakfast! The waitress, Rachel was fantastic and friendly and a wonderful smile. 

Don't look for a low CAL breakfast.

Breakfast is the most important meal of the day and Hash House A Go Go gives you a huge heavy portion of food that will last you for the rest of the day. I have been here a couple of times and it is definitely one of the better breakfast/brunch spots. My boyfriends and I were staying in LV with some of our friends and we were really hungry. I put our name down for 8 people and they quoted us 45 minutes. Honestly, totally expected for the time that we arrived. Luckily they ended up calling us  in 20 mins.

They ended up putting us at 2 separate booths of 4. We didn't request this, but I guess they were trying to accommodate us as quickly as possible. The server took a long time to come to us, but once she was at our table she was very nice and attentive. We ordered a round of mimosas and my boyfriend and I split a Ground Turkey Hash Brown entree that came with smoked bacon, onion and smoked mozzarella. It also comes with crispy potatoes and topped with 2 eggs and served with fruit and a biscuit. Oh man, thank god we split this. It was WAY too much food. Both me and my boyfriend could not finish it, we even gave part of it to our friends because their food was actually a really small portion.

Overall, it was a pretty good experience and I would be back here again if we were in the area.

The flapjacks here are bigger than your head!  100% recommend getting the brown sugar banana flapjack!  And just one flapjack is big enough to share!  We had super fast and friendly service. :D  Loved this place.

You know it was a great experience when you dig for the receipt to find the server's name. That being said...John, was fantastic and extremely on top of it! 
This place has got quite the menu and the choices all sound amazing so it takes a good few minutes to make your decision. All of the food we saw served looked awesome. The drink choices were amazing too! My Husband tried this Jameson cold coffee drink (the Frigid Irishman) and WOW, you could feel the whiskey but the coffee gave it an amazing taste. I went with a normal warm mocha and it was delicious!
This food though, I just can't get over the flavor combinations and serving size. My Husband had the fried chicken benedict and it was INSANE! Almost impossible to get a perfect bite because of the size of this thing but the taste was worth every single bite. I tried the French toast "tractor" and it came with pecans and maple syrup. 
Again, our server, John was so on top of it and probably the best server we had our entire trip to Vegas this round.
This place has several other locations we found out, so we can't say they're all this good but we were impressed.

I ordered the sage chicken Benedict. The portion was crazy large. The fried chicken was good. The sauce was a bit spicy and the fried cheese layer was no longer melted when it came out. I don't think I will need to return to one.

I had heard the food was good and the portions were big.

The food was great.  The portions were huge.  I had the meatloaf sandwich, when it was brought out to me, I had to devise a strategy to eat it, it was so big.  But eat it I did, the whole thing, although it wasn't pretty.  Might not be the place to take a first date, since there is no dignified way to eat eat this sandwich.  But, oh lords, was it good.  Delicious meatloaf, a tasty homemade ketchup, and a fresh bun.  So, so good.

Fries were not bad either, but I could only eat about three of them after polishing off the sandwich.  Then I was fed for the day, maybe two days.  It was so good.

I ate at the bar, the bartender was very sweet and brought me everything I needed, including extra napkins.  I gave her a good tip because, well, she had to watch me eat that thing.  Place was very nice overall, cool decor with a lot of stainless steel.

So go there soon.  But only if you are seriously hungry.  You've been warned.
Safe Fried Chicken and Waffles is a MUST!! Service was great. From the homemade jam to the fresh homemade biscuits, Hash House should definitely be on the food agenda when visiting Las Vegas.

If your looking for a place where you won't leave hungry look no further.  This is perfect hangover comfort food.  Every was really happy with their meal and I would definitely come back here.  We tried the chicken and waffles, some type of quesadilla and the chicken benedict.  Everything was delicious.  We went during the week for brunch and the place was pretty empty so we received excellent service and the chef even came out to chat with us.  We definitely go back here on our trips to vegas.

With New Years 2012 at a close, where to eat with a mild hangover?  THIS PLACE!  Portions are HUGE and the presentation is awesome.  3 people ate and left thanking the hangover gods for bestowing Hash House upon us!  I had the french toast, with some sort of mashed potato thing that was awesome and I think something else came with it, but what can I say, the night before was rough making my memory a little hazy.   If you had a great or rough night of drinking in Vegas, you too will thank the hangover gods for Hash House!

Never come here !!! Worst management ever!!! Ed should be demoted as a manager. He is horrible with customer service. Food was cold and his response was the food is made to order is there anything else I can help you with and walked away. He really needs to get a new job where he doesn't have to deal with people at all. Not worth the money spent here at all.

Weird name, awesome food. Even watching other people get their food is interesting. The plates are piled high with food. It's almost scary. However, the prices aren't bad at all, given the portion size and quality. I got the chicken & waffles (never had it ever). It was great the waffles were fluffy with a kinda crispy outside. The chicken was moist, tender, and crispy with a nice sage flavor. Loved it.

As we planned our Vegas trip I had multiple friends swear by how incredible this place is. The wife and I checked it out last night. The food portions are enormous. She had the pot pie and I had the chicken and waffles. The place was clean and the food was reasonably priced. For all the hype I was a little disappointed. While the food was good, it was not even close to being the best breakfast I have had. There's more flash and presentation to the plates than there is deliciousness.

Initial wait time 
Wait time to be seated was 2 hours but we had a party of 13 so it was understandable plus we got to walk around and gamble at the casino while we waited they sent 1 person from our party a text once they were ready to seat us 
Expect a long wait time but well worth it! 

Service 
Everyone was very friendly  and eager to answer any questions we had on the menu. 

Restrooms 
Since this restaurant is inside of the casino you must use the casino restrooms when you exit will be on your left hand side next to subway 

Decor
Restaurants is decorated like a barn you can see pictures of farm animals and will find barley on your table 

Drinks
I was amazed at the grand selection of drinks they have a lot of great alcoholic drinks and non alcoholic drinks from chocolate smores not chocolate to bloody Maury pay 15 bucks and you get to keep a neat hashtogogo cup 
Food
Get ready to share the portions here are huge.
They still manage to decorate the plate with the huge portions. Everything was delicious.
I went with a group of friends we all ordered plates to share we ordered following
chicken and waffles 
Snickers pancake
French toast 
Chicken Benedict 
Roasted chicken 

Everything was delicious my husband was not to found of the roasted chicken since this plate was healthier than all of the other options we ordered.
If you are worried about calories this is not the place to go to but if you are looking for a great breakfast this place it a must visit!

So good! Everything I hoped for and more! This was my first visit to the Las Vegas location. Great service and food, just like the Dallas location.
Our server, Rebecca, was great. She had a quirky, Vegas vibe that added to the experience. 
The quality of the food is consistent. We couldn't eat it all (of course), but that was never the goal. 
We had candied bacon, chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy. Everything was hot and delicious.

I want to give it 5 stars because the food was absolutely delicious. Perfect for sharing in a big group or even taking some home to remember what a great meal you had. Our waiter however on the other hand was horrible. He didn't write down our orders, some of which had changes to what was listed on the menu. 
As a former server, making sure your guest gets their order right the first time is key. Not forgetting what was said, coming back twice to correct it and still bring the meals out incorrectly. 
What was even more frustrating was that we didn't get our drinks filled as needed or when we asked for extra plates, condiments, etc we were forgotten, or had to ask several times, including asking other servers for help because ours was no where to be found. Also, we were charged for items we didn't ask for and also were charged for BBQ sauce that was not BBQ sauce. 
The hash house in the quad hotel and casino was a bust service wise, however the food was delicious.

Breakfast food !! Heard about this on the food channel and our hotel (the cal) was so close we decided to walk down and check it out! 

Important stuff- 
- located in the plaza hotel on fremont, this location shouldn't be too busy 
- waited only about 10-15 mins for a party of 7 around 12pm 
- HUGE portions, I would say definitely share !! Unless you're a large hungry man 
- prices: quite reasonable for the size around $10-$12 an entree depending on which 
Service- great, super nice & friendly

We got the avocado bacon scrambled plate ( something along the lines of that) lol and it was huge, it came with a biscuit, a slice of watermelon, a slice of orange, and potatoes. I split this with my sister and it was more than enough for both of us. We asked for no onions and they brought one out for us that did have onions :( but they gladly took it back and fixed our order! Overall the dish was mediocre, nothing to special in my opinion. It might have been because we didn't try their specialties but I was still kind of expecting something super delicious. 

Anyways, overall still good. Might come back to try one of their specialties!

Clean place, prompt and great service, huge portions of food. Definitely share (thats coming from a food hog). The orange juice fresh squeezed and absolutely perfect. The coffee is hot and tasty enough to please my very picky grandmother and all the utensils and glassware are always squeaky clean. I love there use of herbs and spices in their dishes. I come to Fremont just for the Hash House!

If you are thrown off by the prices, just know that the portion size is huge. I got the warm spinach side salad and could only eat half.  The warm maple vinaigrette was the perfect compliment to this salad.  I tried the waffles, which were stuffed with bacon, and they were delicious.  The maple syrup was good quality.  The service was prompt, this location was not crowded.
Delish! Enjoyed every bite. Service was great. Worth the cost - got 2 meals out of it.  Highly recommended.

First, PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  Second, PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  I say that because I read the reviews on here and saw that they had big portions, but my wife and I still ordered separate meals (I'm a big eater and usually eat mine plus whatever she doesn't eat of hers).  Here, we could have shared a meal and still needed a box.  Food and service were great!  I don't know how they think up these crazy concoctions, but they are delicious.  HHaGG is now a must on every future trip to Vegas!
This is the absolute worst meal I've had in Vegas.  4 of us ordered, 4 of us barely touched the food, 4 of us disappointed.  Will not be visiting any of their other locations either.

Second time coming here. The prices are high but the meals sizes are for two people. The wife and I shared the sage fried chicken breast. It comes with bacon, eggs, biscuits, potatoes, and spicy sauce. It was very good and we didn't finish it all. Give it a try for yourself.

Before we left for vacation we were watching some show on the Travel Channel and saw this place(the San Diego location actually) and made a commitment to have breakfast here. 

After a short walk from our hotel to the Plaza we were seated and looking over the bloody mary menu. What better way to deal with a mild hangover than with more booze. I got a BLT bloody mary. This drink comes with lettuce, bacon, toast and a mayo packet so you can make a sandwich with all the trapping you have at your disposal. The bloody mary itself wasn't great but it wasn't bad either. 

The standout here is the food. We split a scramble with basil and goat cheese. Holy eff I need to be making this at home. Incredible. When I return to LV This will be my breakfast spot. Eat here if you're staying downtown. I promise you will not be disappointed.

Wow - everyone talking about the large portions are correct!  And I guess since I'm repeated it, it must be that overwhelming when you see the plate of food placed in front of you.

Keeping the review short - the food is all farm grown and very fresh.  For example, their apple juice is freshly made so it's cloudy with a little bit of pulp - kind of like fresh squeezed orange juice.  It's not bad mind you, just stating a fact.  

The food we has was delicious though.  Eggs were especially good probably due to being fresh from the farm!  Service was as good as you would expect.

Fantastic food, great price, great atmosphere, great service, HUGE portions of delicious hashes, benedicts, sandwiches and other treats. Biscuits with FRESH jam are unreal. The banana brown sugar flapjack was delicious. It was enormous and had a crispy crust of melted sugar on it like a crême bruleé with large slices of ripe banana in the batter...it was 15" across! Corned beef hash was incredible. Even the coffee was excellent. High recommendation - I do not give 4 stars lightly.

Ignore those stars right there.  
I know no other way to do this, than to split Hash House A Go Go into two reviews.

Review 1: solid 4 stars... maybe even five for the food.
Whenever we visit Vegas we eat at Hash House, usually multiple times.  Their fried chicken is the stuff of dreams, and their BLT Blood Mary holds a special place in my heart.  Seriously get that Bloody Mary.  It's a meal in itself.  And the chicken and waffles.... there's bacon in those waffles.  Inside of them.  It's a breakfast miracle!

Review 2: 1 star... service.
Can I even give service a star when it doesn't even exists at this place?  I image their training manual reads something the the effect of "screw it, I'm drunk".  Now here's your block t-shit, get out there kid!  I honestly do not know how my order is ever taken, and how the heck my food ever makes it to the table,  I believe the kitchen staff must have excellent hearing and have devised a way to cut the floor staff out of the process all together because anything these guys touch goes to crap.  Did you want another beverage?  Well, assuming you ever get the first one, too bad!  You will never see that server again! Someone else will drop off your food and run away from the table.  What's that? only half of your table got their food? Here's the check!
Seriously guys, I submit myself to this neglect every time, the food is worth it and I'm on vacation so waiting isn't an issue, but maybe you could try and get your crap together.

Food used to be great.  But tonight was a complete disaster. 6 people and only one person enjoyed their food 

Must have a new chef

Can't wait to go back to my favorite dîner in Vegas. Great food, amazing service and clean and fast with the orders.
This is our happy place.

food was good, the portions are huge , the service here is alittle gloomy compared to the hash house in the Imperial palace.. however this spot is extremely less crowded since it is located downtown in the Plaza hotel. .

Hash house A go go is perfect for lunch. Large portions that taste really really good. Great stop before heading upstairs to the jerky store at plaza hotel. We ordered a large Caesars salad and sage chicken & waffles with bacon. Everything was very good. From being greeted with a smile by the hostess to our waitress service was great.
There was a super long wait. The waitress wasn't really helpful but omg the food was amazing. The waffle was perfect and bigger than my face! Will probably go back for more.

I have not been impressed with many restaurants in the casinos on Fremont, but this was a great place to eat for breakfast.  I spent under $13 for lots of food. Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly.

My BFF had nothing but great things to say about the food here, so the next afternoon after a crazy night out in Vegas, we decided to give this location a try!

They have a great selection of food here and everything just sounds so mouth watering (especially if you are hanging like we were!).  I decided to go for the chicken salad sandwich with salad and my friend got the chicken and waffles, which she said she always gets cause it's that darn good!

Her food came out first and I waited about another 10 min before I got my food.  When I did, I was not disappointed!  My sandwich was HUGE! I had to take a minute to wrap my head and mouth around it.  But, it was DELICIOUS!  I also tried some of my friend's chicken and that was delicious as well.  

The amount of food we got for the price was well worth it.  We both had leftovers, which we munched on later.  Everyone thanked us as we left, which was really nice and pretty rare to see that everyone stops to thank you for your business as you leave.

Well worth the visit. I guess I didn't realize that Man v Food did a piece here. The fried chicken eggs Benedict with maple reduction was excellent. I highly recommend for a hearty breakfast, nice brunch time visit or late lunch with friends.
This menu is to die for!!!! Me and hubby shared a plate, large servings. I had the bloody Mary and it was bomb.
This place is amazing! Huge portions. Never finished my Sage fried chicken Benedict....maybe a 1/4! But so good.

The staff seemed like they didnt want to be there and the food was far from what i would call good quality. The meals are good value for money and you could definitely order 1 meal and share it (we took most of our food home in a takeaway container). We ordered the machacha scramble which was overly seasoned, and the andys sage fried chicken which was dry and bland. The venue is nice and they had the best coffee iv had since iv been in las vegas.

*The 2 stars is specifically for the rude hostess. She ruined it from the get go*

We come here every trip to Vegas. Showed up at 8am, the restaurant was not full. Told the hostess we had a party of 3 maybe 4. She had the worst attitude. She told us we "needed to figure it out". We could see an empty booth and said we'd take the available one that we could plainly see from the hostess stand. She sighed, walked away to apparently see if there was something available. Came back and asked if we wanted a booth or table when we had just said a booth. I have NEVER in 5 years of coming here had such a bad experience here. If Du-pars was still open at the Golden Gate across the street, we would have left and gone there. Our waiter, Jeronimo, was very apologetic so he is the bright spot. He gets 5 stars. However, one of our breakfasts arrived over cooked but cold. What the heck is going on here today?  We may be finding a new breakfast spot. Which is disheartening. We usually love this place. I hope others have a better experience.

I had such high hopes for my dining experience.....unfortunately it was tainted by an allergic reaction to what I will never know was in my bacon, eggs, potatoes and biscuit breakfast.

I would however like to return and try the chicken and waffles...this time I'll take some anti-histamines beforehand.

Firstly let me say we love Hash House, we have been to almost all of their locations in Vegas. All of them have been five star experiences and I would have given this one the same except for the obnoxious odor proliferating through the casino hotel it is located. We valet parked and had to walk through the casino to get to Hash House. The only way I can describe it is that it smells like the worst, most overpowering, perfume that my 70 year old substitute teacher would wear back in the 3rd grade (and if I can remember that smell from 20 + years ago you know it was bad). You know the kind that would give you an instant migraine. That is not Hash House A Go Go's fault but the smell is there and makes it hard for this one to be as appetizing as the rest. The food was as good as usual, but ugh the smell. The food gets the four stars. If you want to try Hash House I would try one of their other locations, at least until they change the scent in the Plaza.

Brunch day with my cousin!  I woke up wanting to grub on some food and have a few cocktails.  When I thought about brunch, I thought about this place!  I've been fortunate enough to the check out the M Resort location, I suggested we go and try the Plaza hotel location.

The look is very consistent to the south location.  You have table tops, you have booths.  Lots of wood and metal lining the tables and walls.  Tables have grains in vases.  It's exactly what they advertise:  Twisted Farm Food (and Decor).  I decided to sit at the bar and was helped by Mandy (blonde bartender).  She was nice and super timely.

For brunch, we started with mimosas for $6.95 each.  Served with an orange slice, this drink contains orange juice with lots of pulp, so be advised.  Not a problem for me, but I know some folks don't like pulp.  It still did the trick!  For my meal, I had the popular Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles for $16.95.  This dish was lined with bacon waffles with two huge breast pieces of Sage Fried chicken, accompanied with fried leaks, hot maple caramel reduction and a sprig of rosemary.  The chicken was amazing!  Super juicy for a breast, the batter was crunchy and seasoned very well!  Home run for me :)  another home run was the bacon waffles.  There's not just bits of bacon, but entire strips of bacon!  The syrup was on point, thick and sweet and really enhanced the overall flavor!!  What I didn't like was the fried leaks.  They were everywhere and made the plate look super sloppy.  Thank goodness they were edible because they kept getting in all bite.  Little irritating but not a huge deal.  What was a huge deal for me was the fact that my cousin's dish came out and I waiting more than 5 minutes until my dish came out.  I understand her dish was just a scramble, however, they should be aware of ticket times so the entire party gets their meals at once.  

Other than that, I would still return to this place.  What I've learned about Hash House is that it's affordable and really packed with flavor.  The crowds of people that wait for a table, no matter the location, is proof that this place rocks!  If you're downtown, come on by and check this place out!

This place is the Bomb! The food was awesome. The portions are huge. The service was great. A little bit of a wait, but its worth the wait. I will be back here whenever I'm in Vegas. Highly recommended. 5 Stars!

Our server Monique was very informative and friendly.  When we asked about something on the menu she knew exactly what was in the item in question, with no hesitation wish we came across more servers like her.

My husband ordered corn beef on a bed of potatoes that was a HUGE serving and he said it was delicious. Only complaint he had was that they didn't have any hot sauce, but by the way he almost liked his plate clean I doubt it was that big of an issue. 

I wasn't very hungry so ordered The Tractor Driver Combo  (2 Eggs, Bacon and 1 flapjack)...should have known by the name it was going to be a big serving.  The pancake was so big I only ate half.

Was very clean and service was great, and the food was delicious.
This place. Great prices ESPECIALLY when you see the portion sizes. Food is AMAZING. Just put your name in and wait, you won't regret it. OMG and get a mimosa

Wow they are not stingy lol they serve huge portions!!!! Definitely getting your money's worth :D 
Had a burger and my bf had a chicken Benedict both of which were like I said HUGE and super yummy :) 
We were there for dinner and with a $40 comp which fed 3. Myself, my bf and my brother. We got the comp from Las Vegas Club. We gambled there and they comped us $40 for Hash House at the Plaza. 
Go go go!

If you want huge, gigantic, farm-sized breakfast or lunch this is your place.  I wasn't hung over, but I can imagine this is the place to cure that too.  

I looked at the table beside us and a lady ordered a country fried steak, one of my personal favorites.  It was enormous and I am not exaggerating that.  I chickened out, and ordered their take on a Reuben with their hash, omg, it was huge and good.  I actually had to make a strategic choice to either consume the meat or the bread.  Otherwise, I was going to leave something on the plate.

Definitely a delicious treat for your taste buds and a lot of fun!

The portion sizes are huge and the staff was friendly. We are visiting from out of town and were told this was a must visit. And it was definitely worth it.

Had a late night breakfast at Hash House a Go Go and my first experience was very good!  I ordered the pancake and a side order of fries!  My boyfriend ordered the cob salad and his brother ordered the grilled cheese with tomato and avocado.  Our server, Melissa was very pleasant and delivered the drinks and food in a prompt manner.  Portions were huge!!! The food tasted so good and very reasonably priced!  We will be returning for sure!

Great place and great service as well couldn't have asked for more.  Service was spot on kind polite curteous and funny... We loved it here. The food was amazing as well and the portions were beyond out expectations. Be hungry very hungry if you done here.

Pros: 
It's across the plaza and a good location and portions are huge!

Cons: 
The price, and depends on what you get.

Food Experience:
I was expecting something better when I ordered the HH special Benedict. It was not that great when I realized its sauce, mash potatoes on top that with large biscuits two thick slices of tomato, a sunny side up egg and more sauce. It was alright honestly.

Conclusion:
Overall don't go here if you're not gonna get the chicken and waffles. It's a brunch/breakfast joint as well. It's worth it at least once to see such large portions.
We heard good reviews. We couldn't get past the terrible waitress lack of Mannerisms, smacking her lips and ghetto attitude.

First off, this place is FUN!!  You're greeted by smiling faces when you make your way into this cool, hip restaurant that's right inside the lobby.  This place was packed during both times that I have been there for breakfast.  Even though they were packed; the bartenders (I sat at the bar since it was so packed) and waitresses were extremely friendly!

Even if you come in STARVING; I don't see how you can finish one of their "Benedicts".  They've become some of the best meals that I've ever had for breakfast.  This time, I tried their Blue Crab Benedict.  Let me tell you something...These guys DO NOT CHINCH on the crab!!! I got 2 really large crab cakes that were smothered in some of the most complex and delicious sauces and ingredients you could find while eating out.  

While waiting for breakfast (this food is freshly cooked, so you'll wait a bit), I knocked back a perfectly made Bloody Mary at their bar.  This didn't have any store bought cheapo mix..It's their own mix and it's one of the best I've had.  

Since the bar had great TV's, I ended up spending the ENTIRE DAY there!! I'm not kidding!  I watched 2 NFL playoff games, and was surrounded by nothing but friendly people as I bought bucket after bucket of beer (5 for $14)!

This place is one of two GREAT restaurants; not only in Downtown; but in Vegas PERIOD!  The food, and the Plaza Hotel are both huge reasons why Downtown Vegas is getting better each year.

The waitress was very loud an agresive. I'm a little hung over so that sucks. The table was VERY wobbly. Was the food good I mean it was pretty good but between the wobbly table and the aggressive waitress I just feel uncomfortable. My wife and I almost started arguing because we didn't feel very good at where we were at. Was there plenty of food on a plate yes there was we shared a plate. Was it good yes it was. Did I feel a little bit uncomfortable like cattle yes. I felt like we were just being pushed through a stall and being told to get done and get out so they can put somebody else in the table. That made me feel very uncomfortable. When I asked about the menu items I got given a light response. The lady didn't even want to tell me. I felt like I was putting her out. The table was so wobbly are water spilled like five times. Again was it good food yes it was good food. Was there enough for us to both share and yes it was. Did I feel uncomfortable there yes absolutely I did feel uncomfortable. I felt like they were like hurry up and Order and get out. We were looking at the menu and should come by 4X loud asking do you know what you want. And I said can we please have a little bit of time. I'm a little hungover. Can you please not be so loud. She laughed at me.

For me it's kind of hard to describe this place... it had a feel of a diner but the food of a higher end brunch establishment.  We had a wait but the nice this is they will text you when the table is ready so we took a quick walk down Fremont Street.

Once we were seated we were greeted by a super friendly lady who was very helpful.  Service seemed quick for how busy they are and we really enjoyed our food.

Highlights: Large portions, quick service, good food, pleasant service

Lowlights: Nitro Cold Brew coffee is a hard PASS. Don't do it... tasted watery and bland.  While I enjoyed my food they should really post the food they are going to add to the plate on the menu. I hate red and green peppers and made sure this was not listed anywhere on the menu. but when the food came out they garnished the entire plate with diced red and green pepper. I had to eat around it since it was already in the sauce.

Pro Tip: Portions are more than large enough for sharing, so save some money and share a plate.

recently stayed at the plaza downtown for the first time and also eating breakfast there. hash house a go go is sooo freaking good. I ordered their french toast that had this banana taste to it with eggs and bacon. it was sooooooo good!! and I know water is water but there's is really good. so refreshing!! and I love how they add decorations to the food. it's a plus! definitely will eat there again!

Three Stars because:

1. The portions here are HUGE. Literally they can feed you for two meals. 
2. My boyfriend and I got seated in the booth next to Barry Bond's and Neil Patrick Harris' photos.
3. No wait, we were seated right away - we went at noon
4. When I asked for a small plate, they gave me a nice huge serving plate
5. Food is pretty good and displayed nicely

Cons:
1. Parking sucks around here. We parked at Las Vegas Club and paid five dollars. But then again downtown Las Vegas doesn't have free parking. 
2. The waitresses were really pushy. They were really just trying to get us to order and rushing us to leave. It was down time too. Almost no one was there. Rude in my opinion.

Okay. So I had trouble making up the list of Pros and Cons, but overall I give this place three stars. Would I go back? Not for a while, but I would if I had no where else to go. Maybe it's because we went to a not so popular Hash House A Go Go in Vegas.

My boyfriend and I ordered two dishes. At first we were originally getting just the Man vs. Food Favorite (Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict), but then we saw people order the burgers and had to try one so we ordered the Fresh Mushroom and Swiss 1lb Burger.

Fresh Mushroom and Swiss Burger: The burger was actually kind of small. I didn't get any sides with it, but overall I'd give it 3.5. I've had better burgers. This one was just blah. I guess what got me was mushrooms, I love eating mushrooms, but this burger barely had any in it. It consisted of two meat patties, barely any mushroom, and one slice of melted swiss cheese. And in the end it only tasted like a burger I could get at any fast food store. 

Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict: Overall it was good. The portion is humongous! My boyfriend and I could not finish it, but if you like CARBS, you'll enjoy this. It had bacon, mashed potatoes, scrambled eggs, biscuits, very little spinach, fried chicken, and some spicy sauce to finish. I have to say it was pretty good. It definitely had that spice to it! Overall I would give it 4. It's pretty unique, but you should eat it all. Don't eat leftovers of it, it sucks. 

Tip: You should wear elastic waist pants because food portions are huge. You'll definitely feel it after eating a meal.

This place is awesome. Husband and I tried to go to the Strip location but it was an hour long wait (no thanks), so we hopped on the bus and tried Downtown since we were headed there anyway. Walked straight in and got a table, and we had finished our meals within about 20 minutes! Which is not to say they were bad meals, quite the opposite. 

I had the sundried tomato/goats cheese/basil scramble which tasted great and fresh, and came with a side of potatoes and a biscuit. The size of the meal actually wasn't huge, which I actually prefer as the size of meals in the US can be a little scary for a foreigner!

I saw the flapjacks on another table, they were MASSIVE and didn't look overly appetising. I think the hashes and scrambles are the way to go here.

Service was good and attentive.
Very large portions, tasty food, and extremely reasonable prices. Especially for Vegas! Great place.
Great place to eat. Had large portions prompt service . I'm for sure coming back to have breakfast in the near future .

I could not believe how much food this restaurant serves. We had an amazing breakfast and a great server, Rebecca!  Just had a little wait getting butter for our biscuits, but we not only got our butter, we got fresh biscuits.  We even got asked by Rebecca, if we wanted dessert. Haha!!!  We'll be back again, I'm sure!!

I love the HHAGG out on Sahara.  Go there almost every time I am in town.  Stayed at the Plaza and apreciated the fact I could stagger out of bed hung over and enjoy a Hash House breakfast without driving to the other side of town.  Service was really poor.  Took almost 15 minutes to get drinks.  I ordered a HH Bloody Mary.  Now, I wasn't expecting Grey Goose or anything, but I've tasted better rubbing alcohol that the house vodka they used in this.  Server was never anywhere to be found, but a hostess did a good job with the drinks.  Food quality was good, but portions were smaller than at the Sahara location.  I was with a friend who is a bit of a grumpy old man so I'm sure his attitude didnt help.

HOLY PORTIONS. This is THE place to eat your hangover away, but be warned, the portions are gigantic! I definitely could have shared an entree with my friend. But hey, I guess everything in Vegas is over the top, so it fits. 

Be sure to order a Bloody Mary, too! This is one of the best I've had!

This place was mediocre. The food was just, well...food. Nothing to really be to excited about. There was really nothing wrong either, it just didn't "wow" us. It was clean and the staff was friendly. Everyone was smiling and attentive. It's OK but probably would pick a different place if I had other options.

Ate a very late breakfast here and it was great! I had steak and eggs with a biscuit and enjoyed it. My dining partner had the chicken hash and it was phenomenal. I'd return again but I'd get the chicken hash.

This was the house that "hangovers" built. A true Vegas necessity, IMHO. Every bite was rich and calorically dense. The quality could have been better. Dishes seemed assembled and warmed, rather than freshly made, but I'm sure if you're trying to soak up a night of bad liquor and equally bad decisions, look no further to bury your self-loathing.

Hash House A Go Go in the Plaza is a family friendly diner with portions meant for sumo wrestlers and competitive eaters.  The food pile is truly a spectacle in a place where quantity seems more important than quality.

We tried the Fried Chicken and Bacon Waffles, the Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict, and a House Salad.  

The Fried Chicken and Waffles was average.  The chicken was crispy enough, but wasn't juicy and didn't have a lot of seasoning.  The waffles didn't have a bacon-y flavor, we wished they had just given us some strips of bacon instead.

The Fried Chicken Benedict was like three separate dishes piled into one--literally stacked right on top of each other.  One dish would be fried chicken and mashed potatoes, another would be a biscuit with gravy, and the last would be an eggs and bacon scramble with spinach, tomato, and mozzarella.  With all that on one plate you can't really distinguish one flavor from another, but you can make every bite different.

The House Salad was the standard bag mix of iceberg lettuce, nothing special.

If you do want to try Hash House A Go Go split a plate with someone and come for a true diner experience.
Located inside Plaza Hotel and Casino.  I had the corned beef hash and it was good and portions are huge.  You could easily split a meal and not leave hungry.

Horrible Horrible Horrible customer service.  Went there with my wife on March 13, 2016 at 1:30 PM.  Waiting a half hour to be seated (no problem) and then the host sat us down.  We wait another 30 minutes to be greeted by our waiter or waitress.  Never happened.  I informed the host that we hadn't been helped yet and he informed me that this was not his job.  In disbelief I actually waited another 10 minutes, to still no avail.  I fist bumped the host on the way out, told him thanks for the great customer service and then went to a real restaurant where they are happy to have you in their restaurant.  If you're a guest and are hungry, avoid this place.  If you're a manager of the restaurant, fire them all.

Brunch was amazing! I mean the banana French toast was mmmmmm so good and it was a huge portion like Texas style !! Topped with Toasted pecans and baked banana !!I mean you can't go wrong getting this !! My cousin got the waffles and chicken which was two big chicken Brest and 4 waffles !

Always have liked this place... Portions are HUGE! Each plate had a tree of rosemary skewering it. The honey buttermilk busicuits are to die for. My friends said their pot pie was a little bland... But it came with a huge hat shaped pie crust and that mostly made up for it.

Huge food at food coma city!

This place is just ridiculous...in a good way.  We've eaten at this and other locations several times on various Vegas visits and it's always good.

This particular trip on 3/26/17 was not the best.  I ordered the Hand Hammered Pork Tenderloin and it was great until I found the 2 bone fragments about 10% of the way through.  I wasn't really that hungry so I intended to take half back to the hotel to eat later, but when I pointed out the bone to the waitress she took the food away and got the manager.  He took off 1/2 the price of the entree (which was well over $20) which was fine, had I had more than 3 bites before it was taken away.  So, I paid about $12 for about $4 worth of food.

Crappy experience, but all the others have been great, so I'll chock it up to an off-day.

My fave is still the Sage Chicken & Waffles, but the pot pie, meatloaf, chicken fried steak and pork tenderloin are all outstanding.

Ate here on st pattys day and was not disappointed Irish coffees were awesome the Guinness beef stew was phenomenal and the corned beef and cabbage was seriously the best I have ever had. The corned beef was so tender it pulled apart perfectly with a fork I will be back every year for this day. Service was great too he was an older gentlemen with white hair was our server. Very friendly and attentive.

So very disappointed, everyone brags about this place...got seated right away, took a long while till we got asked about our drinks, just coffee. Finally brought to our table, hubby ordered corned beef  eggs, biscuit. Took forever and a day to get his order, the waiter simply forgot mine, brought hubby a large plate with his meal...I told him not to wait his food would get cold, as I watched him eat, the waiter finally came back to see how we liked it...I asked when my order as coming, he said you did not order anything, I clarified that indeed I had and that he was suppose to give the avocado part to my husband, which he never received. He say oh oh hey yeah oh wait I will bring it now, we waited another 10 minutes then I told the waiter forget the order. He said no I will bring it right now, I insisted no. So I tried to share some of my husbands breakfast, yuck if I had wanted hash I would have ordered hash, biscuit was hard and bland, no butter no jelly. Nada... Will NOT be going back after all the raves. From fam and friends nope wont to ever again.
Was not impressed if I want a tree of rosemary on my plate I can stay home for that, I have a rosemary bush outside. Blahh

Ordered beef hash and spice chicken sandwich. The food was good with big portions. Couldn't eat it all. Staff was friendly. Best food spot we could find nearby that wasn't fast good. Prices were moderately priced.
Um... YES!!! How awesome that they opened another Hash House on Fremont!!! (inside the Plaza Casino) The food quality and portions will blow your freaking mind! EAT HERE NOW! (thank me later)
Love this place and seriously LOVE LOVE LOVE John super sweet man and very knowledgeable with the menu!! Really good experience will deff be back

First the reason for the loss of the star . . . we asked for a table . . . they hostess tried to fit me (a still large man) into a both . . . and we were told there were no tables available . . . even though three were in plain sight . . . with that we opted for the bar.

Food was great . . . had the mushroom swiss burger . . . missed the part about it being a poung of ground beef . . . put like a trooper . . . I ate the whole thing . . . but not the side.  This burger was great in a taste way . . . not the oowee gooyee way . . . but pure tast way.

Service was great . . . cocktails were very tasty . . . we will devfinitelly be back . . .
Not your grandma's pot pie.. this was awesome!! fresh veggies, chunks of chicken and Mash potatoes

The highlight of staying at the Plaza Hotel was eating one of the most exciting breakfasts that I've ever consumed. Who here gets excited about breakfast? Moi! It's eggs and meat and bread and starches. Every lovely food group that I've ever loved all on one plate.

I had the corned beef house hash. It was by far one of the greatest meals ever and an unexpected breakfast dish. It had a huge portion of corned beef topped with some Swiss cheese.  I've never been a Swiss fan as I think the aftertaste of it is quite outputting, but with the saltiness of the beef, the cheese worked well and was mighty tasty. There was also a huge helping of potatoes, your choice of two eggs, and a biscuit. All in all, it was enough for two meals for me. I'm one of those people that usually can't finish a normal sized portion, let alone a breakfast big enough for a caveman BUT since there wasn't a fridge in the room, I forced myself to eat it all and walk around with my pants un-buttoned for the day.

The prices are a bit steep in comparison to other breakfast joints. Our breakfast cost around $40 for two entrees, a coffee and a fresh squeezed orange juice. In the future, I'd get an entree to split and that would help with the cost and the super sized portions.
The food is decent but the enormous portions are unnecessary. I am not fond of leftovers especially when it's breakfast food.

Items Selected:
Coffee
Four Jumbo Biscuits with Butter and Housemade Jam
Andy's sage fried chicken Benedict w/ fresh spinach, hardwood smoked bacon, market tomato, griddled mozzarella, chipotle cream and scrambled eggs
Andy's famous Bread pudding topped w/ ice cream and served w/ a cup of coffee
French Toast - Griddled french toast dipped in banana cinnamon cream w/ pecan maple syrup 
Snicker's Flapjack

Already having visited the location on Sahara along with those within the (then) Imperial Palace as well as the Rio, it was with a full compliment of family that breakfast was ordered amidst the spacious confines of Hash House a Go-Go at the Plaza, but with substantial delays and subpar service marring this rendition of the San Diwego import the overall experience was less memorable than all had hoped for, though the "Twisted Farm Food" was largely just as good.

Known for its enormous portions and perhaps even more famous in Las Vegas than at home in the Golden State, it was first to a substantial wait for a table despite the restaurant being almost 2/3 empty that we stood at the podium after arriving at 8:30, another protracted delay to follow as servers seemed completely lost as to who was responsible for which table, then further complicated  by a similar wait for both food as well as drinks.

Not one to suffer such annoyances well, particularly after an early rise and nearly twelve-mile early morning run, it was finally after wondering aloud why such a delay was taking place that coffee was refilled and plates began to trickle forth, the benedict still fifteen minutes away with a steaming block of bread pudding oddly arriving first.

Previously impressed by the molten brownie topped in chocolate, caramel, and nuts with ice cream slowly forming a pool of creamy vanilla sauce, it was after a few bites that attention was turned to the hubcap sized pancake studded in the similar flavors of Snickers that attention was turned, the buttermilk largely overwhelming the candybar when topped in butter and pure maple syrup brought from home while the French Toast was rich with the flavors of cinnamon and vanilla custard plus skin-on bananas, the presentation a bit slipshod though perhaps also the most "down home."

Always attuned to the presence of biscuits, those at Hash House a Go-Go of the larger, fluffier variety popular throughout the Midwest, it was alongside the signature chicken that a quartet of golden rounds was brought forth, each amongst the best in Sin City while the mountainous Benedict buried the one included beneath crispy well-seasoned bird and fresh vegetables, the addition of bacon, cheese, at least three eggs, and smoky cream sauce no doubt making the Man vs. Food Classic a dish best shared.

Offering more support than most for the sort of early morning gluttony through which  Hash House a Go-Go has made its name it may warrant further visits to determine precisely why the service was so awful during this visit to the one at the Plaza, but unless one is restricted by transportation the better bet would seem to be a trip to the locations with better service (and free parking) on Sahara, 24/7 in the Rio, or Stripside at The Linq.

Amazing fried chicken & waffles!! Done like it's suppose to & can easily be shared worth every penny & I will come back every time I'm in Vegas. Worth the wait THANK YOU for the unforgettable best chicken and waffles I've ever had. Bloody Mary's are bomb too!!!

Large portions and you'll leave satisfied!  My fave is the chicken and waffles.  Coming in second would be their benedicts.  I've never had to wait here long and the servers are always checking in on our table.  Bloody Mary is a hit!

So much food!
Okay, I heard this place was good and the portions were gigantic. I had to see for myself. 
I arrived on a Thursday shortly after 10a and the there a lot of people waiting. Thankfully Bar is "FCFS" so my friend & I got lucky right away. I ordered the chicken & waffle and it was delicious but way more than my petite stomach can hold. Food came quick and service was good at the bar. I observed the waiting list moved fairly quickly so don't be discouraged by the line. 
So this is a great place to share meals: chicken & waffle was 2 fried chicken breasts + 4 waffles so you can definitely share. 
Enjoy!

WOW!!!!  Super huge servings here!  

DO NOT GET AN ORDER PER PERSON!!  Do family style dining, it'll be more filling that way.  

I tried the Fried Eggs Benedict and the Slow Cooked Bar B Que Porked Ribs.  The benedict is a must there.  I mean it was on Man vs. Food!!!  There are so many ingredients in the dish..there's bacon, eggs, mashed potatoes, spinach, and chipotle sauce tops it off.  The ribs were cooked to perfection.  It was flavorful and came off the bone easily.  What I did not enjoy was the mashed potatoes that was over loaded with horse raddish which was almost like wasabi.

The guy on the plane told me I had to check out this place.  Guess what there is one in my hotel.  I ordered pancakes for dinner!  The blueberries were fresh and big.  It was the size of a medium pizza.  I'm back tomorrow morning for their signature  Bloody Mary.  A whole strip of bacon, whole stick of carrot and a whole celery stick!!

There isn't much here for vegetarians, but I had their portabello mushroom sandwich and sweet potato fries - both of which I enjoyed.  The waitress was attentive and courteous, and my friend and I were well taken care of.  A lot of reviews talk about breakfast/brunch...  We went for dinner, but I might return at some point to try other meals.
The food was hot and flavorful. The drinks were nice and strong and our server was super friendly and attentive.
This place always amazes! Unique combinations, extra large portions, and great drinks! Had a farmhouse scramble ,  and loved it!

this past year i tried both this hash house in the plaza and the one on sahara.....idk maybe cause it was the first time....but the sage chicken i had at the plaza.....
OMG it was sooooooo delicious!! i could not stop eating it and i wanted to personally go back to the kitchen and congrat the chef....it was unbelievably good! 
the second visit to hash house was at the one on sahara....it was also good but idk the one in the plaza tasted better to me for some reason.

Known for their large portions of breakfast foods (courtesy of Man vs Food), we came here to fill our bellies with 'cakes and bacon. One can always walk it off with a stroll along Fremont.  The bonus here wasn't the fact that the prices are very decent or that the cakes were bigger than our platter but that here, they use fresh ingredients.....and a lot of them.  The Tractor Driver Combo was served with fresh fruit, the cake had huge blueberries (and not the frozen with syrup kind) and two eggs cooked perfectly.  The service was a-ok, oj fresh squeezed and the bar area (where we sat) was kept very clean and orderly.  

Bar is open seating.  If a table is preferred, plan at least a 15min wait as this place is popular.  

5 stars for the music (Skid Row and The Scorpions for breakfast?!?!) and service,  4 stars as the potatoes were too "soft" (requested crispy).

Hash House has enormous portions. If you plan to eat here, either prepare to take home leftovers or to split the meal with a few of  your buddies. They're known for their chicken and waffles and also their Bloody Mary's, but we decided to try some new items.
We ordered the rainbow drink, the Spiked Kiwi Watermelon Lemonade, and I ordered the Meatloaf Hash. The rainbow drink tasted delicious, just like juice, and it's oh-so-pretty that we finished it pretty quickly. The Meatloaf Hash was also very tasty, moist and delicious with spinach and cheese over a bed of taters. Honestly, you can't really go wrong with anything you order here, just bring your appetite and loose fitting pants.

This is our last day here in Las Vegas and I wish that I would have found this place sooner. This place is SOOO GOOD!!!! Great atmosphere, great waitress, fast service and the food is SOOO GOOD!!!! Try the banana brown sugar flap jack - the best! Reasonably priced and family friendly, too.
Chocolate chip pancakes weren't on the menu but they made me one anyway, I had a VERY nice waitress.
Had Andys famous sage chicken. Huge meal. Very good. Wife had one of the hash meals. Also huge serving. No complaints about this place.
Got the meatloaf sandwich which was excellent and HUGE!  My buddy got the pancake which was good and HUGE!  I would go early because it does get crowded.

All I can say is this place was THE BOMB!! The food comes in huge portions. You can feed a small village here!! The waitress we had was awesome. Nice and clean restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, I could not eat it all so I took some to go. The price point for everything was reasonable, worth every dime. I highly recommend if you are in the area to treat yourself to this extraordinary experience!

5 stars for the AMAZING food! This place is off the hook! Service was decent, wish our server had more personality but maybe she was having a bad day. It was our first time here so I'll be patient and see what the service is like when we come back. We showed up around noon and no waiting! Everything on the menu looks incredible. Between  4 of us we had the man vs food plate, banana french toast, fried green tomatoes, a stuffed burger and the mac n cheese. I recommend everything!!! Can't wait until our next visit!!

5 stars is not enough to rate the Hash House. Seriously the wait was non existent, servers were helpful and friendly and the food left me speechless. My bf and I both ordered the 18oz rib eye. That's 18 whole ounces served on a bed of pumpkin mashed potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly and tender and flavorful!! This was an amazing experience love it!!!
An oasis in the desert. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and we had a great time. The best restaurant in the plaza hotel.
Not my cup of tea although not the worse place to go to if you're paying my bill. I guess some like it though because it's very popular. I had breakfast here it didn't agree with me.

Although the portion sizes and bloody Mary's are amazing here, the service is very much lacking. My boyfriend and I ordered dessert and breakfast as our entrees and they brought out my breakfast first, but never brought out my boyfriends breakfast as it "took longer to cook". They ended up comping the breakfast and both of our drinks, but still.

Terrible customer service. I asked to substitute toast or a biscuit for eggs because of an egg allergy & they refused. They said I could order lunch instead (all breakfast entrees came w/ 2 eggs). Or they said they would leave the eggs off and I could pay $4.50 to my $13 breakfast to add a biscuit. The manager was rude & not concerned about losing our business over substituting a five cent piece of toast for 2 eggs. My party of 4 walked out & will never go back. It's obvious they prey on one-time tourists & don't care about keeping local repeat customers. Additional side note: the casino is gross -- u will leave reeking of cigarettes, parking was horrendous, location was scary.

My husband and I went for breakfast. The first time we both had the basic breakfast and everything was great. The service was very attentive and we were so pleased we decided to visit again. 
Unfortunately, we did not have a great experience the 2nd time. I ordered two side orders...biscuit and gravy and scrambled eggs. My husband ordered oatmeal.
After about 10 mins. a couple came in, were seated, ordered, and received their meals of pancakes before we got our food. 
Our server never said a thing as to why our food was taking so long. He came with more coffee, but it was cold. When the food did arrive, I asked why the food took so long and he said they had to bake the biscuits. 
Are you kidding me? 
Needless to say, we will never go to this place again. Not worth it...there are plenty of other places looking for business.

Portions were enormous. I wasn't that impressed to be honest. The drink was the best part we ordered 3 that came with a Mug. They ran out so gave us one in a glass. At the end we measured and the glass was half the size of the mug. Rip off. The server was super sweet and said the boss wouldn't do shit about it, even from the start of running out of the promised cup. No discount, no free mug of another size. Nothing. A too bad so sad. For that reason I wouldn't go back. Not good business to rip someone off if your out of your advertised at the table mug. Chicken was good waffles were ok. Service was great. If you get something SHARE IT portions are HUGE.

Huge portions.  If the Plaza hotel had a refrigerator I could stretch dinner to 2 meals.   Some of the dishes come with giant portions of mashed potatoes, so ask for extra sauce or it starts to seem dry.  I have had 3 dinners and breakfast here and all good.   The blue crab cake dinner is awesome and so is the breakfast #1 scramble.  Bartenders have been friendly and make a good size cocktail.   Drink here before the plaza bar!!!!
You could go fuckin HAM up in here !! We're do I start ,,sling me some   f$&@kin Hash ,,,bitch !!!

Worse meal I have had from a place that is so proud of their menu.  Serving was poor at best with 10 mins before we had our drink order taken and another 10 before we asked if we were ready to order.  Food came out luke warm and under seasoned.

Oh my god, huge plates, huge portions. I could have shared this Chicken pot pie with 2 others and probably had some left over. Sauce was delicious also. Nice dinner like atmosphere and now upstairs for Plaza Bingo

I start by saying the food was great. Went in for lunch and it wasn't busy. 
Service.... It was really bad. No one even came to get our drink order for almost 20 minutes I almost left (I timed everything after this) Finally she came we ordered our drinks and food. 
10 minutes later our drinks came. 
She then came back about 10 minutes later and said "Did you get your food?"  We said no and she said oh ok and then did refill our drinks
We waited another 35 minutes for our food.
She brought to the food to our table and then left. We were never asked if everything was ok or even if it tasted ok.
She never came back except to drop our bill off and then left again only saying I'm your cashier I'll take it when your ready. 
We left cash on the table to cover the bill and a small tip.
This place is crowded today with huge groyos. The bakerfamilia is in the spot again...

Not really a fan of this location. I had my mouth set on the chicken and waffles but was disappointed. The chicken was not seasoned at all and the waffles were bland. Next time I know to go to the location by the strip.
One of the most outstanding breakfasts I've had!. The service was a little slow but the wait was worth it! The Siracha cream sauce was outstanding!

This place is actually not half bad, if you venture to their other locations. This particular location has a questionable? placement inside the plaza hotel and casino and is right in the corner of the downstairs, dragging in all the smoke smell and weirdos from outside. 

Normally their service is pretty standard, but this location I felt was significantly slower and the staff was rude. The bar staff area especially. We sat at the counter because there was a ridiculous line, and the bartender didn't even greet us for 10 minutes. The counter is not that big, and she had help. So coming from a person who worked in restaurants, she's just lazy and probably shouldn't be working a fast paced place that counts on regulars (as well as tourists) and not being friendly or curious to customers, also a necessity.

The food itself took FOREVER to come, we had plans to go on a helicopter tour and were almost late for our pick up because it took an hour and a half to be seated, be greeted, order, get our food and bother the staff to pay. Our food was not brought out at the same time, actually my dad got his food about 20 minutes before mine. He had a huge breakfast with eggs, potatoes, pancakes and meat, this took almost an hour for him to get. All I had was fresh fruits and oatmeal which for some reason took even longer then his food....???

Needless to say this was the worst experience I ever had at a hash house in my 6 years living in Las Vegas and I won't ever be back to this location. Even asking them for a to go box, or where my food was after an hour, or getting silverware for my meal was a hassle to them and they were rude about it. My tip to this hash house- learn how to treat your customers or you won't have any to serve in the near future- Or servers to serve since no one will tip them.

Food is great, the people suck. Only one waffle maker working, ridiculous, never going there again only to the Sahara one. But the manager was nice enough to make us feel better. By the way the hostess JOEY sucks, he rolled his eyes at us and looked blank at everything we said.

Not sure what the big deal is. I think I had the driest, saddest meatloaf I've ever seen in my life and my mashed potatoes looked and tasted like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp for awhile. Friend got the BBBLT and basically ended up just eating the bacon out of it. Service was subpar and server never asked how the food was and disappeared for long amounts of time. Didn't get water refills. Fries were good. Maybe the other locations are better. Oh well.
Atmosphere was friendly the staff was kind. Lovely place with tv sports channel on.  The food was so good came out fast.  Clean and very loud but can't complain it's in a casino lol

We always eat here when staying at the plaza. We've never waited in line, the food in in large portions and delicious!

I usually get the chicken, mozzarella , and corn hash which comes with some eggs
And a large yummy biscuits. The scrambles are eggcellent too. The juices are fresh squeezed we love the orange and tangerine and the coffee is fantastic. I've had the s'more mocha( you've never seen anything like this) and the ice tractor coffee.

Wait Til you see the pancakes! They're folding over the plate!

I've seen burgers, sage chicken and waffles all piled high at the tables around me. You really can't
Go wrong! Try one Dish today and
A new one on your next visit!

Ahhhh Hash House. You are always on the mind when I think of brunch in Vegas. I try to stay health conscious and order egg whites.... but seriously that doesn't go well with Hash House. You gotta order the pork chop for breakfast. My friend ordered that and I think I enjoyed bite of her dish better than my whole entire breakfast omelet thingy that look like meshed baby food. 

Just go with the big fat piece of pork chop. That thing could feed family of 4 and next time I go thats all I am getting. Plus maybe the beer in a paper bag. hahaha

If i could give this place 0 stars i definitely would. First off the wait was horrendous( I'm going to add that the place was half empty with many tables and booths open), service was half assed with no attentiveness to our party, the food looked like something out of a horror movie( a complete mess and was not appetizing!) , totally turned my appetite off. I came here on a recommendation from a friend who's a local. Least to say we aren't friends anymore. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!

The food portions were huge, delicious, and the servers were very friendly. I ordered the basic breakfast and couldn't even finish it!! However, you can only be seated once your entire party is present which for a large party it is unfortunate when you have to go back to the end when you are only missing one person (we had 11 people). Another issue was that they will sit you down but they don't take your order right away even though your whole party knows what they want. The servers take your drink orders only, bring the drinks out right away, then leave and don't come back for 20 minutes. They then take the food orders, but it took about 40 minutes to get and then getting the check once we finished was also time consuming. We arrived at the restaurant at 9am and didn't leave till 11:30am so be sure to dedicate a chunk of time in your plans for this place.

Décor is interesting, and they bill themselves as 'farm food with a twist' or something like that.  That translates into 'everything we serve is so freaking big you won't ever finish it, so just get over it'.
 
I ordered the BBBLT with a salad and could only eat the side salad and took the entire monstrosity of a sandwich on the plane ride home.  
Ross got the cheddar, avocado, and hardwood bacon-stuffed burger, with fries.  HUGE and delish and he didn't finish it all.  

Both sandwiches came with a huge steak knife stuck in the middle, guess to keep everything in place during transit.  

Overall, I'd go back - would like to try their breakfast next time.

Huge portions doesn't necessarily equate to good food. I had the salmon Benedict with the Snickers pancakes (which were ok) and while i couldn't finish the pancakes due to the size, the Benedict was pretty much 60% mashed potatoes. The cream sauce was very sweet and didn't really go with that dish. Not my favorite breakfast spot.

I come here every time I'm in downtown las vegas! Normally i get the sage fried chicken & waffles. This time, i tried something different. I got the rosemary chicken hash which was a pretty good choice! I didn't even finish it all....i was stuffed! My server Martha was exceptional!
Big portions decent service but food was only ok tasting and pricy if had better for less
The food as always is great, But the kitchen sent out 1 part of our meal, before the rest. The server was fun. And the drinks refreshing!

I would pass on this place. 
The hash was not good by any stretch! They shouldn't name their place after a dish they don't know how to make!  

To critique the dish that I cannot remember the name of: The potato's in a hash are not mean to be so large they taste like a plain steamed potato by the time you're getting to the middle. They needed to be cut about a quarter of the size they were when they were served. I did end up having to cut them and eat them with the other foods on the plate and the flavor was very bland. The biscuit was very dry and hard. 

There was nothing special about what I ate at this place.

We were told that this was a good place for breakfast, we visited and was not disappointed, But what I didn't expect was the size of the portion. Wow, huge!!! 
Next time I'll remember. 
See ya when I return to Vegas

I ordered their french banana pecan french toast which was good. Their coffee is delicious. Now my wifes meal. They messed up on two of her items and her food was cold. My daughter ordered the oatmeal with us asking them to put all of the fruit garnishing on the side. They messed that up also. The waitress was nice but really messed up our order and served us cold food.

I've heard a lot about this place so I decided to give it a chance while I was in Vegas. We went in and waited about 15 min to be seated. Finally got in, and we were attended quickly. The menu was a bit overwhelming, but I was able to narrow down what I wanted. It was about noon so they were serving breakfast and brunch. I ordered biscuits and gravy, and my boyfriend ordered the hammered tenderloin pork sandwich. The portions are HUGE (I took a pic). I also ordered a mimosa and it was delish. It was good food, but nothing to boast about. Maybe I need to try something else but it can be overwhelming because it's a lot of food. It was worth the wait, and I would go back!

Visited the area again last week & ate here 3 times!  One night brought 10 other people who all loved it!  Chicken & waffles was the big favorite with the chicken pot pie coming in second place.   I loved the sage chicken Benedict.  Coffee is great,  service is excellent.
