Food was excellent.  Service was "eh typical"...would have been higher review if their "world famous: bloody mary had lived up to the reputation.  I put them in the top 5 WORST I've ever had the misfortune of imbibing. Wouldn't ever ordee it again and am warning others to fo the same

If you're hungry this is the place to eat.  Located in The Plaza Hotel and Casino in downtown in Las Vegas, which is where we were staying proved to be a convenient place to get some serious farm food!!  The HH bloody marys started off the morning perfectly.  Not too thick like some tend to be, but with just the right amount of heat.  Tasty!!  It was closer to lunch so we opted for burgers.  My buddy and I could've shared one, they're so huge!  I had the blue cheese with bacon and side of fries.  Two patties covered in their thick cut bacon and melted blue cheese stuffed into the huge patties that dwarfed the buns.  We're talking ginormous!!  It was delicious.  My friend and just had a discussion about goat cheese on a burger, and lo and behold, goat cheese and jalapeno!!!!!  It was a truly delicious way to start and end the day as took the other half back to our room to enjoy later!  This is not my first time here and everything is delicious! Don't get me started on the drink menu, but I had a watermelon kiwi lemonade.  YUM!

The building has an odd smell and it was covered up with a lot of air freshner, this was my biggest hold up. Then again, most places downtown do have that same smell, it wasn't repulsive...just enough to catch your attention. Never in my life have I had the 'WOW factor' when getting a food item out as I had with the chicken and waffles here. It wasn't just us, pretty much everyone was looking over as it was being served with the same reaction. The food was INCREDIBLE. Everything in this pile had distinct flavors yet blended together perfect. It was honestly unlike anything I've ever had and I'm itching to go back. My mother and I split it and were more than full. This isn't your standard meal! We went around 2pm and we got right in. Staff was friendly, nothing exceptional but no complaints. All food being served looked equally good.

One of my favorite places in Las Vegas. You'll leave full or with a to go box because of the portion sizes. I had Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict. It changed my life. It was that great. They have a Bacon Bloody Mary and it made my day better. Overall, this place will always get my money.

Walked all the way here from my hotel to figure out they had changed the open time of the restaurant. Really? Change it on your Yelp profile also and help out the customer. Love the food here but didn't get to eat any today because they weren't open.

A must stop for incredible, delicious, gourmet food.  I always stop here because the food is so good.  The portions are HUGE so unless your hungry, really hungry you might want to share.  This is a hidden jewel at the end of the strip.
My first chicken and waffles, but not my first time here. Ashley did a great job. Possibly best breakfast option in downtown Las Vegas.

I loved this place! I went here with my girlfriends Saturday around noon with an incredible hangover.  We wandered in the Plaza in search of the McDonalds, but since it was closed and we didn't think we'd make it much farther looking for food, we decided to stop in Hash House A Go Go.  Looking at the menu I thought the entrees looked a little pricey, but when we got our food I realized why.  The portions were gigantic.  Like some of the biggest I've ever gotten at a restaurant.  Which was awesome for my hangover.  I got this really incredible Watermelon Kiwi Lemonade that was both delicious and beatiful.  Our server was amazing.  She was so fun and really helped rally our tired hungover group.  She went out of her way to add litte touches that made our meal better.  One of the girls had a bloody mary that had food on tiny swords. After we broke one in a tiny sword fight, we asked for one more.  She brought enough for everyone in the group which was rather large.    I would definitely go back here next time I go to Fremont street.

Decent food. We arrived and the bartender wasn't there yet so I didn't get my s'mores mocha until halfway through my meal. The service was kind of lacking, but the portion sizes are decent and the food is as I would expect at a diner.

The basic: The potatoes didn't really have any flavor and the chopped onions sprinkled through them were raw (ew to raw onions), eggs were a little under easy and runny, the biscuit was hard and broke into pieces and there were so many chunks of peach/apricot that it was hard to spread the jelly...but the chicken sausage was pretty good. Very filling.

S'mores mocha: was a little bit disappointing! Didn't look like it does in the photo on the menu, and there was so much marshmallow it was hard to get to the mocha itself....

All in all... Not that great...

First time we had ever eaten here and had never even heard of the place, it was the restaurant at the hotel we were staying. We both ordered what we normally do at other restaurants and were stunned at the amount of food we were served!!!  I had a bloody mary which was the best I had ever had.  Our waiter, John, was very friendly and an excellent waiter.  He was so good and the experience was so positive that the next morning we ate there and asked to be seated in his station.  He even remembered us!!!!  We will making HHAGG a regular stop on all of our Vegas trips, even if we stay at a different hotel.
The food was quite good. The atmosphere was casual and our server was amazing.  Not the cheapest place to grab breakfast but good quality and big portions.

This place was packed! The atmosphere was fun,  the servers were friendly and attentive.  The food portions were huge and very very tasty! My husband had the chicken and waffles and I had sunny side up eggs and sausage all seasoned to perfection. We will definitely visit this place again.
Amazing Service, Realistic prices, Large Portions along with $5 mimosa's. Old Vegas is where the Turnup truly is

Stopped in Saturday morning said the wait would be 25 minutes but it was only about 10 for four people. Our waitress was friendly and quick to get our first drink order. Refills however were a little slow and had to be requested. Also our food order did not come out together. Portions were huge and the presentation was cool. A little pricey but nice to try once.
The portions are just stupid, nobody needs to eat that much.  The food is just average.  I would have thought with a slogan like "twisted farm food"  they would have had organic options.

I'm not sure where all these three star reviews are coming from, so I've got to give this place a 5 to balance things out. I sense that a lot of frustration may come from people who are coming in at rush hour (11-12:30) and frustrated with waiting. If you come in before 10:30 AM on the weekend, you should have no problem getting seated and served quickly. On to the food.

My wife and I ate here twice in one weekend. I had the machaca skillet one day and chorizo skillet the other. The machaca was very tasty with the beef being the star, but the chorizo scramble knocked it out of the park. The flavor in the chorizo is amazing. It's so good, you really have to be careful how much you eat because no one who's not an NFL lineman should be eating this whole plate. The portions are huge. Most people could eat half and be full. The biscuits and jellies are all fresh made and delicious as well. 

The cocktails are like everything else, large. My mom got a prosecco cocktail which came in a larger pint style glass. We ordered a nitro cold brew and I'm not sure if something was off but it wasn't very dark and tasted weak. We sent that back with no issues taking it off the bill.

We had a different server each day, but both of them were consummate PROS! They were attentive, very personable and hard working servers worthy of praise. 

They also have some decent happy hour promos from 4-7, but that's pretty standard for everywhere in Vegas.

A complete shit house.
This location took on the seedy atmosphere and aroma of the Plaza Hotel.

Indifferent employees milling around ignoring customers, junk piled on tables, floors and counters.

Looks like that TV show Hoarders or My Strange Addiction with the same weirdo people as employees.

Never greeted nor given menus after a long wait.
"Ahhh, ya know what ya want?" we eventually heard from the server who never gave us menus, and while on the fly, never stopping then texting and vanished.
No water, no silverware,,, the place a pig corral.

Dupars is just steps away in the Golden Gate is far superor with outstanding food and prompt service.

Hash House has to be the worst restaurant in Las Vegas.
A shithole with horrible attitudes.
Sad thing is, they know it and don't give a flying fuck.

But they are convinced an omelet garnished with blue pubic and red chest hairs will still bring in customers,,,, and they are secure in that thought.

Beware of fake shill 5 star YELP reviews from management, employees and
founders families.

The internet fix is in.

Stopped in for some breakfast/brunch on our first morning in Vegas. My friend had been before and said she was craving it - so we visited. 

My first impression was that the restaurant was dirty. The carpet looked old and the menus were a bit rough/worn out. It was also very HOT in the restaurant. Their air conditioning did not seem to be working properly. We had to ask to be moved to another section of the restaurant.

The prices were pretty standard for Vegas $10-20 for each meal. I ordered "The Basic" which came with sausage, toast, eggs and grits. All were pretty good. My sausage was very tender and flavorful. The grits were not bad, but not as good as we make them in Charleston!

My friend ordered the Farmer's Breakfast (?) which came with a MASSIVE pancake - one that we split. It was pretty good but I found it was tough to cut...a bit rubbery. Not fluffy.

I will say, our waitress was completely on her game - always quick with the refills, extra napkins, clearing plates and bringing the check. She was a star.

I'd probably visit again if I was nearby, but I would not make an effort/go out of my way for it.

Stopped in for breakfast while visiting Vegas and staying on Fremont Street. We stopped in relatively early (9 AM on a Saturday) and we were able to get a table without waiting.

Staff: nice, friendly, courteous, and timely
Restaurant: average ambiance, clean, spacious
Prices: pretty good relative to other Vegas restaurants
Portion size: very large; good place to split a meal

The food itself it fine. A friend had the HH original benedict, which was huge and covered with red pepper cream instead of hollandaise sauce. There was a lot going on with that plate. It was OK. My husband had the basic. Eggs were cooked just fine, and the bacon was pretty ordinary. The biscuit was pretty dry and definitely needs a good amount of butter and/or preserves. I had the sundried tomato, goat cheese, and basil egg scramble. It was a nice flavor, with lots of sundried tomatoes, but I didn't see or taste any basil. Accompanying crispy potatoes were pretty bland, and accompanying fruit was a single slice of orange and a single slice of melon (I was expecting a bit more).

That being said, I didn't feel like I was completely ripped off after eating here. The problem with Vegas restaurants is that the convenient, no name places in a hotel/casino lobby is that they're convenient but extremely overpriced and serve terrible, terrible food. Hash House prices are OK, and the quality and portion sizes are reasonable. I would go back.
A nice change of pace to get some HH food without waiting forever at their W Sahara location.  Same menu, same big portions, service could have been a little better, but it wasn't terrible.

Pros:
-Huge Portions
-Great Customer Service
-Delicious Hot Chocolates
- Overall Decent Prices

Cons:
-Food wasn't the greatest

I heard great things about this place and was hoping the food would be amazing, but it fell a bit flat for me. I went for breakfast with a group and got to try a little bit of everything, but I wasn't super impressed. I think I'll get lunch the next time I go.
They gave me a water and when I was about to take a sip, I saw a lipstick mark on my cup smh. NASTY

Big fan of this chain

Great food in large volumes
HORRIBLE service
Greeter needs basic training  (Like paying attention to the person your speaking to, or actually finishing sentences )
Other locations have much better service

I was not trilled to have to stay at the Plaza but one good thing was Hash House A Go Go is in the lobby. The breakfasts are fantastic. We had a family of 6 and we all enjoyed our selections. Large portions! But food and service was excellent. So if you're staying (or wake up) in downtown Vegas, this is a good place for breakfast.
Great staff great food and a must stop when in Vegas. The chicken and waffles is amazing. It's huge and can be shared. Service is great too
Come here hungry. The portion sizes are enormous. The prices are very reasonable. Service was quick and efficient.

This place is amazing! We were staying at The Plaza over Memorial Day weekend and decided to come here for breakfast. When we arrived we were told there was an hour wait but that they could text us when our table was ready so we went back to our room and waited. We received a text in about 40mins so not too bad of a wait. But trust me, it's definitely worth the wait! I ordered the waffles, one friend ordered the French toast, and my other friend ordered the fried chicken eggs Benedict. Our plates were GINORMOUS! We couldn't even finish. Definitely stop here if you're gonna be in old town Vegas.

I had Hash House A Go Go bookmarked for a while. This wasn't the location I bookmarked but it was near my current location. We went for brunch on a Saturday morning. It was a 30 minute wait (first come, first serve at bar). Luckily, we were able to get bar seats. I usually wait to be seated at a table but I was hungry so we took the open bar seats. I ordered banana French toast. The portion was huge (enough for 2 people IMO). Customer service at the bar left a lot to be desired. I understand why this location was rated a lot lower than other locations. Service at the bar definitely needed tuning up. My experience was "meh" in Yelp terms for brunch. I'm hoping this was just an off day but reading reviews it's unlikely.
Just an awesome Breakfast. Need to get that Banana muffin.The hash was a 10!!!!

Service was good. Wait was sorta long but that's because the place is very popular with people who are staying in the  hotel and others who are not. Overall the food was very good. Would definitely recommend trying this place.

This place is over hyped and over loved. 

We were seated fairly fast. But it seemed they gave us too small a table for 3 adults and one child. And knowing we had a toddler with us, it was not so kid friendly. Items all over the table, in reach of the high chair. 

My server was not so friendly, not so attentive and just wasn't on her game. But I told myself, it would be worth it. Everyone raves about this place. But I should have trusted my gut.If you start off with a poor server, then it can't get much better. 

The server kept rushing and rushing us. RUDE!!! So we ordered and per suggestion of the server, I ordered the Sage Fried Chicken Benedict. My husband ordered the Tractor Driver Combo. For my son, I ordered a grilled cheese off the kids meal.

Let's break it down.

Chicken Benedict = Dry, Bland and piled high with "mashed" potatoes. I quote "mashed" because right in the middle of my mashed potatoes were two whole potatoes that somehow were forgotten. The egg on my meal was dry and tasteless. They could have cooked it in the microwave because that is sure what it tasted like. The fried chicken was hard and dry as well. No seasoning to be found. 
The best part of my meal was the melted cheese all over the dish, in fact it was the only thing i found appetizing on my plate. The next best thing on my plate were the biscuits. They were pretty fresh and good. But they were not the "highlighted" or "featured" items on my dish. 

Grilled Cheese from kid's menu = Let's admit it. Most kids are picky. Their palletes are not developed and they love and enjoy simple things. So why in the heck is Hash House using thick cut, hearty bread on a kids grilled cheese i have no idea why. NOT KID FRIENDLY. So i asked the server if we could replace the fresh fruit that came with the grilled cheese with french fries. The answer was no and if I wanted fries, i would pay additional. Fine, whatever. I got to feed my son.

The fries came out and they were delicious. Hence why they get the one star. I ate more of the fries than I did my own meal.

Tractor Driver Combo = over cooked pancake, sausage was still pink in the middle. The eggs were okay. However severely over priced.

The whole time we were eating we kept smelling curry and could never quite figure out why. There is no curry on the menu from what I could see.

We will not return to Hash House A Go Go in the future ever. 

Just a friendly tip, none of the servers here seemed to helpful. They all milled around gossiping and talking.  One even told us we were in the thier way but we were seated at our table. I couldn't quite figure that one out.
A solid meal and drinks.  Get's a little busy and service slows down, but portions are huge and quality is good.
This place is a must whenever I visit Vegas. Massive portions of delicious food for reasonable prices. The Sage-friend chicken and waffles are my go-to dish.

First time in my life that I ever had red velvet pancakes and it was great. Had to make another trip. The customer service is great and I like that they can send you a text message when your table is available. Definitely worth the trip.

Great Food!!! Huge portions!!! No wait, same great food and service. 

Had the Kokomo Sandwich (meatloaf) and it was amazing, also had a basic breakfast -at only 8.95 it's a steal!!! The biscuits are TO DIE for!

Second time we have been to Hash House and they both have been delicious. Service was fast and nice. We enjoyed the fries chicken and waffles. So much food! I suggest splitting and getting a side salad to round out a shared meal.

I only felt the need to eat here twice. The first time, I was expecting a lot after hearing nothing but good things. I found the quality of the food to be lacking. I decided to chalk it up to a one-time occurrence, and went back the following week. What I figured out on my second trip is that this restaurant values quantity over quality. If you're looking for OK food, but plenty of leftovers, this is the place for you. Otherwise, I'd say your money is better spent elsewhere. I tend not to eat anything I take home in a doggy-bag, so I probably would only go back if a friend was visiting and really wanted to give it a go, and wanted to share the meal.

Ok, maybe 3 1/2 stars.  Breakfast is good but way overpriced.  Breakfast for two... Corned beef hash and eggs, a pancake, and two coffees... $33.  We have had dinner here, and it's a much better value.

I tried this place a couple of times because it's the only restaurant at Plaza Hotel in downtown and I was pleasantly surprised. The menu is pretty big and their portions are huge. If you stop by for a happy hour you will save a lot of money on drinks.
good service.  expensive for good-quality edibles rendered .  many choices on the menu.  even their spectacular big biscuts couldn't render a 4star
My expectations were high and the food was just so-so. Got the chicken and waffles.  Chicken was pretty good, waffles not so great.  Don't feel the need to revisit.
Love the biscuit and gravy. The fried chicken is very crispy, and the waffles with bacon are so yummy. Oh you should share, the portion is huge.
